story:
Help fund the 2014 U.S. Workplace Bullying Survey.

The most cited statistics worldwide about adult bullying in the workplace come from the Workplace Bullying Institute (WBI) national surveys. The media rely on WBI statistics. The story of workplace bullying is kept alive by the media. We haven't run a national scientific survey since 2010.


Why Only $6,000 ?

The goal is modest thanks to the heavily discounted rate our partner national pollster offers WBI (for comparison Gallup would charge $100,000 for the same). Only by using a pollster can we get a national sample of adult Americans. The $6,000 covers the fee to commission the study and to use credible news distribution services (e.g., PR Newswire) that alert national and local media about the new findings.

Sustaining the U.S. Workplace Bullying movement

WBI founders started the movement in mid-1997. WBI is the recognized source of all things involving bullying at work -- self-help for individuals, books, public outreach through over 1,100 media interviews. DVDs, and research. Statistics validate bullied individuals, convincing them they are not alone. In the past, the WBI survey found that 54 million Americans are directly affected. The epidemic prevalence rate in the past has kept awareness raising moving forward. It's time for a new survey to convince the public, including employers, about the seriousness of this health-harming problem. A new 2014 survey will be the benchmark for comparison with other nations, among employers and within unions. It will make news!!

Donor Incentives

Merchandise -- Buttons, DVDs & Books -- with contributions of $50 or more.

Sponsorship mention for contributions of $1,000 or more.

Tell Everyone

  • Point to this project to all friends
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Grateful for your help.

Gary Namie, PhD, Director, WBI

story:
Summary

Beginning in September, I will embark on a 6-month cultural exchange adventure with Canada World Youth (CWY). Together with 17 other young people, I will be spending 3 months in Victoriaville, Quebec, followed by an unimaginably exciting 3 months in Benin (West Africa). 

During the program, I will be contributing to community-driven development projects which focus on the environment. In addition, I will be developing my leadership skills, learning a new language (French), and building bridges between my own culture(s) and those of my host communities. You can read more about my program at http://canadaworldyouth.org/apply/youth-leaders-in-action/

All youth participants are expected to fundraise $3200 to go towards the cost of the program. I need your help to make this possible, so read on!

Why This Matters To Me

There is no better way of learning about yourself and the world around you than by hitting the road and meeting new people. As a newcomer to Canada, I look forward to learning more about this country and its people during the first part of my exchange, in particular the unique French culture of Quebec. I also hope to learn more about the environmental work being done here at home and overseas, and how I can contribute to it. 

Mostly, I hope to challenge myself to be a better person, and build human ties with people who are from different geographical, cultural, linguistic, and socioeconomic backgrounds than myself. To me, this is the absolute best way I can think of to spend what remains of my youth.

What I Need & What You Get

All youth volunteers are expected to fundraise $3200 to take part in this program, which represents a fraction of the overall cost of the program. In addition to mitigating the cost, the fundraising goal is intended to help spread the word about CWY to keep this amazing opportunity open for future generations. 

Although I will be contributing the majority of this amount out of my own savings, I would appreciate ALL THE HELP I can get from my friends, families, and generous acquaintances to help me reach the full fundraising amount! I have set a $1000 personal fundraising goal, and will contribute the rest myself.

All contributions are greatly appreciated, no matter how big or small. Everyone who contributes $10 or more will get a postcard from Benin! If you are able to contribute $25 or more, you will be rewarded with a personal, hand-drawn postcard from my adventures in Benin :)

*PERKS HAVE BEEN UPDATED SINCE I MADE THE VIDEO!!*

(On a less upbeat note, I will be unable to provide tax receipts so if this is usually important to you, please consider donating a smaller amount where this is less of a concern.)

Thank you in advance for all your help, friends!

=)

story:
WCNS Needs a New Home

Westville Community Nursery School opened 43 years ago in its current location on Harrison St. in the Westville area of New Haven.  Over the years, it's become the heart of an ever-expanding community of families whose children have benefited from its NAEYC accredited, play-based program filled with laughter and learning.  

Today, WCNS needs to move forward to a new home.  Why? 

  • The church that has been its home has an expanding community itself, and needs to reclaim the space where the school currently resides.  We have been asked to vacate by the end of the current school year. 
  • With change comes opportunity:  moving into a new location may allow WCNS to expand its offerings to new programs and educational experiences. 

WCNS' board has identified several potential new locations and is in negotiations to define whether they will fit the needs of the school and its students.   

This online initiative marks the beginning of our Relocation Campaign.  We hope that each of you can help plant the seeds for WCNS' next generation of joyful growth!


How can you help? 

We're reaching out to our community, including current and alumni families, to help us plant those seeds  ~ and we want to make sure that garden continues to grow in Westville!   

While there are limited choices in the neighborhood for commercial space that fulfills the needs of the school and its students, a few locations do stand out.  Our options are to either obtain a long-term lease or to purchase a space, then complete renovations. 

The funds for this campaign will be targeted toward our initial acquisition of the new space, which we estimate will require $10,000.    What would that cover? 

  • If we Lease:  First, Last and Security Deposit 
  • If we Purchase:  a large part of our down payment for the new property. 
After our new home has been secured, we'll keep everyone up to date on our progress!

 

What's in it for you?  

Check out our exciting perk levels on the right - there are some fun things over there!

  • Who wouldn't want to have some of the Last Batch of Syrup from the Sweetest Place on Earth? 
  • Want to finally jump on the mats with your whole family? 
  • No kitchen is complete without a calendar of WCNS kids' art.
.... and much more!

Please note that WCNS is a registered 501 (c)(3) non-profit organization, so your donation is Tax Deductible!

And great news... Because of its Flexible Funding program for Non-Profits: if we don't reach full funding on Indiegogo, we still receive our funding.


The Impact

Westville Community Nursery School has been part of the heart of Westville for 43 years, and we plan to be around at least the next four decades and beyond.  

  • We are committed to continuing on the tradition of Play-Based learning for children.
  • The community we've built is far larger than its walls.  
  • A new location will help us grow stronger branches, and build even deeper roots!


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:

  • Let us know if you have ideas for the new space or things you'd like to see in the new location, including programs that would help WCNS get out into the community. 
  • Get the word out and make some noise about WCNS!  Tell the local media, your neighbors and friends... 
  • Feel free to share this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook, Twitter, by email or use your Outside Voice to crow about it!

story:
Teamplars

We are a team of five master students from Delft’s University of Technology in the Netherlands, doing our Joint Master Program, as part of our academic formation. We come from different parts of the world with an open mind and desire to explore, design, inspire and play. Our team is Sandra (Romania), Katerina (Greece), Kiki (The Netherlands), Nicoló (Italy) and Christian (Colombia). We combine our professional and cultural experiences to forge meaningful concepts and turn them into feasible projects, with the aim to help improve the quality of life. 

We are excited to work in the Ghanaian context; the culture, the youth and everything that culture has to offer in order to inspire the team and the out coming ideas for the project

Design, inspire, play..

Our project deals with the impact of increasing urbanization on the play environments and habits of children in Accra. The goal of the project developed for Mmofra foundation is within the scope of stimulating, enhancing and maintaining the creativity of children in Ghana during their childhood. We want our project to help them recreate their playful universe enhancing and stimulating their creativity while strengthen their cultural heritage.

To successfully provide the best and feasible solution, a cultural research hast to be conducted on location (in Accra), where we will first spend one month. We will go back to Delft, and after the analysis we want to actually implement our results and ideas, for which we will go back to Accra for one more month. We want to use as much local and traditional as possible, and try to enhance children’s connection with the Ghanaian cultural heritage.

Mmofra foundation

Our design team will complete the project with the support of Mmofra foundation (See link), a non-profit organization based in Accra. Research will be conducted in the field, ideas and prototypes will be developed and finally validation processes will lead to the final product.

In one of the Ghana’s languages, Akan,  Mmofra means “children” , who are the main focus of the foundation. The main goal of the foundation is to enrich the cultural and intellectual lives of all the children in Ghana. Programs and products are developed in order to make children in Ghana aware of their cultural routs and become creative outside classroom.

The foundation was found by Efua T. Sutherland (1924-1996), a famous Ghanaian writer and educator. From the early 1950’s to the 1990’s she tried to develop education, literature, theater and film for children in Ghana.  From 1997, the foundation was open to children from all backgrounds and the dream of its founder has become real.

Nowadays, the contribution of the foundation includes workshops and exhibitions in visual arts literacy and public health initiatives, book and audio-visual development , active cultural recovery and reinforcement, cross-cultural exposure, and data collection.

One of the main projects developed by Mmofra foundation is the Playtime in Africa Initiative (See link).

Inspired by the book “Playtime in Africa” published in the early 60s by Efua T. Sutherland and Willis Bell, Mmofra foundation is in the process of creating an informal outdoor playground for the children of Accra. Playtime in Africa Initiative is a child-focused park in the heart of Accra’s Dzorwulu neighborhood which inspires creativity, fosters play and educates through hands-on discovery. 

Your support

As students and volunteers for this project, we want to get hands on the job and actually implement something that will help improve the quality of life for the Ghanaian youth. But this is an objective that brings along some serious financial challenges. As part of our design process, context research plays an important role, together with ideation, detailing, prototyping and implementation. In order to have valuable results and to validate the utility of our concepts, many of these phases will have to take place in the actual context of the product, in Accra, Ghana. This is why we will have to deal with various expenses, from travel expenses for the research, prototyping materials and hand labor.  We appreciate any help you can provide in order to make feasible the materialization of our project and support the youth in Ghana. We consider that it is never too late to have a start and a meaningful contribution.

We would like you to help us to positively influence the life of many kids in Ghana and take this journey with us.  We truly believe in the feasible outcomes of this project and we hope you will join us in this amazing adventure, by following our experiences trough our blog (See link).

Your donations will be of real helpfor the whole team to successfully conclude our project in Ghana.

Join us!

If you want to join us in our journey , follow us on our blog (See link).  Here you can see the progress of our project and be up to date.

Thank you for your support!

Teamplars

story:
Summary

Hi there. My name is Jeremy and I teach kindergarten. I've been in the elementary education field for close to 20 years now and I've also worked in an independent bookstore and for a major publisher. I have a passion for reading that I try to impart to my students. By publishing, I hope to reach more students.

I came up with the idea to publish some leveled readers (beginner books that teachers can use for instruction) when I realized, while there are some good books out there, they could be better. I want to create titles that combine a sense of humor, good graphic design, and subjects that are interesting to children. Additionally, they'll make use of current research on how children best learn to read.

With your help, I'll be able to publish 9 titles, featuring my energetic wheaten terrier Finn for comic relief. Three level A, three level B and three level C books have all been written and are in the process of having the finishing touches put on their design. (Check out the mock up of I See Dinosaurs at the top of your screen.) The next stop is the printers!

I'm so excited to see these titles in print and being used in classrooms and already have a second set of titles in mind. With your donation, I can make these books a reality.

What I Need & What You Get

I so appreciate your donation, no matter the size and want you to know that I intend to put it to good use. Here's a breakdown of the project.

  • $7,500 cost of having the books printed.
  • $500 cost of ISBNs, number codes used to identify individual titles.
  • $1,000 cost of website to market books.

If I exceed my goal, I'll work on adding more titles to the series. If I don't reach my goal, I'll look for other ways to raise funds and put them toward having the books printed. I'm determined to see this project through and publish high quality readers for kids.

To show my appreciation, I'm offering a series of perks at various levels. Check them out to the right.

The Impact

I'm starting small here with nine titles, but ultimately I want to create a rich library of books that teachers all across the US can use in their classroom. My hope is that teachers and students alike will enjoy the well designed and well written books, as a love of reading is fostered in classrooms everywhere.

I feel like I'm up to the task. I've written successful grants in the past, in the hopes of enriching the learning environment of my students. One grant found me creating hands-on colonial history kits, another helped raise funds for a raptor in Alaska and yet another grant helped put picture books and mentor readers in local school libraries. 

Other Ways You Can Help

While a monetary donation ultimately helps me to get these books printed, there are other things you can do to help me make this project happen. You can tell your friends, family and neighbors about my project through word of mouth, FaceBook and LinkedIn or by using the Indiegogo share tools. I really appreciate your help!

story:
Four Paws Farm is me, Amber Rissman farming my heart out! I have exhausted my current space and before I jump into a larger plot I want a larger education. 

I've been micro-farming for the past three years and have been accepted to The Organic Farm Training Program at Michigan State University. (http://www.msuorganicfarm.com/) For nine months I would be immersed in all aspects of small scale farming. The program covers everything from tractor maintenance to soil amendment to business plans and how to run a CSA. I think this is the best way for me to successfully move to full time farming. The Organic Farmer Training Program has a great track record of success, and many of it's graduates have applied skills learned to small farms of their own. 

So here's the catch: the program is full time Monday-Friday from March to November and it costs over $9,000!!! I can still work my job on the weekends but that wont cover much more than rent and health insurance and still leaves the tuition to pay. With help from contributors I can cover tuition and make this insane schedule a possibility!

Ten grand you say!!!

Tuition alone is nine thousand and then there is books/equipment/tools to cover. I'll be going seven days a week for nine months to try and keep up my end of the bargain and make this the best experience I can. I've tried to think of neat and unique perks as incentive to give. 

Small, Local, Sustainable. 

I feel passionately that small, local, sustainable and organic farming is the best way to feed and contribute to our communities. I know there is no time like the present to pursue my own small farm dreams. I view myself as a rational person and when I was questioned about why I would choose OFTP over just going to work on a farm, part of my response spoke to my inherent need to know more in order to start a successful farm of my own. In addition it is very important that I have as much hands on preparation as possible before embarking on this adventure. 

I hope to eventually run my own 5 acre farm, working one acre on a five year rotation. I want to primarily grow garlic, with additional small plots of other vegetables and flowers. I've made contacts in my local farm scene and from other farms I've seen I believe this is a workable plan.
story_txt: Four Paws Farm is me, Amber Rissman farming my heart out! I have exhausted my current space and before I jump into a larger plot I want a larger education. I've been micro-farming for the past three years and have been accepted to The Organic Farm Training Program at Michigan State University. (http://www.msuorganicfarm.com/) For nine months I would be immersed in all aspects of small scale farming. The program covers everything from tractor maintenance to soil amendment to business plans and how to run a CSA. I think this is the best way for me to successfully move to full time farming. The Organic Farmer Training Program has a great track record of success, and many of it's graduates have applied skills learned to small farms of their own. So here's the catch: the program is full time Monday-Friday from March to November and it costs over $9,000!!! I can still work my job on the weekends but that wont cover much more than rent and health insurance and still leaves the tuition to pay. With help from contributors I can cover tuition and make this insane schedule a possibility!Ten grand you say!!!Tuition alone is nine thousand and then there is books/equipment/tools to cover. I'll be going seven days a week for nine months to try and keep up my end of the bargain and make this the best experience I can. I've tried to think of neat and unique perks as incentive to give. Small, Local, Sustainable. I feel passionately that small, local, sustainable and organic farming is the best way to feed and contribute to our communities. I know there is no time like the present to pursue my own small farm dreams. I view myself as a rational person and when I was questioned about why I would choose OFTP over just going to work on a farm, part of my response spoke to my inherent need to know more in order to start a successful farm of my own. In addition it is very important that I have as much hands on preparation as possible before embarking on this adventure. I hope to eventually run my own 5 acre farm, working one acre on a five year rotation. I want to primarily grow garlic, with additional small plots of other vegetables and flowers. I've made contacts in my local farm scene and from other farms I've seen I believe this is a workable plan.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Arno Akobyan, I am a student at Loyola Law School in Los Angeles, a graduate of UC-Berkeley -- and I am very passionate about politics.

In particular, I would like to increase the access that regular, middle to lower income, working-class Americans have to their elected officials.

The way I propose to do this is by inviting elected officials / politicians to have dinner in the home a family whom they represent in their district. 

After all, elected officials have to have dinner every night, don't they? So why not have dinner in the homes of the people whom they've been elected to serve and represent?

The main point of this idea is to break bread with the people we put into office, to have a nice meal, and possibly discuss a few things on our mind. 
 
Politicians keep saying that they know the difficult times we, the normal folk, are going through -- but when that statement comes from a multi-million politician -- it tends to sound disingenuous.
 
They don't worry about constantly increasing gas prices, student loan bills that are as big as a mortgage, or simply where their next meal is coming from.
 
So why not have a meal and talk about the issues that we really care about, and what our leaders are doing to help us?
 
The ultimate goal is to have each politician pledge, once a week / month (whatever their schedule permits) to have dinner with a regular family?
 
It's not too much to ask if just ONE night a week they would devote to having dinner with an average voter in their district, is it? I didn't think so!
 
With your contribution, you can help start a project that will put the "local" back into local politics, empower normal, working-class people and possibly increase voter registration and turnout.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I have already registered the domain -- www.DinnerWithConstitutents.com -- but I need a few people with technical expertise to help me get it off the ground.

I am asking for $10,000 so I can register my cause as a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization and get it off the ground.

(LegalZoom charges $500-$700 just to complete the non-profit paperwork)

I also need to hire a team of computer developers to create the website, database, and logistics of vetting and connecting regular people with their elected representatives.

I would also need someone to help advertise and spread the word to communities across the country -- both so they can register to have dinner with their local politicians, as well as to encourage the politicans themselves to make the pledge to join our cause and have dinner every week/month with their constituents.

 

In exchange for your help -- I promise that there will be a page on the DinnerWithConstituents.com website where your names will be prominently displayed. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please contact your local politicians and tell them about this idea, and ask them to make the pledge.

Also: if anyone has contacts with Bill O'reilly, Rachel Maddow, or any other political commentator(s) (doesn't have to be tv--radio and print are just as good), please tell them about Dinner With Constituents, and ask them to spread the word.

 

Thanks everyone!

story:
Hello, my name is Haley and I have been selected to advance to the national finals for the America's US Miss Scholarship Program where I will compete for thousands of dollars in college scholarships to further my education.

National finalists must excel in the areas of academics, volunteer service, and self confidence.

By getting the chance to compete as a national finalist I will take home lifelong skills by participating in the national scholarship program. I can further learn how to effectively speak on stage in front of a live audience, as well as learning how to dress and conduct myself in a private one-on-one interview.

I am a take-charge kind of girl and that is why I have decided to follow in my family's footsteps and join the Navy and go to the Naval Academy, so I can take charge of my future and serve my country. I am currently active in my local Girl Scout chapter and have been for 8 years. I have also been a cheerleader for 6 years and am an excellent student. I support  Relay for Life and Make a Wish Foundation. I have also volunteered at Military Assistance Mission (MAM), and various areas around my home town in Queen Creek, Arizona.

As a potential sponsor, you are asked to participate financially in the America's US Miss Scholarship Program to help recognize the "outstanding young women of the United States." Your financial investment today in in the leaders of tomorrow. Any amount of financial support would greatly be appreciated. This will help cover the cost of the Programs fees, transportation, and hotel costs. The sponsor fee is tax deductible.

I want to thank you in advance for your sponsorship to help me achieve my goal as a national finalists in the America's US Miss Scholarship Program.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Our History

The Coalition for Positive Sexuality (CPS) is a grassroots volunteer group formed in 1992 by high school and college students, teachers, and activists in Chicago. The AIDS epidemic, queer-bashing, and concerns about teen pregnancy sparked our desire to provide teens with accurate, positive, empowering sexuality and safe-sex information. We worked with teenagers to create a sex education booklet that covered birth control, STDs, safe-sex practices, HIV/AIDS, pregnancy prevention, abortion rights, and sexual identity without preaching abstinence or denying sexual pleasure. We wanted to contribute to a teen peer culture that would eventually make sexual ignorance unacceptable.


Our Impact

CPS started distributing our self-published sex education booklet, Just Say Yes, to Chicago public high school students by standing in front of their schools at 7am with a box of booklets and hundreds of latex condoms. This action forced the schools, and Chicago, to readdress the needs of their teenaged students and the deficiencies in the "Family Life" Curriculum being offered. In 1995 CPS launched our website, www.positive.org, making Just Say Yes available to teens around the world. The site includes a forum for teens to ask questions and provide peer-education in response. CPS doesn’t just want to provide teens with information, we want to inspire teens to educate themselves and each other, feel confident in their sexual choices, and demand comprehensive sex education in their schools. At present, CPS has distributed over 50,000 Just Say Yes booklets and 6,000 Girl Germs posters. Our website averages 70,000 hits a day (yes, a day) from 7,000 visitors.


What We Need & What You Get

The CPS website (http://www.positive.org) is in desperate need of redesign. The factual information is continuously updated to reflect changes in medicine, diagnosis, new treatments, and changing legislation concerning teens and access to health care. However, the site needs to be redesigned for easier access to the most sought after information (could I be pregnant? is the most common question visitors ask) and to look hip and cool! Gotta stay current and cutting-edge on the internet!

Your donation enables CPS to hire a young, aspiring web designer to work as a summer intern with our all-volunteer staff on updating the look of our popular website. We plan to organize a focus group of teens and young college students to review the existing website and provide feedback on what works and what needs changed. A contemporary looking website is vital to our teen-appeal, and a user-friendly interface makes it easier for users to find the information they need.

In return for your donation, CPS sends you a copy of our Just Say Yes booklet. For larger donations you receive a Girl Germs poster, empowering teen girls to take control of their sexuality and demand respect.


Other Ways You Can Help

Encourage the schools in your community to provide comprehensive sex education that empowers teens to make informed decisions about their sexual health. Spread the word about the CPS website, Just Say Yes booklets, and this campaign to raise funds. If you're a well-informed young person that want's to help teens make smart sexual health decisions, log onto our "Let's Talk"  forum and reply to some of their questions! If you know of some really well-designed websites (no matter what the subject matter), send us a link so we can be inspired (positive[at]positive.org).

story:
Did you know that elephants communicates with their feet ?

That females hyenas have a penis-looking clitoris ?

 This project is made for curious peoples who love nature, and who are eager to learn fun facts about it.
This project is made for photography lovers.
 
This project is a meeting between cool science and photography, available in English / et en Français !
 

Short Summary

The aim of the project is to answer a set of cool (sometimes even weird) questions about savanna's wildlife, from the field, in the form of a scientific photoblog updated twice a month. Every chapter will come with illustrative and creative pictures taken in the savanna. You will receive every chapter either in your email or printed !
The final product is a book about wildlife wonders and curiosities.

From march to october, this project will show you that The Lion's King producers didn't tell you everything there is to know about savanna’s wildlife.

 

My story

I am a young researcher in behavioural ecology, working on zebras and giraffes. My own research project focuses on mammal's behaviour, but i am very interested in photojournalism as well. I will spent 7 months in the savanna of the Hwange National Park (Zimbabwe) to conduct the fieldwork of my scientific research, and will be surrounded almost every day by iconics animals such as lions, kudus and elephants. I found myself so lucky that i wanted to share it all around. You can make it possible !

 

Some examples of questions that will be answered :

- Melodramatic cheetahs prefer to hunt by moonlight... a question of competition ?

- What is the origin of the huge clitoris of hyenas ?

- Why Honey Badger, why so much badassery ?

- How can we prevent savannas to disappear by studying avalanches ?

- Elephants communicate with sismic waves with their feet. How, why ?


- Ok, we're in 2012 now. Do we know what is the function of zebra stripes ?

- The idea that Darwin didn't have : giraffes neck as a sexual attribute.

 

and more ! ...

- the grandma's importance in elephants : why is it important to maintain good relationships with you granny ?
- What is the sexual deception that suffers female antelope ?
- Is there dark lions (as Scar in the Lion King) ?
- What's the link between handclapping and antelopes feeding ?

 

What i need !

The money that you will invest will be used to buy a good photo gear ; tripod, lens, DSLR body.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the funk ! Share it to anyone of your friends who could be interested !
 
---
Video editing by Bim (the dancing lion) : http://hou-bim.blogspot.fr/

story:
Current amount raised including offline donations: $17,683!

If our campaign brings in $28,000, Wynton Marsalis, jazz musician and Artistic Director of Jazz at Lincoln Center, and Mark Patterson, Vice Chair of Jazz at Lincoln Center, have offered to contribute the remaining $10,000 to bring us to our total goal of $38,000!

We need your help to get there. Please give as much as you are able and inspired -- and help us spread the word. 

“Knowing that people are helping just a poor little school in a big place, it makes me feel important.” -12-year-old Sebastian, a member of the band at I.S. 171 (Listen at http://cbsloc.al/UEy2Zr)

More details on our fundraising goal and how we plan to reach it are below.

 

The Band's Story:

At I.S. 171, a middle school in the low-income Cypress Hills/East New York, Brooklyn neighborhood, there is no music education during the school day. For many years, the school’s instruments, dusty and forgotten, were locked up in a closet.

Three years ago, a local nonprofit stepped in to bring the joy of music back: they started up the school band in their afterschool program. It was a huge success!

About 35 students each year learned to play instruments and read music. At the band concerts, the kids and families beamed with pride. Students moved from beginner to advanced band and some earned scholarships to join the jazz program at the Brooklyn Conservatory of Music! That’s an all-but-unheard-of opportunity in the Cypress Hills/East New York neighborhood.

But the school band’s funding ran out at the end of the 2011-2012 school year. Right now, kids are back in school, but there is no band. The instruments are once again locked up in a closet.

After the band’s final concert 2011, one 12-year-old boy asked, “Do I have to give my trombone back?” The staff said yes, and explained that the instruments belonged to the school. The boy handed over his trombone but, as he did, he burst into tears. His family, like almost all families at IS 171, does not have enough money to rent an instrument.

This band was changing lives. We need to save it.

The nonprofit, Cypress Hills Local Development Corporation (CHLDC), and the music instructors from the Brooklyn Queens Conservatory of Music are ready to restart the I.S. 171 band as soon as the funds are raised – as early as mid-to-late October -- so the kids get as much time to practice as possible. But they can’t do it without your help.

Every kid should have the chance to play an instrument in school, but the kids at I.S. 171 won’t – unless we make it happen. So let's do it. Let's save the middle school band!

 

The Budget

The total cost of running that band for one school year is $38,000. Here’s what that covers:

Program Director:                $3,200
Site Director:                      $2,315
Music Instructors*:              $29,750

Administrative Overhead:     $2,735

TOTAL:                              $38,000

*Includes 20 weeks of instruction, two days per week, for 6 teachers (to be able to provide lessons for all the instruments during afterschool time), as well as time for concerts and special events

"But guys, your page is only for $15,000!"

That's true. We're hoping the page will exceed its goal, but we're also doing other things to raise additional funds:

  • If our campaign brings in $28,000, Wynton Marsalis and Mark Patterson have offered to contribute the remaining $10,000 to bring us to our goal of $38,000!

  • The Talent Show Brand Variety Show hosted a show on October 2, starring comedians Hannibal Buress, Eugene Mirman, Michael Showalter, Dave Hill, and more, and generously donated all proceeds to our campaign. The show raised more than $2,500! A follow-up video will be released soon, starring the comedians from the show, to draw more attention to the cause!
  • We have raised more than $5,000 in additional offline donations, as well. Please give online if you are able -- we all love to watch the campaign progress -- but if you strongly prefer to give offline, contact chelseaa@cypresshills.org for information on where to mail a check.

Even if we don’t reach the total goal, donations will still bring as much music as possible back to the kids in Cypress Hills -- we will restructure the program based on the amount raised (i.e. offer a band, but for fewer weeks of the year).

Please note: because CHLDC is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, donations are tax deductible. We will send you a receipt for tax purposes.

And for those who are wondering, “If we raise the funds for 2012-2013, so what? Won’t the band be in the same pickle next year?” Good news:

We will be applying for a NYS government grant for the 2013-2014 school year. It’s the grant that supported the band the last 3 years, but there’s no funding available this year because of government cuts. This is devastating for the kids who would otherwise be continuing in band and those who'd hoped to join.

Your gift will directly support music education for middle school students in Cypress Hills/East New York. LET’S DO THIS!

 

The Impact and Other Ways to Help

If you played an instrument or did anything creative when you were in middle school (and probably even if you didn’t), you probably know what a big deal this is. Sometimes band is the only thing to look forward to.

But even if you loved middle school, the school band has an impact far beyond having fun and learning to read notes – it helps kids build confidence, work as a team, learn to really listen, develop a new passion, and appreciate jazz, classical music, and the arts a whole lot more.

Any amount you can give will help bring the music program back to the kids at I.S. 171.

And please, please, whether you can donate or not, spread the word about the campaign! Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, whatever other newfangled network you’re using these days – let people know they can be part of saving the music for some amazing kids.

 

Other information: Cypress Hills Local Development Corporation is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization. Our mailing address is 625 Jamaica Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11208. We are committed to financial transparency: additional information is on our website.

*Includes 20 weeks of instruction, two days per week, for 6 teachers (to be able to provide lessons for all the instruments during afterschool time), as well as time for concerts and special events
"But guys, your page is only for $15,000!"
That's true. We're hoping the page will exceed its goal, but we're also doing other things to raise additional funds:


If our campaign brings in $28,000, Wynton Marsalis and Mark Patterson have offered to contribute the remaining $10,000 to bring us to our goal of $38,000!


The Talent Show Brand Variety Show hosted a show on October 2, starring comedians Hannibal Buress, Eugene Mirman, Michael Showalter, Dave Hill, and more, and generously donated all proceeds to our campaign. The show raised more than $2,500! A follow-up video will be released soon, starring the comedians from the show, to draw more attention to the cause!


We have raised more than $5,000 in additional offline donations, as well. Please give online if you are able -- we all love to watch the campaign progress -- but if you strongly prefer to give offline, contact chelseaa@cypresshills.org for information on where to mail a check.

Even if we don’t reach the total goal, donations will still bring as much music as possible back to the kids in Cypress Hills -- we will restructure the program based on the amount raised (i.e. offer a band, but for fewer weeks of the year).
Please note: because CHLDC is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, donations are tax deductible. We will send you a receipt for tax purposes.
And for those who are wondering, “If we raise the funds for 2012-2013, so what? Won’t the band be in the same pickle next year?” Good news:
We will be applying for a NYS government grant for the 2013-2014 school year. It’s the grant that supported the band the last 3 years, but there’s no funding available this year because of government cuts. This is devastating for the kids who would otherwise be continuing in band and those who'd hoped to join.Your gift will directly support music education for middle school students in Cypress Hills/East New York. LET’S DO THIS!
 


The Impact and Other Ways to Help
If you played an instrument or did anything creative when you were in middle school (and probably even if you didn’t), you probably know what a big deal this is. Sometimes band is the only thing to look forward to.
But even if you loved middle school, the school band has an impact far beyond having fun and learning to read notes – it helps kids build confidence, work as a team, learn to really listen, develop a new passion, and appreciate jazz, classical music, and the arts a whole lot more.
Any amount you can give will help bring the music program back to the kids at I.S. 171.
And please, please, whether you can donate or not, spread the word about the campaign! Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, whatever other newfangled network you’re using these days – let people know they can be part of saving the music for some amazing kids.
 
Other information: Cypress Hills Local Development Corporation is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization. Our mailing address is 625 Jamaica Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11208. We are committed to financial transparency: additional information is on our website.

story:
This is about the future of creativity and innovation, a David v Goliath flashpoint that we hope to rally your support around.

We are a tiny company called Languages Out There (LOT) and publish the world's first social media English course called English Out There (EOT).

EOT works with Facebook and Skype and can transform the English speaking ability of long-term frustrated learners. It is inexpensive for the students but can help teachers to start their own businesses.

We have developed our content over 11 years and have only made a tiny profit in the last two years. It has not been at all easy.

Over ALMOST THREE YEARS we provided privileged and confidential information about our unique content to Oxford University Press (OUP) because they said they were interested in our content. 

In March of this year they wrote to us,

"we do not feel that LOT offers the type of materials that we could bring within our catalogue, whether in relation to the current offering or our future plans." 

JUST FIVE MONTHS LATER they launched a new five level English course book series with the words,

"Network is the first course to use social networking to help students succeed in English."

The first three English teachers we sent the OUP product link (just the link, nothing else), said this:

 

 

Click HERE for our long video with detailed timeline and evidence.

Click HERE for the OUP video of Kristin Sherman (author) talking about teaching English using social media.

This is from OUP's published Code of Conduct document on their website:

There's obviously something wrong at the biggest academic publisher in the world. OUP were recently banned by the World Bank for bribery in Kenya and paid £4.2m to settle a corruption case with the UK Serious Fraud Office (SFO).

 

What We Need

  • We have consulted a top IP lawyer who has looked at the evidence and says we have good claims for passing off and copyright infringement. We now need to prepare our case properly.
  • In the first instance OUP will probably play the 'they can't afford to lose' card and ask us to put a large amount of money into court (this is how it works!).
  • So, we would lose just on the basis of being small and having no money.
  • We need at least £20,000 ($30,000) to start with and we need to know we have your support, because a case like this could cost £50-60,000 in total.
  • If we don't hit our target we will use the money to go as far as we can and then fund some programming work on our website that will help us to make money by giving our content away (we have another innovative idea!).
  • None of your money will be wasted, we promise.

What You Get

  • $10 gets you OR ANYONE YOU PROVIDE THE EMAIL ADDRESS OF a 60 hour English Out There self-study social media English course (download of PDFs and MP3s). You can see the courses here
  • $40 gets you or someone you want to give them to the complete set of self-study courses (6 levels, 360 hours of study) OR one 60 hour level of teacher's English Out There (with a licence for one teacher to use commercially)
  • $200 gets you or a teacher you provide the email address of the complete set of OO English Out There materials for teaching one-to-one and online in virtual classrooms and with online social networks like Facebook.com and social learning management systems like Edmodo.com
  • $1000 gets you a complete set of teacher's materials with a licence for five teachers to use commercially PLUS a live webinar and Q&A for as many people as you like with creator and founder of EOT, Jason West
  • $3000 gets your company or school a full set of teacher's materials, a licence for up to 15 teachers to use them commercially forever and a live webinar PLUS unlimited online support and online elearning consultancy for a month from EOT creator and founder Jason West

Why Is This Important

EOT is the only English course in the world that is proven (we have audio before and after case studies with randomly selected students) to help learners go from beginner to intermediate speakers in weeks.

Probably the world's most famous expert on language acquisition and English teaching and learning, listened to this before and after audio case study with Jane, a typical 27 year old Chinese learner and commented,

"Remarkable...a major contribution to what we know works." Professor Stephen Krashen (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_Krashen)

In the right hands and at the right price EOT is capable of helping millions of English learners to improve their life prospects. A recent British Council report showed that being able to speak English comfortably increases someone's lifetime earnings by a minimum of 25%.

This is why OUP showed so much interest in EOT. The global ELT market is estimated to be worth over $60bn per year.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate or buy some EOT content perks here don't worry, you can still sign our e-petition to the Vice-Chancellor of Oxford University in which we demand that he pays for an independent legal inquiry that will provide a full and public explanation of the behaviour of #OUPELT's employees.

And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools here too!

Thanks for reading this, watching the video and giving us your support in any way that you can.

Together we can win this battle of David and Goliath and strike a big blow for small creators and companies all over the world who fear exactly the same happening to their hard work and creative lifeblood.

Thank You.

story: Thanks for your support.
story_txt: Thanks for your support.

story:
Who we are

Center for Africa Missions is an outreach organization that focuses on reaching the underprivileged in communities and villages across Ghana through education and community development programs, i.e., building schools and digging water wells in remote villages, as well as feeding programs and establishing after-school activities at our main Center to prevent children being left to themselves.

 

What we need

Our biggest need right now is to purchase a bus to enable us to bring in at risk children to our main Center in Prampram. These children are compromised in society because they’re not in school and mainly left alone from a very young age while parents are at work or simply absent.

 

Why we need it

When children are left to themselves the consequences are usually negative such as teenage pregnancy, stealing and drinking, only to mention a few. If we had a bus, we could transport some of these children to our Center where they receive basic education (reading and writing), participate in extra-curricular activities (soccer, volleyball, choreograph dance, piano and computer training) and character building skills (Ethics and social responsibility). We are doing this already but using our personal cars and the result is disastrous because no child wants to be left behind and we end up with around 20 children crammed into one car! So a bus would be a great asset to correct this situation.

 

How much we need and our perks

We need $ 27,000 to purchase an adequate bus (at least 33 seats). Wondering why this amount? Vehicles tend to be more expensive in Africa due to the shipping and duty fees charged at the port of entry, as most of the cars are imported. Our goal also covers for Indiegogo fees charged on the overall amount.

We have fun rewards for your donations ranging from naming a seat on the bus, to hand-painted postcards from the children (with photo), handmade bead-bracelets and the top reward for the highest donation: naming the bus itself!

Our transparency policy regarding your donations:

If we don’t reach our goal, we will still go for a bus but most likely settle for a smaller, less expensive vehicle that does not seat as many children as we would like.

If we go above and beyond, we get our bus plus a smaller 12 seater van to bring in even more children and also serve as a means of transportation for our team when travelling to our various projects in several communities.

 

Previous projects

  1. We are a small outreach Mission and many of our projects have been successful so far. For example, we have established two primary schools. Deveme Community School located in the Eastern Region of Ghana has been running for eight years now. It started with 50 kids under a mango tree and nowadays has 300 students. The first class will be writing their BECE exams at the end of this academic year.
  2. Akorlikope Community School is located in the Volta Region of Ghana and was completed early this year. They currently have 60 students. Also we put a well to bring potable water to the people in this community.
  3. We have our Annual Youth Summer Camp in Keta which had a very successful first edition in 2012 with more than 500 youth registered. Definitely to be repeated this August.  And the bus we are appealing for in this project will also help us bring kids to the Summer Camp.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to share this project with your network of contacts because we really need to get as much exposure as possible to make this dream come true. Indiegogo makes it really easy to share via several social media outlets.

If you have any other questions please do not hesitate to ask us. We are right here to answer you.

To get the latest news on this project please visit our Blog at www.ridetoeducationghana.blogspot.com

story:
A stationery to define the future -- Dreamer stylus. No matter you use paper or iPad, a whole new stylus is going to bring you to the future road of inspiration.

Elegance and future

NEWS!

The UDO Studio and VEARI, an Chinese professional stylus brand have reached cooperation, jointly completed DREAMER project, and prepare to expose it to the global market.

Therefore, even if INDIEGOGO financing target cannot be reached, you can get your favorite DREAMER. It is brilliant !

Think, stylus in the future

Writing and drawing are the nature of the human. Either on the paper or on iPad, you need a pen to release your inspiration. What will a pen in the future be? Pen+ stylus may be one of the answers.

To design the stationery in the future is a great dream to us. We bring it to Kickstarter, hoping to share our dream with more people. Therefore, we call the stylus the DREAMER.

Use button to switch your inspiration

The most important feature of the DREAMER is its button. The design idea is from Apple Inc, as the button on iPad, iPhone, and iPod. It is unique, futuristic. By pushing the button, you switch between two modes of the stylus, therefore switch your inspiration of creation.

Unibody design
On iPad / Paper

Elegance of the metal

Just as Apple is proud of its unibody production technology, DREAMER's body is made from an entire piece of aerospace grade aluminium using CNC precise machine tool. Therefore, it looks elegant and attractive.

Unibody design. Aluminum Dreamer Prototype

 

Different feel

With more subtle changes, your hand will feel the differences such as the location of button to use flexibly, diameter of stylus to reduce mis-operation, unique design of the cone-shape Stylus Tip to improve the accuracy of writing, also the proper weight and smooth curve. Everything is just perfect. No matter how you use it, the experience is enjoyable.

Classic Metal DREAMER: Silver/ Black anodized aerospace grade aluminium

Compatible All Parker Style G2 Size Refills & All Fisher Style Spacepen Refills

*Refill-Freindly, Work with 45+ high-quality refills

*Ballpen refills, Extra-Fine, Gel, Soft ink, Soft Roll, Space...

*G2 refills is easy to buy, and many Colors for your choices. 

 Anniversary Edition Classic Metal Dreamer: Brown anodized aerospace grade aluminium. Numerical laser etching:001-100 Plus your name!

Better carry

Different from the traditional stylus carry we add a strap on DREAMER. It is made of high quality rubber, connected with Smart Cover, so that the DREAMER and iPad are connected as well. Other than Smart Cover, other brands of iPad covers are compatible with DREAMER, which is easy to carry and fashionable.

on iPad & iPad mini: Classic DREAMER Strap Suitable for iPad's cover, mini DREAMER Strap Suitable for iPad mini's cover.

MINI DREAMER to share more

There is a great design that we hope to share with more people. We also designed a whole new MINI DREAMER made of eletroconductive plastic material. It is lighter, more colorful, yet not as expensive. It comes with beautiful strap, fitting with iPad as well as iPad mini.

Colourful Mini DREAMER: Blue/ green/ purple/ yellow/ black

Compatible all Mini D-1 Size Refills

*35+ high-quality D1 refills, can match your Mini DREAMER.
*D1 have Ballpen refills, Gel, Soft ink, Stylus, Highlighter...
*D1 refills is easy to buy, and many Colors for your choices.

DREAMER's Stylus Tip

* Senior conductive rubber, smooth and fluent
* Pure copper inner core, conductivity stronger
* Precision exhaust structure, the best writing

 

DREAMER helps DREAMER

Everyone who promotes ideas on Indigogo is a DREAMER. Everyone who reviews the program is also a DREAMER. It is your support and help that make those dreams come true.

On our project DREAMER, our team has been developed for more than seven months, and put in a big amount of money in development, now we have a few prototypes. We need around 20,000 US dollars for later development. This amount is going to be used for a few detail adjustments, development of product mould, and the deposit for volume production in the factory.

As you know, just as Apple set its production factory in China, where you can find great manufacturing production ability. We have competent business partners in China. We will work together and you will be surprised to see our final product.

Glory takes time. We are confident to set our goal -- to get a whole new DREAMER on the very beginning of the March 2013. Please spread the words and share with your friends.

Thanks.


size

 

Reward

NEWS!

The UDO Studio and VEARI, an Chinese professional stylus brand have reached cooperation, jointly completed DREAMER project, and prepare to expose it to the global market.

Therefore, even if INDIEGOGO financing target cannot be reached, you can get your favorite DREAMER. It is brilliant !

 

You can pick color, from our options.

* Classic Metal DREAMER: Silver/ Black anodized aluminium.
* Anniversary Classic Metal Dreamer: Brown anodized  aluminium.
* Colourful Mini DREAMER: Blue/ green/ purple/ yellow/ black.

 What color is your choice? You can leave a message in "Comments"

* Strap for Classic DREAMER: Brown only.
* Strap for mini DREAMER: the same color with pen. 
 

 

Anonymous Contributor: Very thoughtful design!

Margaret: EXCITING, This is the pen I want.

Andrew Smyk: The versatility of the pen refills is a great feature.

______________________________________________________

Thank you for helping make this transition easier.

______________________________________________________

Please "like" this project on Facebook by clicking on the link above to spread the word as this project depends on each and everyone of you.  If you use Twitter or other, please share the word and help support this project. Thank you! Sharing is caring. :)

 

About us

www.udostyle.com

Simon Brown and Wei Du created UDO studio focusing on interesting design and research, specialized in consumer digital product area.
Simon is a designer as well as an web editor. He always has good ideas.
Wei is an expert in manufacturing. She always turns Simon's ideas into real products.
UDO studio have one thing in common -- All big fans of Apple!

The main challenge is how we make a satisfactory product from a design concept. It requires collaboration with factories. Fortunately, one of our team members is quite familiar with China. She has 10 years of experience in manufacturing industry. She already has a fixed industry partner, who has great experience in manufacturing, especially in metal machining. It is one of the world-leading factories, which guarantees to provide best quality products in set schedule.

Our team is full of passion in project DREAMER. We already finished the prototype development, and already have a few samples. Now it needs some tuning. First of all, our unique button design and some internal structures need to be adjusted to ensure the optimal user experience. Next, we need to adjust the stylus tip，including wear resistance, smoothness, hardness, to guarantee the best writing result.

It is more important to contact all supporters, since it helps us solve unexpected problems. We will contact supporters and reply all comments and messages as soon as possible.

We are confident because we are DREAMERS.

* Classic Metal DREAMER: Silver/ Black anodized aluminium.
* Anniversary Classic Metal Dreamer: Brown anodized  aluminium.
* Colourful Mini DREAMER: Blue/ green/ purple/ yellow/ black.
 What color is your choice? You can leave a message in "Comments"

* Strap for Classic DREAMER: Brown only.
* Strap for mini DREAMER: the same color with pen. 
 





 
Anonymous Contributor: Very thoughtful design!
Margaret: EXCITING, This is the pen I want.
Andrew Smyk: The versatility of the pen refills is a great feature.

______________________________________________________

Thank you for helping make this transition easier.
______________________________________________________
Please "like" this project on Facebook by clicking on the link above to spread the word as this project depends on each and everyone of you.  If you use Twitter or other, please share the word and help support this project. Thank you! Sharing is caring. :)
 



About us

www.udostyle.com
Simon Brown and Wei Du created UDO studio focusing on interesting design and research, specialized in consumer digital product area.Simon is a designer as well as an web editor. He always has good ideas.Wei is an expert in manufacturing. She always turns Simon's ideas into real products.UDO studio have one thing in common -- All big fans of Apple!
The main challenge is how we make a satisfactory product from a design concept. It requires collaboration with factories. Fortunately, one of our team members is quite familiar with China. She has 10 years of experience in manufacturing industry. She already has a fixed industry partner, who has great experience in manufacturing, especially in metal machining. It is one of the world-leading factories, which guarantees to provide best quality products in set schedule.
Our team is full of passion in project DREAMER. We already finished the prototype development, and already have a few samples. Now it needs some tuning. First of all, our unique button design and some internal structures need to be adjusted to ensure the optimal user experience. Next, we need to adjust the stylus tip，including wear resistance, smoothness, hardness, to guarantee the best writing result.
It is more important to contact all supporters, since it helps us solve unexpected problems. We will contact supporters and reply all comments and messages as soon as possible.
We are confident because we are DREAMERS.

story:
Short Summary

I started the Peace and Prosperity Alliance in 2005 after losing my brother on the 1988 terrorist bombing of Pan Am flight 103 out of a desire to overcome evil with good by helping the people of Libya.

The Libyan revolution began the process of transformation of Libya to a democratic society. But the process has not been without challenges. With the assassination of the US Ambassador and multiple terrorist attacks, there is a significant need for more quality training in how to resolve conflicts more effectively.

In order to do that we need funds for translation of the training materials into the arabic language and for the upcoming training in the fall.

You have the opportunity to make a lasting impact in stabilizing the region by investing in this training project.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • $4500 dollars needed for translation of materials and the upcoming training program in Libya.
  • For your valuable investment in this project, you will receive perks such as copies of books and audio training series.

The Impact

Hundred of leaders in Benghazi, Libya have already been trained in this life impacting program.

Countless more will have the opportunity to take advantage of this program with your investment.

Other Ways You Can Help

Let your friends and colleagues know about this project by sharing on Twitter and Facebook.

story:
Hi my name is MaloRee Allen and I am a third year veterinary student, attending St. George's University of Veterinary Medicine. 

This summer, I'll be embarking on a once in a life time opportunity: joining just 80 veterinary students from around the globe in South Africa to further our careers in veterinary medicine.

A little about me...

I will be finishing up my 3rd year from St. George's University this year, doing my clinical rotations in the US, then I plan on becoming the most kick ass vet I can!

SYMCO presents a chance to get hands on experience in one of the most diverse wildlife locations on the planet. The lessons I learn in those short few weeks will enhance my vetinary prowress for the rest of my life!

This is a HUGE opportunity that very few professionals in my field ever see so attending and maximizing what I learn on the trip could really give me a leg up.

Destination: South Africa

As you can imagine, flights to and from the other side of the globe don't come cheap, nor does the symposium itself:

Every cent that comes in will go towards paying for my travel expenses and the SYMCO attendance fee. I have managed to cover some costs through various school grants and donations but every bit to help an indebted college student counts!

As a gift to everyone who helps, I promise to bring you back a little piece of South Africa! Check out the various donation tiers to see what goodies could be in store for you.

The Impact

Feel free to send me a mesage if you want to hear more about the trip and some of the amazing things I'll be getting to do! 

Any support counts and will be helping me on my way to becoming a vertinarian that can make significant changes in the lives of animals all around the globe. 

HUGS!!!

story:
Short Summary

When James Lubo Mijak and Ngor Kur Mayol came to the United States from a refugee camp, they wanted to work on their education and find their path, and then find a way to give back to their home, which in 2011 became the world's newest country, South Sudan. Over the last few years, Lubo and Ngor worked together and created the organization Raising Sudan. With help from friends, Raising Sudan connected with Mothering Across Continents and raised enough money for two schools. I have known Lubo since he came to the US and settled in Charlotte. This summer, I am joining with the Raising Sudan project to begin the process of offering teacher training and support to the school in Nyarweng, Lubo's home village. 

Our Project

During our trip this summer, our team hopes to:

  • Travel to Nyarweng to see the new school and access needs;
  • Share some basic resources and provide teacher training for new teachers
  • Make contacts with other schools in South Sudan--provide some teacher training and pursues connections for Nyarweng

The Impact

In an area of the world desperate for education, we hope to begin a relationship of support to offer training, resources, and supplies to the schools in South Sudan. 

  • Offering new teachers instruction in everything from basics, like classroom management, to the most up-to-date pedagogy, including learning styles and multiple intelligences
  • Helping teachers find materials and use the materials they have in creative ways
  • Supporting teachers in their relationships with parents and the community 

Education Leads To Opportunity and Peace

South Sudan's people are excited about having their own country, but the country itself remains fragile. Education will provide the foundation that the country needs to continue moving forward.

story:
Summary

I've been working the same types of unfulfilling jobs for over ten years.  I am unhappy and dissatisfied.  I need a drastic change.  I want a career that means something, that supports me emotionally, physically, and mentally.  Something challenging, something that lets me make a difference, while still leaving me time to persue other hobbies and interests, which include crafting, animal care, travelling, and singing in my band.

Unfortunately, I am not eligible for any financial aid or student loans in order to make my dream of education a reality.  This is where you come in!

What I Need & What You Get

I want to go to school to become a real estate appraiser.  The entire cost of this three-level program is about $3000.  The first set of classes are all day, Monday-Friday, for a month straight.  This means I'll need to take a leave from my current job yet still have something to live on while I'm in school.

If you help me achieve my goal, you will not only get a letter of thanks and gratitude, but a personal, homemade gift from me.  Each craft, recipe, or meal will be made with love.

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference in my immediate as well as long-term future.  I will finally be on my way to a real, meaningful career.  Every little bit helps!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, never fear; you can still help me considerably by just spreading the word!  Use the share tools on this page, get my message out on social networking sites, tell your friends and family, let them know this is all for a good cause and a good person.  You will still be very much appreciated.  Thank you to everyone who has made it this far, you will be rewarded in good karma!

story:
Short Summary

The Tingathe Initiative is a community based organization operating out of Chinsapo – a peri-urban area on the outskirts of Lilongwe, Malawi. Chinsapo is one of the most severely affected communities in the country for life expectancy, infant mortality, prevalence of HIV/AIDS, illiteracy, unemployment, and violent crime. Tingathe was born as a means of providing accessible education for people of all ages who would otherwise be left without option.

With over 250 members, Tingathe’s central membership consists of approximately 150 secondary school students, 60 primary school students, and a local women's forum of 40 women who have partnered with us in order to help deliver educational services. Tingathe strongly believes in a subsidiary-oriented approach wherein those who will be most affected by decisions have a proportional role in the decision-making process.

The Initiative's four core areas of focus are: basic primary and secondary education, vocational skills training for those hoping to enter the workforce, HIV/AIDS awareness and support, and environmental sustainability programs. In addition to these current projects, Tingathe holds enormous potential to develop new endeavors in response to dynamic community needs.

Tingathe has both a Malawian and Canadian team. We believe that the project needs to be very much Malawian run with any decisions made based directly on the needs and wants of the community in Chinsapo. At the moment we are registered as a Community-Youth Organization in Malawi and are looking to become registered as an NGO in Malawi as well. In Canada we are running fundraisers to raise money to be able to sustain and expand Tingathe, and in August two of our Canadian team members will be going to Chinsapo to participate on the ground level and initiate new programs like a community garden, the expansion of our classrooms, support groups for HIV-affected individuals as well as sports, music and arts programs.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What We Need:

The $3500 that we're hoping to raise through Indiegogo is going to be a huge contribution towards our larger budget of $10,000. This money will be put towards:

-at least one textbook for all grades in the Malawian curriculum

-learning supplies such as pens and paper for the students, blackboards and chalk for the teachers

-a computer for the center for both administrative purposes and to teach basic vocational skills to young adults

-a small salary to recompense our Malawian volunteer teachers

-building supplies to help expand our center

-sports equipment to start up extra curricular sports leagues

-solar panels to bring consistent electricity to our center and the community

-gardening tools and seeds for our community garden initiative to provide HIV+ individuals with proper nutrition and to encourage agricultural sustainability practices

 

If we don't reach our entire goal our focus will be on our educational center and the supplies (textbooks, pens and papers) needed to sustain and expand it. Our other priority will be recompensing our volunteer teachers who have been generously giving time that they cannot afford to be donating. 

 

What You Get:

Any size donation - We will put your name under a big Thank You on the partners page of our website. 

$25 - We will personally call you to thank you. 

$50- In addition to the above, we will send you a thank you card with current photos of the center. 

$100- In addition to the above, you will be invited to a Thank You dinner held by the Tingathe Initiative in mid-June. 

$250- In addition to the above, you will be invited to the Launch-Off party for some of our Canadian members going to Malawi in mid-August. 

 

The Impact

Your impact will be huge! The Tingathe Initiative is attempting to provide students and young people with services that would otherwise be unavailable to them. Because Chinsapo is technically an "area" of Lilongwe (and the poorest one at that), there are no educational services set up there. However, it is not close enough to Lilongwe to allow potential students to commute to school and back in a day in time to also work which they must do to help support their families.

The Tingathe Initiative offers daily classes from 6-9am directly in Chinsapo to allow students to access education within their community. This accomodates the necessity of their working schedule and allows them to continue living with their families rather than having to leave to Lilongwe for education.  

Our organization is small: we are all volunteers and recieve no salary, we have no administrative costs and we know, care about and work directly with the students this is impacting. That means your impact can be enormous! You give directly to the cause for education, with tangible and transparent results. 

Our team has a diverse background of experiences in international development. Chris Cameron, our founding member, has worked on the ground in Chinsapo as the programs coordinator for the Rainbow Home-Based Care Center which provides support to HIV-affected individuals and families. Samantha Lacourse, one of our managers, has also worked in Malawi for the World University Services of Canada as the program assistant for their Student Refugee Program. Lewis Grandinetti is a founder of the International Literacy Foundation and has set up libraries in Kenya, Pakistan and Hamilton, Ontario. My own experience is in ensuring the sustainability of non-profit organizations which I have done as the executive director of the Inuvik Homeless Shelter in the Northwest Territories. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that not everyone can make a monetary donation but there are tons of ways you can help us out!

Help spread awareness about the Tingathe Initiative. Like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter and use the Sharetool on Indiegogo to bring us to the attention of your friends!

We are looking to hold fundraisers. If you have a fundraising idea or a venue that we can use for a fundraiser please don't be shy to get in touch with us!

We're looking for information and knowledge. If you have experience, say setting up a community garden, that you think we may benefit from please share with us!

We're looking for used book and sports equipment to send to Malawi and also help in covering shipping costs.

Finally, we're looking to meet likeminded people interested in making a difference in the world. Interested in traveling? Come volunteer for us in Malawi! There are tons of ways you can make a difference tailored to your interests. Want to make an impact closer to home? Get in touch with your ideas and see how you can help out our Canadian team!

story:
Hi all,

As you know, Dr. Larry Witmer is a phenomenal paleontologist. He's given so much to paleo. Perhaps it's time for us to give something back. Larry is "strongly protanomolous," which means he's badly colorblind. In paleo, the ability to see color is essential for visualizing reconstructed soft-tissues, something that is near and dear to Larry's work. Larry is a trooper, and he's accommodated for his colorblindness thus far. However, having color vision would enrich his life and his work. There are special glasses (http://enchroma.com/) that can correct colorblindness, but they're expensive ($650, including fees). Please consider making a contribution today to help Larry see in full color! It would make a wonderful Christmas present!

 Thanks!

Ashley Morhardt 

P.S. Larry has no clue about this campaign, but he will soon! :)
