story:
Summary

I have been working with families affected by Autism and other learning differences since 2000 in the panhandle and in South Florida.  I currently work privately with 6 families and have been with most of my families for 4+ years.  The therapy services that I provide are Applied Behavior Analysis, Verbal Behavior, life skills training, academic tutoring, and parent training.  With the astounding increase in Autism Spectrum Disorder cases over the last 6 years (rates have doubled to 1 in 50 children), there is an increased demand for therapeutic services and early intervention.  Not wanting to compromise the quality of the services which I provide, I keep my case load small and am loyal to my current families.  In some cases, there are children who would greatly benefit from additional therapies or an increase in therapy hours but it can be cost prohibitive. In addition to several types of therapies, families also pay for extracurricular activites, extra medical costs (in some cases), and specialized child care.  Families soon find that a large majority of their family income is spent on these types of therapeutic, educational, and medical costs.  With this campaign, I am going to raise enough money to provide, for 2 families, 3 additional hours of therapy per week for 1 year and $2000 cash for each family to use towards educational, medical, or therapy costs.  If I exceed my goal, I will seek out a new family who cannot afford services and will offer the overage to them in the form of a scholarship.

If the contributions meet the goal ($20,000), the actual amount received will be $18,100 from indiegogo.com after the fees are collected by the site.  $4000 will be given as cash gifts to the families which leaves $7,100 for therapy expenses (materials, etc.).  This is about $48.00 per hour, 20% less than the actual cost.  The remaining 20% will be contributed by me.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to do this, the goal is $20,000.  This amount will cover 3 hours of therapy per week, per family, and $2000 cash for each family to spend on medical, therapeutic or educational expenses for their child.  If the goal is not met, the scholarship will be scaled down to provide as much assistance as possible.  For your contribution, you will receive an update about the progress of the scholarship program (hopefully I can continue it beyond 1 year and for different families in need) and will have my undying gratitude for paying it forward and helping me to pay it forward.

If the contributions meet the goal ($20,000), the actual amount received will be $18,100 from indiegogo.com after the fees are collected by the site.  $4000 will be given as cash gifts to the families which leaves $7,100 for therapy expenses (materials, etc.).  This is about $48.00 per hour, 20% less than the actual cost.  The remaining 20% will be contributed by me.

 
The Impact

Your contribution will help children build their vocabulary, social skills, and independence.  It will give families another piece of the puzzle.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any size contribution is greatly appreciated.  A penny here and a penny there... it all adds up to a bunch of pennies and a whole lot more support and help for families in our community.  It takes a village to raise a child and these types of projects, albeit small,  help to make our village a little bit more tightly knit.  If you are not able to contribute monetarily, please forward this to everyone you know, ask them to help out, and encourage educators and therapists in your community to start their own campaigns.  There are so many resources out there... unfortunately they are distributed so unevenly.  There is is no reason why any child should go without the help that they need to be successful and independent.  Together, we can see to it that every child is taken care of. Thank you in advance.

PLEASE SEE MY BLOG. COPY AND PASTE THE LINK IN YOUR BROWSER: http://marloplanas90.wordpress.com/2013/03/30/m...

** The above picture is not a picture of children that I work with or of children with Autism.  I used it because I have the rights to it.**
story_txt:
Summary
I have been working with families affected by Autism and other learning differences since 2000 in the panhandle and in South Florida.  I currently work privately with 6 families and have been with most of my families for 4+ years.  The therapy services that I provide are Applied Behavior Analysis, Verbal Behavior, life skills training, academic tutoring, and parent training.  With the astounding increase in Autism Spectrum Disorder cases over the last 6 years (rates have doubled to 1 in 50 children), there is an increased demand for therapeutic services and early intervention.  Not wanting to compromise the quality of the services which I provide, I keep my case load small and am loyal to my current families.  In some cases, there are children who would greatly benefit from additional therapies or an increase in therapy hours but it can be cost prohibitive. In addition to several types of therapies, families also pay for extracurricular activites, extra medical costs (in some cases), and specialized child care.  Families soon find that a large majority of their family income is spent on these types of therapeutic, educational, and medical costs.  With this campaign, I am going to raise enough money to provide, for 2 families, 3 additional hours of therapy per week for 1 year and $2000 cash for each family to use towards educational, medical, or therapy costs.  If I exceed my goal, I will seek out a new family who cannot afford services and will offer the overage to them in the form of a scholarship.
If the contributions meet the goal ($20,000), the actual amount received will be $18,100 from indiegogo.com after the fees are collected by the site.  $4000 will be given as cash gifts to the families which leaves $7,100 for therapy expenses (materials, etc.).  This is about $48.00 per hour, 20% less than the actual cost.  The remaining 20% will be contributed by me.


What We Need & What You Get
In order to do this, the goal is $20,000.  This amount will cover 3 hours of therapy per week, per family, and $2000 cash for each family to spend on medical, therapeutic or educational expenses for their child.  If the goal is not met, the scholarship will be scaled down to provide as much assistance as possible.  For your contribution, you will receive an update about the progress of the scholarship program (hopefully I can continue it beyond 1 year and for different families in need) and will have my undying gratitude for paying it forward and helping me to pay it forward.

If the contributions meet the goal ($20,000), the actual amount received will be $18,100 from indiegogo.com after the fees are collected by the site.  $4000 will be given as cash gifts to the families which leaves $7,100 for therapy expenses (materials, etc.).  This is about $48.00 per hour, 20% less than the actual cost.  The remaining 20% will be contributed by me.

 
The Impact


Your contribution will help children build their vocabulary, social skills, and independence.  It will give families another piece of the puzzle.


Other Ways You Can Help
Any size contribution is greatly appreciated.  A penny here and a penny there... it all adds up to a bunch of pennies and a whole lot more support and help for families in our community.  It takes a village to raise a child and these types of projects, albeit small,  help to make our village a little bit more tightly knit.  If you are not able to contribute monetarily, please forward this to everyone you know, ask them to help out, and encourage educators and therapists in your community to start their own campaigns.  There are so many resources out there... unfortunately they are distributed so unevenly.  There is is no reason why any child should go without the help that they need to be successful and independent.  Together, we can see to it that every child is taken care of. Thank you in advance.
PLEASE SEE MY BLOG. COPY AND PASTE THE LINK IN YOUR BROWSER: http://marloplanas90.wordpress.com/2013/03/30/m...
** The above picture is not a picture of children that I work with or of children with Autism.  I used it because I have the rights to it.**

story:
The Pitch

Rideau High School is located in Ottawa, Ontario. We are a school of 550 students. We have a very diverse population with students from all over the world. We have the largest ELD/ESL population in our school board and the largest Aboriginal population. This diversity is our strength and many of our students use the word "family" to describe how they feel about Rideau.

We are not a wealthy school. The average household income at Rideau is just over $39,000. In the city of Ottawa, the average is $96,000. Many of our students do not have the resources to purchase their own laptops or tablets to use in school. It is also a challenge to fundraise to purchase technology resources. Our computers are getting old and students are often frustrated with the lack of speed and computing power available to them.

We want to give our students access to technology that will help them in school and prepare them for work and future studies.

What We Need

We would like to purchase a class set of 30 Chrome Books and a charging cart. The Chrome Books would be available in the library for students to sign out for the day or for teachers to sign out for their class.

Each Chrome Book costs $300 and the charging cart is about $2000. 

The Impact

Chrome Books are fast and reliable. They start up in seconds and connect students to a plethora of web based apps that sync with their Google Apps accounts. Student work is created and saved to the cloud. They can access their work from any device, any where, any time.

Our current computers, in some cases, take over 10 minutes to start up and open a browser. They regularly crash and frustrate students and staff alike. Access to chrome books will help students become more familiar with technology that will become an essential part of their future education and careers.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a donation right now, please pass this on to anyone you know. If you are familiar with Rideau, you know how great the community is. Take the opportunity to sing the praises of the school to your friends and family and spread the word of our fundraising campaign. 

Every little bit helps.

story:
*** Our Indiegogo campaign has reached the deadline.  However, we are still accepting donations.  Donations can be mailed to: 103 Leadership Building, Attn. International Service Teams, Kansas State University, Manhattan, Ks.  66506.  Checks can be made out to "Kansas State University" with "Team Uganda" in the memo line.***

 

Who We Are 

We are a team of 6 undergraduate students and 1 doctoral candidate at Kansas State University.  Near the end of last semester we began to put together a once in a lifetime opportunity to expand upon our education by spending a summer in Uganda conducting hands-on research and performing community service as a member of the International Service Teams (IST) at Kansas State University.

IST is a service-learning program of interdisciplinary teams of KSU students who serve in communities around the world.  Over the past 21 years, IST has served in communities in Brazil, Kenya, Mexico, and South Africa, through the development of service-learning initiatives based on specific community needs.  

While service learning has historically been a portion of the IST program, we are the first team to incorporate a research component to our trip.  This is not only a benefit to our team, but it is also pushing the expansion of the IST program to provide future Kansas State students real-world research experience.  

Joseph Kony/LRA

For nearly 20 years Joseph Kony and the Lord's Resistence Army terrorized Uganda.  In 2006, attacks within Uganda ended and the country has since seen nearly 7 years of peace.  At the height of the attacks, it is estimated that nearly 90% of northern Ugandans were internally displaced.  Those who had the resources and ability fled, many to Kampala in the south.  However, an estimated 1.8 million people were not as fortunate and called an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) camp home.  

Since 2007 the victims of the LRA's reign of terror have been returning home to pick up the pieces and rebuild their lives.  Despite the end of attrocities inside of Uganda nearly 6 years prior, the Kony 2012 movement drew tremendous newfound attention to the region.  This attention has led to numerous developments on the national and international level.  Billions of dollars in aid and military soldiers have found their way into east Africa to track down Joseph Kony and bring him to justice.

During a recent trip to Uganda to set up contacts at Makerere University, M-Lisada orphanage, and Bead for Life, we learned that many Ugandans do not view the influx of attention favorably.  In fact, many people we talked to were confused as to why this conflict, years after attrocities have ended, is the one that has garnered attention.  

When we began delving deeper into their views, we learned that the campaign is largely missing historical and cultural context.  We also learned (after listening to hours of life-stories) that everyone has a story.  

What is their story?  How do they view the recent influx of attention?  What do they see as important in their daily lives?  Where do they think international attention should be drawn?  

Ugandans are not "voiceless" (as they are often portrayed).  But, in many cases, they do lack ability to be heard.  We hope to provide that conduit. 

 

What We Need 

A 10 week trip to Uganda for 7 college students is not cheap.  For airfare, in country transportation, housing, and basic necessities, we are in search of about $28,000 ($4,000 per person).    

In addition to asking family and friends, we have applied for several grants/scholarships and have planned numerous fundraising events.

Without funding, there are some in our group who may not be able to travel.  That is why we are here at Indiegogo asking for your support.  :) 

In sociology we like to use the phrase, "become an outsider, within."  In that spirit, we will actually live with families who have been directly and indirectly impacted by LRA activities.  This does two things.  First, it brings funds and support to some of the poorest families in the world rather than a hotel.  Second, it keeps our cost as low as possible.

We are not in this to make a profit.  If we are fortunate enough to fully fund our travel, all additional money will be donated to M-Lisada orphanage in Kampala, Uganda and Bead for Life.

www.mlisada.com

www.beadforlife.org 

  

The Impact

We are currently enrolled in a Leadership Studies course where we are learning about international travel, Ugandan history, language skills, and advanced research methods.  This summer we will travel to Uganda and put these newly learned skills to use by conducting qualitative interviews with families who have been directly impacted by the Lord’s Resistance Army (a rebel group who abducted children nearly a decade ago).  For this portion of the project we are partnering with Makerere University (the largest and oldest University in Uganda) and Bead for Life, a poverty alleviation group that teaches highly impoverished women how to make beads, and shea butter products, provides entrepreneurial training, and in some cases provides housing.  

 

In addition, we will spend about half of the summer partnering with M-Lisada orphanage.  M-Lisada helps orphans by providing them with a place to stay, helping them become educated, and teaching them life skills.  While there we will assist with planting trees, painting their house, teaching the children, aiding the administration, and working with the children as they spend time cleaning the nearby community (Katwe slum).

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Help spread the word about our campaign!  http://igg.me/at/Uganda2013/x/2429087

Media and Events

Follow us on Facebook:  http://www.facebook.com/pages/Uganda-Research-Team-2013/213970592077378

Bluestem Bistro May 4th event: http://www.facebook.com/events/496740953714753/...

K-State Collegian: http://www.kstatecollegian.com/2013/04/18/k-state-students-plan-trip-to-uganda-to-learn-about-kony/

Manhattan Mercury: http://themercury.com/articles/six-k-state-students-are-bound-for-uganda

Listen to our radio interview:  http://1350kman.com/infocus-31813/#

Kansas City Star: http://pressreleases.kcstar.com/release/message...

And tell your friends!

story:
"The Gay Icon Classics of the World" is a collection of gay love stories from different cultures. The book is written for a general audience. The stories help us understand that all cultures have gay love stories.

I have committed myself to help start a reading group for young gay men in Canada. However, I would like to be fair and also donate this wonderful book, in French, to  form gay reading groups in French speaking Canada too.

So, won't you help me raise the money needed for the translation and set up costs of the book?

For a donation of $25.00, you will receive a copy of "The Gay Icon Classics Of The World II". This is a GOOD DEAL because the book cost $18.00 on Amazon and with shipping, it would be $25.00.

For a donation of $100 or higher, you will receive a coupon from Icon Empire Press (www.gaybooks.info) for the a free copy of any book in their catalog. Although Icon Empire Press has gay fiction...THERE IS ONE BOOK THAT ALL AUDIENCES WILL LOVE, it's "1001 Internet Jokes Gay - Lesbian Edition". So, they have something for everyone at the $100 donation level!

Icon Empire Press has also offered matching book donations, for every book that I donate in my campaign in Canada, They will donate a book to a gay youth group in the United States. So, please support this wonderful company!

Please help me teach young adults both straight and gay that gay love exists in all cultures.

Thank you.

story:
We believe young people should have power and control over their own education.

It's that simple.

Our goal is to open a new learning environment in central Massachusetts based on the model of North Star.

Like North Star, in Hadley, MA, our center will be a small, safe, welcoming community of learners: individuals moving forward in unique directions at a pace that is right for them.  MAP the Pursuit is not a school.  Rather, it is an alternative to school.

See the link to North Star below.

And help spread the word by clicking Share, Tweet or +1 on our site right now.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

NOTE: 

We have received unexpected support & our start up costs are now much lower than we thought when we started the campaign. This means we only need to raise $1,100.00 for seed money.  We can't change our goal with Indiegogo, so we will be successful when we reach 25% of our original goal.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Our mission is to demonstrate that self-directed learning is more efficient and produces superior results than traditional education for most students.

______________________________________________________________________

What is MAP the Pursuit? 

MAP stands for Mastery, Autonomy and Purpose.  These are the three ingredients for intrinsic motivation.  

  • Mastery = the process of getting better at a skill every time you practice it.
  • Autonomy = the power and freedom to make decisions about your  own life.
  • Purpose = the connection of what you do to something meaningful in your life.

When students exercise Mastery, Autonomy and Purpose, they learn on their own without being forced or bribed to do it.  Self-directed learning is not pie-in-the-sky optimism. It is based on scientific understandings of neurology and psychology and practical, real world experience by leaders such as Sugata Mitra, Daniel Pink, Charles Tsai, Mihaly Csikszentmihaly, Peter Gray, Elliot Washor, Dennis Littky, John Taylor Gatto and many others.   People all over the world are creating learning environments based on the science of human motivation.  We want one, too, for our children and our community.

And the “Pursuit” part of our name?  It’s the pursuit of happiness, of course.  With MAP, any young person can pursue his or her own happiness. 

......

Outcomes: Self-directed Learners Go to College… And Beyond

There is clear evidence that self-directed learners of all stripes, including homeschoolers, unschoolers, and others go on to college where they do well and then move on to meaningful, fulfilling lives:

  • Colleges everywhere have routes to admission for self-directed learners, and at many universities, these students are sought after.  In our area alone, 6 of the 11 universities that belong to the Colleges of Worcester Consortium, including Worcester Polytechnic Institute, provide on their websites admission information for self-directed learners, and 4 of the others responded positively to email inquiries about applications from all kinds of self-directed learners.
  • The admissions page on Massachusetts Institute of Technology’s website states, “MIT has a long history of admitting homeschooled students, and these students are successful and vibrant members of our community."
  • In a report written by Peter Gray, PhD, of Boston College, on a survey of adults who had been self-directed learners, 83% enrolled in higher education, including graduate school beyond a 4 year degree.  The “participants reported remarkably little difficulty academically in college… Students who had never previously been in a classroom or read a textbook found themselves getting straight A’s and earning honors, both in community college courses and in bachelor’s programs…”  A link to the first of 4 reports on this survey by Peter Gray, PhD, of Boston College, can be found in our Comments section.
  • As far back as 1994, the Wall Street Journal reported, “Many colleges now routinely accept homeschooled students, who typically present portfolios of their work instead of transcripts. Each year Harvard University takes up to 10 applicants who have had some homeschooling.
  • Organizations all over North America that help young people find alternatives to traditional schooling report that every student they serve who wants to go to college is admitted to one. Some of these, like the Sudbury Valley School and North Star (www.northstarteens.org)  have been working with young people for decades.
  • According to the National Center for Educational Statistics, the number of self-directed students with parents with Bachelor’s or higher degrees rose from 403,000 in 1999 to 688,000 in 2011, an increase of 170% in 12 years.  This indicates an increasing interest in alternatives to traditional school among the most highly educated parents in the country.
  • The benefits of self-directed learning seem to go beyond academic benefits.  A graduate thesis by Roya J. Dedeaux at California State University, Long Beach, based on a study of 1,052 participants, concludes “The results indicated that several common assumptions about the homeschool culture are inaccurate, that homeschoolers as a group are well below clinical cut-off scores for anxiety and depression…”

What We Need Start-up Funds For:

We have found new partners who are going to help us complete the legal requirements for filing for a non-profit status with the IRS!  This is going to save us $2,000.00, which means that MORE of your donation can go directly toward helping young people take control of their own education!  

1) $3,000.00 $1,000.00 will cover costs associated with starting the non-profit corporation. We want to do this right. We've researched different ways to complete these legal requirements, and there are less expensive options, but they offer little to no personal advising from an expert who specializes in starting non-profit corporations. We want to MAP the Pursuit right so that it lasts. We believe hiring a reputable, experienced lawyer is the way to do it. If anyone with legal expertise in starting 501(3)'s and who believes in what we're doing can contribute pro bono help, we'd be forever grateful. 

2. $188 covers Indiegogo's very reasonable 4% fees. 

3. $3,500 (or any amount above or below that) will go directly to funding self-directed learning experiences designed entirely by and for young people. 


Let's Challenge the Status Quo

Our long term plans also include campaigns to challenge the injustice of traditional schooling.  We believe we can help young people achieve academic success at HALF the cost that traditional public schools pay per student per year.  Districts in Massachusetts spend between $10,000 and $30,000 per pupil per year.  We can begin helping young people achieve their potential for about $6,000 per learner per year.  We have a long-term financial strategy that will challenge the establishment to rethink how self-directed learning can actually SAVE cities and towns hundreds of thousands of dollars a year.  This Indiegogo campaign is the first step in our long-term strategy.  We will build our organization one student at a time.  We will start by offering funding to students who design their own self-directed learning projects. We will use their success to market our organization and increase our fundraising strategy through grants and donations.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Visit North Star's website to see what kids in central Massachusetts can have:

Self-directed Learning for Teens 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Post a link to our Indiegogo site on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Vine or other social networking site.  Get the word out and make some noise about MAP the Pursuit.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Email everyone you know a link to our Indiegogo campaign.
  • If you can offer us any expertise in law, fundraising, real estate, board management, technology or finance -- or if you are interested in finding out more about self-directed learning for you, your family or your friends -- email us at mapthepursuit@gmail.com.

There is clear evidence that
self-directed learners of all stripes, including homeschoolers, unschoolers,
and others go on to college where they do well and then move on to meaningful,
fulfilling lives:



Colleges everywhere have routes to
admission for self-directed learners, and at many universities, these students
are sought after.  In our area alone, 6
of the 11 universities that belong to the Colleges of Worcester Consortium, including
Worcester Polytechnic Institute, provide on their websites admission information
for self-directed learners, and 4 of the others responded positively to email
inquiries about applications from all kinds of self-directed learners.


The admissions page on Massachusetts Institute of Technology’s
website states, “MIT has a long history of admitting homeschooled students,
and these students are successful and vibrant members of our community."


In a report written by Peter Gray, PhD, of
Boston College, on a survey of adults
who had been self-directed learners, 83% enrolled in higher education,
including graduate school beyond a 4 year degree.  The “participants reported remarkably little
difficulty academically in college… Students who had never previously been in a classroom or read a
textbook found themselves getting straight A’s and earning honors, both in
community college courses and in bachelor’s programs…”  A link to
the first of 4 reports on this survey by Peter Gray, PhD, of Boston College,
can be found in our Comments section.


As far back as 1994, the Wall Street
Journal reported, “Many colleges now routinely accept homeschooled students, who
typically present portfolios of their work instead of transcripts. Each year Harvard
University takes up to 10 applicants who have had some
homeschooling.


Organizations all over North America that
help young people find alternatives to traditional schooling report that every student
they serve who wants to go to college is admitted to one. Some of these, like the
Sudbury Valley School and North Star (www.northstarteens.org)
 have been working with young people for
decades.


According to the National Center for
Educational Statistics, the number of self-directed students with parents with
Bachelor’s or higher degrees rose from 403,000 in 1999 to 688,000 in 2011, an
increase of 170% in 12 years.  This
indicates an increasing interest in alternatives to traditional school among the most
highly educated parents in the country.


The benefits of
self-directed learning seem to go beyond academic benefits.  A
graduate thesis by Roya J. Dedeaux at California State University, Long Beach, based
on a study of 1,052 participants, concludes “The results indicated that several
common assumptions about the homeschool culture are inaccurate, that
homeschoolers as a group are well below clinical cut-off scores for anxiety and
depression…”


What We Need Start-up Funds For:We have found new partners
who are going to help us complete the legal requirements for filing for a
non-profit status with the IRS!  This is going to save us $2,000.00, which
means that MORE of your donation can go directly toward helping young people
take control of their own education!  
1) $3,000.00 $1,000.00 will cover costs associated with starting the non-profit
corporation. We want to do this right. We've researched different ways to
complete these legal requirements, and there are less expensive options, but
they offer little to no personal advising from an expert who specializes in
starting non-profit corporations. We want to MAP the Pursuit right so that it
lasts. We believe hiring a reputable, experienced lawyer is the way to do it.
If anyone with legal expertise in starting 501(3)'s and who believes in
what we're doing can contribute pro bono help, we'd be forever grateful. 
2. $188 covers Indiegogo's very reasonable 4% fees. 
3. $3,500 (or any amount above or below that) will go directly to funding self-directed learning experiences designed entirely by and for young people. Let's Challenge the Status QuoOur long term plans also include campaigns to challenge the injustice of traditional schooling.  We believe we can help young people achieve academic success at HALF the cost that traditional public schools pay per student per year.  Districts in Massachusetts spend between $10,000 and $30,000 per pupil per year.  We can begin helping young people achieve their potential for about $6,000 per learner per year.  We have a long-term financial strategy that will challenge the establishment to rethink how self-directed learning can actually SAVE cities and towns hundreds of thousands of dollars a year.  This Indiegogo campaign is the first step in our long-term strategy.  We will build our organization one student at a time.  We will start by offering funding to students who design their own self-directed learning projects. We will use their success to market our organization and increase our fundraising strategy through grants and donations.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Visit North Star's website to see what kids in central Massachusetts can have:Self-directed Learning for Teens ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Other
Ways You Can Help

Post a link to our Indiegogo site on your Facebook,
     Twitter, Instagram, Vine or other social networking site.  Get the
     word out and make some noise about MAP the Pursuit.


Use the Indiegogo share tools!


Email everyone you know a link to our
     Indiegogo campaign.


If you can offer us any expertise in law, fundraising,
     real estate, board management, technology or finance -- or if you are
     interested in finding out more about self-directed learning for you, your
     family or your friends -- email us at mapthepursuit@gmail.com.

story:
(Version française à la fin)

What we are

Each one of us had their own reason reason to undertake volunteering and international training: adventure, openness to the world, cultural curiosity, a career change or the experience of a lifetime. However, the true passion every one of us has for this mission is the desire to make a difference. Invested with a strong desire to help those in needs, it is with great enthusiasm that we will fly to Haiti in a few months. An environment of simplicity and green scenery that will sharpen our knowledge and nursing skills, with the support of local doctors and our accompanying professors. Two weeks during which we will learn, not only heal the world, but also to change it, little by little, at the Caribbean pace. A transformation that can only begin with ourselves.


Who we are

8 college nursing students, aged from 18 to 33 years old, along with two experienced teachers, from Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu (Quebec, Canada). We will be supported by local doctors and different NGOs like FODES-5.

http://www.fodes5.org/



What we do

A 15 days internship in Haiti for a 2nd year nursing class. The clinic is situated in Labrousse, Haïti, about 90 Km away from the capital Port-au-Prince. There, we will be able to practice our nursing skills, support doctors as well as perform many educational capsules. This is the eleventh international mission undertaken by the college.

What We Need

We need: 10 plane tickets, 15 days of shelter and food, local transportation, vaccines and medication.  Current estimate is set at $22 910.

We already have different funding initiative: A reptile zoo for kids, ticket sale, other NGO sponsorship (LOJIQ, Léger, Forces Avenir), donations and personal downpayment. Current estimate is set to $22 129.

Basically, we need another $1000 to cover all spendings and hopefully some more money to start paying back our personal downpayment ($750 per students... ouch!). We are only asking for another $1000 to help us cover part of that downpayment.


What You Get

Look at the perks!

(Calendar currently unavailable)


The Impact

Last year student's were able to provide clinical help to over 250 patients in need, either at the local clinic or through a Mobile Clinic that moved along the neighbor villages. They saw over 500 during last fall mission. Even though curative care is important, health prevention is one of the key aspect of this important internship for the students. Also, many of the rural haitians only believe in white men's medicine and will often wait many weeks or months before coming to the clinic, awaiting student nurses or student doctors to arrive before consulting.



Nos valeurs

Chacun de nous a sa propre raison de la raison d'entreprendre le bénévolat et la formation internationale: l'aventure, l'ouverture au monde, la curiosité culturelle, un changement de carrière ou l'expérience d'une vie. Il y a cependant une une passion que nous partageons tous, soit le désir de faire une différence. Investi avec un fort désir d'aider ceux dans le besoin, c'est avec beaucoup d'enthousiasme que nous nous envolerons à Haïti dans quelques mois. Un environnement de simplicité et de verdure qui affinera nos connaissances et compétences infirmières, grâce au soutien de médecins locaux et de nos professeurs accompagnatrices. Deux semaines au cours desquelles nous apprendrons, non seulement à guérir le monde, mais aussi à le changer, peu à peu, au rythme des Caraïbes. Une transformation qui ne pourra commencer par nous-mêmes.


Qui nous sommes

8 étudiants de niveau collégial en soins infirmiers, agés de 18 à 33 ans, ainsi que deux enseignantes expérimentées, de Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu (Québec, Canada). Nous serons soutenus par des médecins locaux et différentes ONG tel que FODES-5.

http://www.fodes5.org/


Ce que nous allons y faire

Un stage de 15 jours en Haïti pour un cours de soins infirmiers de 2ème année. La clinique est située à Labrousse, en Haïti, à environ 90 km de la capitale Port-au-Prince. De là, nous serons en mesure de pratiquer nos compétences en soins infirmiers, supporter les médecins et effectuer de nombreuses capsules éducatives. Il s'agit de la onzième mission internationale entreprise par le département de soins infirmiers du cégep Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu.


Ce que nous avons besoin

Nous avons besoin de: 10 billets d'avion, logement et nourriture durant 15 jours, le transport local, les vaccins et les médicaments. Estimation actuelle est fixé à 22 910 $.

Nous avons déjà différente initiatives de financement: Un zoo de reptiles pour enfants, vente de billets de tirage, d'autres ONG de parrainage (LOJIQ, Léger, Forces Avenir), des dons et une mise de fonds personnelle. Estimation actuelle est de 22 129 $.

Fondamentalement, nous aurons besoin d'environ 1000 $ pour couvrir toutes les dépenses et un peu plus d'argent pour commencer à rembourser notre mise de fonds personnelle (750 $ par étudiants). Nous demandons seulement un autre 1000 $ pour nous aider à couvrir une partie de cette mise de fonds.


Ce que vous obtenez en échange

Regardez les "Perks" pour les montants à donner et les cadeaux. 

(Calendrier présentement non-disponible)


L'impact

L'année dernière, le groupe d'étudiantes fut en mesure de fournir de l'aide à plus de 250 patients dans le besoin, soit à la clinique locale soit par une clinique mobile qui se déplaçait le long des villages voisins. Ils en ont vu plus de 500 lors de la dernière mission à l'automne 2013. Même si les soins curatifs sont importants, la prévention de la santé est l'un des aspects clé de ce stage et nous y travaillerons ardemment. De plus, beaucoup d'Haïtiens ruraux croient que dans la médecine des Blancs est meilleur et attendent parfois plusieurs semaines avant de venir à la clinique, dans l'attente des élèves infirmières ou les étudiants en médecine. Nous leur apporterons ainsi des médicaments, des soins de qualité, des connaissances et un peu de réconfort.

story:
Jessica Hinson was an amazing young woman who battled colon cancer in her 20's. She had a precious spirit and a contagious smile that touched everyone. She dedicated her life to her love of dancing and to her daughter, Stella.

Jessica was strong. She had to be, because she had an amazingly, adorable daughter who needed her. 

Jessica sadly lost her battle with cancer in 2013. But her strength, just like her smile, was contagious, and it lives on in the lives of her friends and family. 

Most importantly, Jessica's love and strength lives on in Stella.

Stella is 4 years old and has already lost both of her parents. But she is graced with a family that adores and loves her in the deepest way. 

Jessica's family and friends are "Staying Strong for Stella". You don't have to know Jessica to know that cancer took her away from Stella too soon. 

We all want the best for Stella's future and want to ensure that she is given the opportunities she deserves. So for Stella, all money raised will go into a college fund.

If you're reading this, please consider donating to this cause. Seriously, no matter how small, your donation will impact Stella's future and also celebrate Jessica's life.

This is for Stella's education, so she can grow to be the amazing woman she is destined to be. It's in her DNA! :)

Stay strong for Stella!

story:
6 Hours ago a message went out to pray for a dear friends little nephew, little did I know hours later he would enter the gates of Heaven. Brandon (Truitt's Uncle) is a very dear friend who entered my life earlier in the year. As I have gotten to know the heart of him and his family I have been truly blessed. Just weeks ago I was able to Facetime with Truitt and he was a funny, energetic, loving little man. In that short encounter with him I seen the joy he was able to bring to those around him. He will be dearly missed, and forever loved.

I have started this indiegogo page to help his family with the cost of medical bills, funeral details, time out of work, or however they see fit to use this money.

story:
The Goal

Our sixty-three 5th graders have worked extremely hard this year to develop the academic skills and critical-thinking abilities they need to be successful in middle school. As they get ready for their next big step, we want to honor their hard work by sending them on an overnight camping trip.  Our goal is to support the cost of every student attending the trip.

The Trip

Frost Valley is an enriching outdoor camp that rests in the heart of the Catskills Mountains, about two hours north of New York City. While here, our scholars would get the opportunity to build leadership skills that we trust will last a lifetime. Over the course of a two-night stay, scholars would get the chance to get out of New York City and engage with nature in a way that most of them never have before!

The Ask

We are looking to raise $5,000 to fund our scholars' trip from May 6-8, 2015. Please help make this awesome adventure an actual reality by giving whatever you can!

story:
Our first school room is quickly filling and we need to begin planning and fundraising for additional rooms. The need is great in the community we are serving and on January 5, 2015 we officially opened with a "Baby" level class taught in our one-room schoolhouse.  It is important that we soon begin construction on Phase II of the school, allowing the current students to graduate to the "Middle" class and then to the "Pre-primary" level and have adequate classroom space.

The Second  Phase of our school expansion will add four classrooms and a kitchen, and will be able to accommodate eighty additional students in ascending grade levels.  The Physical property and necessary basic support infra-structure and minimal utilities needed are already available.  We need your help to complete Phase II of this school.  You have a unique opportunity to fund a project which will benefit the lives of women, men and children for generations, and help stimulate and grow a small economy into a developing and more stable community.  Your donation today will carry forward benefiting the lives of children not yet born.  Join us today.  Dare to Dream Big with us!

story:
Make Your Play, Funt

All the fun! Funt's fundamental value is language.

Funt combines fun and language learning at the same time.

Free assembly videos on Youtube.

Free Funt Play Book.

Organic learning through experience.

 

 

 
 

 

 

 
 
 

- Children are naturally interested in letters.

- Organic education about animals.

 
 

- Improves reasoning and space perception abilities.

- Used as a toy.

 
 
 

- Develop children's hands' fine motor skills.

- Can be used with interior items.

 
 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

* We will begin shipping at the end of February and

   it will take about 60 to 70 days to ship.

 

 

 

 

 

We are already recognized in our country.

story:
Early Years

So I have been drawing since I can remember, and so I knew it was something I wanted to do professionally even at a young age. I have been pursuing this goal of being an art professional all my life, and this is another step in that direction for me. 

I need the moolah to get me to Canada. You get personalized art! 

When all is said and done I need about 5k to get to the Imaginism workshop held in Canada. It's a month long ordeal of intense concept art learning, and it's super exciting! BUT! I do not expect ALL of that moolah from you lovely people. All I am asking for is $2500. Added to what I am earning on my own, that should be more than enough to get me where I am going!

Now on to YOU! Most of my prizes have to do with original art for you, created by me. From a simple sketch to a fully rendered piece of art, it's all custom made by me, and tailored to exactly what you want. But the big cahuna, the Piez-de-resistaunce, is the $1000 perk. You donate 1000 bucks, I will create a large scale fully rendered crazy-insane painting, printed and mounted on foam core, shipped right to your door. But the best part- When I get back from Imaginism, I will either re-create the same piece, or create a brand new one with my newly developed skills from the workshop!

So double prize with that one! Go you! :)

What it means to me...

This is something I have dreamed of doing since I first heard of it when I first got into Art college. It's hard to explain to most people, but just the simple act of being able to LIVE with the artist who is teaching me, and getting real, hands-on, one-on-one teaching in a group of 4 people is just an astounding opportunity that I cannot pass up. Especially as an artist I get to really ask the questions I want to, and have them answered, and answered well from one bad-a$$ artist! (pardon my french :D)

I have been to school, and gotten the basics, but now I want to specialize and really find out how much better of an artist I can become. This would give me that opportunity, and more! 

Why Imaginism rocks!

If you are reading all of this and don't have a clue about Imaginism studios, check out this link http://www.imaginismstudios.com/

They are an awesome pre-production focused company that has produced some fantastic artwork for blockbuster films such as Alice in Wonderland, MIB3, and more. As well as having film credits, they create plenty of independant artwork, while also delving into children books and other interesting artistic endeavors. They are also the creators of Schoolism, an online school where people can learn techniques from masters in their respective fields. They know what they are doing! 

And almost as an upgrade from Schoolism, is this workshop! http://www.imaginismstudios.com/workshop.php Heres a link if you want to check it out even more. Instead of getting only online feedback through schoolism, I'd have real life human interaction to learn and perfect my craft while there. Out of the (possibly) hundreds of applicants to their workshop, only 4 people are chosen. 4! And I was one of those chosen! So you can see how awesome and unique this opportunity is! Consider helping this become a reality!

How the starving artist can help...

So you wanna help but are poorer than me, huh? Well fret not, you can still help!

Get on facebook, twitter, google+ and whatever-the-hell-else and let other people know. Shout it from the rooftops of your building if you really want to. (just dont mention my name if you get arrested <.< >.>)

THANKS!

Thanks for reading! Thanks for contemplating donating! Thanks for actually donating! Just thanks all around! You are amazing people, and you make the world go round! You really do :)

I do not expect ALL of that moolah from you lovely people. All I am asking for is $2500. Added to what I am earning on my own, that should be more than enough to get me where I am going!
Now on to YOU! Most of my prizes have to do with original art for you, created by me. From a simple sketch to a fully rendered piece of art, it's all custom made by me, and tailored to exactly what you want. But the big cahuna, the Piez-de-resistaunce, is the $1000 perk. You donate 1000 bucks, I will create a large scale fully rendered crazy-insane painting, printed and mounted on foam core, shipped right to your door. But the best part- When I get back from Imaginism, I will either re-create the same piece, or create a brand new one with my newly developed skills from the workshop!
So double prize with that one! Go you! :)

What it means to me...
This is something I have dreamed of doing since I first heard of it when I first got into Art college. It's hard to explain to most people, but just the simple act of being able to LIVE with the artist who is teaching me, and getting real, hands-on, one-on-one teaching in a group of 4 people is just an astounding opportunity that I cannot pass up. Especially as an artist I get to really ask the questions I want to, and have them answered, and answered well from one bad-a$$ artist! (pardon my french :D)
I have been to school, and gotten the basics, but now I want to specialize and really find out how much better of an artist I can become. This would give me that opportunity, and more! 
Why Imaginism rocks!
If you are reading all of this and don't have a clue about Imaginism studios, check out this link http://www.imaginismstudios.com/
They are an awesome pre-production focused company that has produced some fantastic artwork for blockbuster films such as Alice in Wonderland, MIB3, and more. As well as having film credits, they create plenty of independant artwork, while also delving into children books and other interesting artistic endeavors. They are also the creators of Schoolism, an online school where people can learn techniques from masters in their respective fields. They know what they are doing! 
And almost as an upgrade from Schoolism, is this workshop! http://www.imaginismstudios.com/workshop.php Heres a link if you want to check it out even more. Instead of getting only online feedback through schoolism, I'd have real life human interaction to learn and perfect my craft while there. Out of the (possibly) hundreds of applicants to their workshop, only 4 people are chosen. 4! And I was one of those chosen! So you can see how awesome and unique this opportunity is! Consider helping this become a reality!


How the starving artist can help...
So you wanna help but are poorer than me, huh? Well fret not, you can still help!
Get on facebook, twitter, google+ and whatever-the-hell-else and let other people know. Shout it from the rooftops of your building if you really want to. (just dont mention my name if you get arrested <.< >.>)












THANKS!
Thanks for reading! Thanks for contemplating donating! Thanks for actually donating! Just thanks all around! You are amazing people, and you make the world go round! You really do :)

story:
As a high school student myself, I am aware of how important education is. I traveled to Belize last spring and I saw many children in their homes instead of at school. It turns out that a majority of these kids aren't in school because they can't afford the books and the uniforms, even though the education is free. I am inspired to help some of these children get the education they desire.


All the money I receive goes directly to the James Arthur Albert Foundation, which provides scholarships to students as well as building schools and providing young women with opportunities. The foundation is located in Punta Gorda, Belize, where I am traveling to deliver the money personally in January 2014. Whatever money accumulates from this fundraiser will end up going to the foundation. Your donations will give you access to my blog while I am helping in Belize. You can enjoy the holiday season knowing that you're giving a child a chance!

This foundation helps students to receive an education much desired, but hard to get. These students go through a long application process of being accepted into a school, so whatever you donate will go to a child who really wants it. This will help these students have a brighter future and a chance to realize their dreams.

Please spread the word about this and tell people about the James Arthur Albert Foundation. Help a child achieve their dreams!

story:
Here is Mathew:


He's the most hard working person I know. 

Over the last few years, Matt has attended school full time, worked full time and maintained great relationships with his family, friends and with me, excelling in each of these pursuits.

 

He's consistently earned all A's in school


We all still love him


and he was recently chosen as the MVP at work, an award that has only been handed out 5 times in the 9 years his company has been in business. 



Finally, a few months ago, Matt was accepted to attend Dev Bootcamp. Dev Bootcamp is a 19 week long training program where students learn to master Ruby on Rails, a computer programming language that allows people to make computers do magical things called interactive web applications (for instance, the Groupon and Twitter Websites are built using Ruby on Rails).

Dev Bootcamp is a reputable program in Chicago, New York and San Francisco and Dev Bootcamp has a 90% rate of placing students into jobs they want to be in. That's 36% more than University of Michigan, but we won't tell Ann Arbor that.

On top of all of this, as of right now, Matt has saved all but $800 of the $16,000 dollars he needs to pay tuition and cover his living expenses while he is in the program!

In effort to keep Matthew debt free while he works towards his professional and financial goals, I am launching a new product, Ruby Fruit Jam, and selling it as a part of a new "We Love Matthew Campaign".

We have picked 20lbs of Michigan blueberries and concord grapes during the very peak of the season (these things are delicious) and turned them into Ruby Fruit Jam. Ruby Fruit Jam goes very well with toast, biscuits, cheese or ice cream and for your donation toward supporting Matthew's education, I will send you your own jar :)

All proceeds from Ruby Fruit Jam go directly toward the cost of tuition for Dev Bootcamp!

Thank You for helping us make our dreams come true, we really appreciate your support !!

story:
Three wars ravaged Bosnia and Herzegovina during the 20th century; each destroyed invaluable cultural and historical treasures. What remains is threatened by neglect, vandalism, natural disasters, and the ravages of time.

These threats are real. The National Museum has closed; other museums, libraries, and cultural institutions are teetering on the brink, starved of funding with little or no prospect of keeping them operational. Old materials deteriorate under poor conditions. The threats of natural catastrophes and mob violence simply make matters worse.

In 2014 alone, these threats struck twice. In February, rioters set fire to centuries-old documents in the State Presidency archives. In May, unprecedented flooding and landslides damaged or destroyed old documents and official records throughout the country. And the dangers are only growing.

To combat these threats, the Foundation for the Preservation of Historical Heritage (FPHH) began digitizing rare holdings of the National Library in January 2014. In August 2014 it expanded its program to include the Historical Museum, along with Oslobodjenje, the country’s oldest continuously published daily newspaper. But these represent only the tip of the iceberg.

Up until now the Foundation has relied on volunteer efforts, donations of equipment, time, know-how and materials. But this is no longer sufficient.

Bosnia and Herzegovina needs your help to preserve its priceless heritage, which is an important part of the world’s cultural treasury. We must include other cultural institutions and rare document collections before they too are lost. In order to do this, your financial support is now critical.

FPHH has set an initial goal of $48,500.

These funds would enable FPHH to:

• Purchase additional high-tech, customized, digitization equipment and software;

• Ensure and enhance the security of data and equipment;

Any funds raised above of this goal will permit FPHH to:

• Identify new partners with archives and documents in need of preservation;

• Acquire additional digitization equipment, including a mobile unit for remote parts of the country; and

• Develop outreach and education materials.

story:
Hello Indigogo!

This is the Los Angeles Robotics & Aeronautics Learning Club. We would like to get a 3D printer & bench drill press to use for enhancing our education, and hosting workshops at for students and  local Boy Scouts of America Troops. We are passionate about education, and we believe this project has a great potential to positively impact our community.

Our future is important to us, and we believe that inspiring the youth will make this world a better place. If we do not reach our goal, we will still pursue a 3D printer, but of less quality. If we exceed our goals, then we can invest in a higher quality printer, the materials that we will need for it, and be able to do more frequent projects in the community. Please visit our Facebook page and spread the word!



We are raising $950 for this printer Press and the filament we will need to work on our  projects as well as the workshops we host in our community.  We will be hosting summer Merit Badge classes for local Boy Scouts of America, and eventually classes for disabled children. the idea is to not only create, record and catalog new robotic ideas but to also teach the youth in the surrounding community engineering skills to spark their imagination.


I started this due to wishing that this was available to me in my youth, because i cannot imagine the ideas I would have today if I had been apart of something like that as a child.





What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need $950
  • 400 for printer
  • 400 for Drill press
  • 150 for fees prizes as well as tax and shipping.

Extra money will go towards buying a 3d modeling printing software (that fixes modeling errors (needed due to youth that will be modeling.))


Software $300 for printing (fixes errors)(need for bsa and children classes)

Filiments

Tools

Books and manuscripts (for BSA and Children Classes)



    • ---------------------------

      Building the kit from scratch will allow for even better understanding of the workings of 3D printing from the inside out. 

      By participating in helping fund 


      $10 Thanks! - Thanks on a special page on our website as well as the twitter and Facebook and Good vibes! 

      $35 Key-chain - If you contribute $35.00, you will receive a LARALC key chain!

      $100 3d Printed item - If you donate $100.00, we will print out an item on our new 3D printer that we design for you
      $150 3d Mini Robot -If you donate $150.00, we will print out a LARALC mini Robot on our new 3D printer that we design for you.
      $70  Coffee Cup Lense-

      It's perfect for anyone who wants a cool coffee cup


    • $85 Three Time Zone Military Watch -  Leather Watch that will get a ton of compliments

      $100 Ratchet Belt- Stylish Holes Belt with stylish design. belt made with real leather.




    • $500  Custom 3D item -  Custom 3D printed name and simple object from personal sketch
      $650 mini uav-  Custom 3D printed uav compatible with hubsan parts

      $850 Custom V-tail UAV-  Custom V-tail UAV (comes preloaded with software) (will fund 85% of campaign alone and we could raise missing funds if one person picks this) (receiver and battery sold separately

    • If we over-fund, we will buy more 3D printed related software and hardware for a more enjoyable experience at our club.


    The Impact


    Buying a 3d Printer and tabletop drill press for the club will allow the larger community to have access to a 3D printer and drill press to create rapid prototypes and objects of their own designs. It will bring ideas to life in new ways and help personal and professional dreams become realized. Nothing is more exciting for a community than seeing this happen and being able to support each other in this happening.


    When we work with disabled children and Boy Scouts of America, we will be able to help bring their ideas to life.




    Risks & Challenges

    If we don't make funding we will do fundraisers for the rest of funds

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you like what we are doing and can't help donate please share on linked in Facebook or twitter, each share brings out gogo factor up higher and allows more people to see us.



      ---------------------------------------

story:
• 46% of those who enter a U.S. college fail to graduate within 6 years*
  • 58% of Hispanic students fail to graduate within that time*
  • With your help, I WON'T become yet another statistic

American Dream 2.0*

Four months ago, when I found out I no longer had funds to finish college, my life changed. Being an international student makes things a bit more challenging since I am not able to work or get loans, and I currently have no scholarships. 

At home, I learned the value of education, and how it can be recognized as both a problem AND a solution for developing countries. I believe it is not time for me to give up on my short-term goal to finish my last 5 classes at Ringling College (1 semester), or on my long-term goal of helping all those back home who, to this day, still find barriers to get education. Long story short, I am here today, and I want to stay. 

I have always tried to figure things out on my own and I am not used to asking for help... but this time I really need it.

Like us on Facebook to stay tuned for more updates on the background story of why I need this and how I got to be where I am now. 


What I Need & What You Get

Guat'emole aims to raise $22,000 to afford for health, technology, activity & graduation fees, as well as any art supplies I may need.
BUDGET BREAKDOWN
Ful Time Enrollment          $18,440
Student Activities Fee      $305
Health Services Fee          $195
Graduation Fee                  $400
Technology Fee                 $1,100
Art Supplies                       $1,000
+ Taxes & Production costs

  • I teamed up with fellow Ringling illustrators, filmmakers, motion designers, business majors and many more to collaborate with them throughout my journey. Along with my illustrator teammates, we worked on designing and manually screen printing a series Limited Edition Guat'emole shirts and totes, as well as cool post-cards and coasters. PREVIEW COMING SOON...
  • What happens if I can't raise all the money? Frankly, that WILL NOT happen, but everyone needs a plan B. I will take the money to go back to Guatemala and produce a documentary on the impact and quality of education in developing countries, and the challenges some dreamers face.
To be a part of the Guat'emole movement, feel free to donate anything, from a dollar to a smile if you see me walk by.


The Impact

With your help, I will conclude nearly 18 years of my education, that began way back in Guatemala.

  • This project isn't just about me though, it's about creating a movement for all of those who just like me find their dreams paused due to educational barriers
  • Coming from an underdeveloped country, I was always aware of the importance and lack of good quality education available globally
  • In the future I want to guide those who don't have funds for their education, but believe they can empower themselves and raise funds for their educational needs
  • If you try my guacamole, you will have tried the BEST

Personally...

This has been one heck of a journey to me, but it's been worth it.
I was forced to face many of my deepest fears, and overcame them
I got first-hand production experience
I got to collaborate with many talented individuals
I learned to Screen Print thanks to Irene R.
I found amazing people and connections along the way
When I felt like I had nothing left, I found hope and realized I had it all

Meet the team

I would like to  thank each one of you who shared with me their time and held my hand when I needed the most.

Irene Rofail

Shash Bista

Nathan Walkington

Riko Cribbs

Andrew Grzybowski

Diego Sánchez Chico

David Villa

Michael Cano

The Green Bean Coffee House - Sarasota

I couldn't be more grateful for such amazing friends.


Risks & Challenges

The ONLY risk you will take is not being a part of the movement. And not trying this guacamole. 

The biggest challenge I face is sharing my secret recipes with you, and getting Guat'emole all the way to your hands.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you believe or relate to my cause, please share it with those you know
  • Follow us on Facebook & Ello
  • Come out to the Green Bean Coffee House - Sarasota, and for every 'Lost Guatemalan' wrap, a dollar will be donated to my campaign.
  • Want a guac party? Email for a quote: guatemole.campaign@gmail.com
I'm Elo, join me in the Guat'emole moevement to fund my education with guacamole.

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone, we are a group of Graduate Social Work students from Gallaudet University. We are using our social work skills and passion to come together with LAVOSI. LAVOSI is a school for the Deaf in Guatemala. "There are many people in Guatemala who have hearing difficulties and sadly, there are few resources, services, trained educators, or organizations devoted to the education of these beautiful minds" (LAVOSI, 2013) (http://www.lavosi.org/aboutus.html).

The resources and support for those who are Deaf/hoh, as the quote above says, so LAVOSI and all of us are reaching out to all of you.  Currently there are 33 Students and only 3 teachers.

"Poverty is also an obstacle to many in Guatemala, and hinders access to many deserved opportunities" (LAVOSI, 2013).​ LAVOSI relies heavily on volunteers and donations because the government does not fund them. Please help these children receive the education they deserve to help make their dreams come true.

THIS EVENT WILL CLOSE BY THANKSGIVING WEEK 11/27

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for the next few months is to raise awareness and $3,000+ in donations.

  • The money will go towards a teacher's salary
  • Help the school afford computers
  • And help them make first aid kits

The Impact

One year salary for a teacher is $3,000 (American currency)

Your contribution can add to that!!

Risks & Challenges

One reason why we are doing a campaign online is because getting money and supplies to Guatemala is not always the safest and easiest task. This also allows us to reach out to more of you and hopefully,  you will share with your friends, so we can reach out even further!

Other Ways You Can Help

    • You can go to their website and donate at another time http://www.lavosi.org/index.html
    • Like them on facebook https://www.facebook.com/FriendsoftheDeaf
    • or if you have any computers that still work but you would like to donate please contact nechodeleon@gmail.com
story_txt:
Short SummaryHello everyone, we are a group of Graduate Social Work students from Gallaudet University. We are using our social work skills and passion to come together with LAVOSI. LAVOSI is a school for the Deaf in Guatemala. "There are many people in Guatemala who have hearing difficulties and 
sadly, there are few resources, services, trained educators, or 
organizations devoted to the education of these beautiful minds" (LAVOSI, 2013) (http://www.lavosi.org/aboutus.html).The resources and support for those who are Deaf/hoh, as the quote above says, so LAVOSI and all of us are reaching out to all of you.  Currently there are 33 Students and only 3 teachers. "Poverty
 is also an obstacle to many in Guatemala, and hinders access to many deserved opportunities" (LAVOSI, 2013).​ LAVOSI relies heavily on volunteers and donations because the government does not fund them. Please help these children receive the education they deserve to help make their dreams come true.THIS EVENT WILL CLOSE BY THANKSGIVING WEEK 11/27
  What We Need & What You Get Our goal for the next few months is to raise awareness and $3,000+ in donations. 

The money will go towards a teacher's salary
Help the school afford computers
And help them make first aid kits


  The Impact One year salary for a teacher is $3,000 (American currency) 
Your contribution can add to that!!
  Risks & ChallengesOne reason why we are doing a campaign online is because getting money and supplies to Guatemala is not always the safest and easiest task. This also allows us to reach out to more of you and hopefully,  you will share with your friends, so we can reach out even further! 
  Other Ways You Can Help 
 
You can go to their website and donate at another time http://www.lavosi.org/index.html 

Like them on facebook https://www.facebook.com/FriendsoftheDeaf

or if you have any computers that still work but you would like to donate please contact nechodeleon@gmail.com

story:
Greetings to all:

We are so excited about Dec 2,2014 #GiveTuesday. Were ecstatic about announcing our new project to the world. Check below for details and Become a World Charger Today!!

We are The Next Level Up Ministries and we are currently collaborating with GOTG LLC and the Bobby Jones Kidney Foundation for the “Get Back To Work Now Project.” Our goal is to raise a minimum of $10,000 For the phase 1. Then we will roll out our additional phases.Our mission is to get the unemployed back to work. This project is based out of Sacramento, CA.

With the Get Back To Work Now Project our objective is create jobs for unemployed and low income families. We will provide the necessary training they will need to become sufficient in the workforce. Each new employee will be paid $10 per hour. We are seeking low income families that have been unemployed for six months or longer with professional backgrounds. Implementing these services in our community, we will strengthen our economy and become a voice to the community to create a rock solid foundation for success.

As givers we are big advocates for community services with over 15 years of services. The Get Back To Work Now Project will definitely bring change as Sacramento sees fit. We want to solve problems with solutions and make a big impact in others lives.

You may ask yourself Why should I help them?

Here's Why:

You should find it in your heart to donate because people need to hear our message loud and clear. In the world today there is so much turmoil and people need to hear about the good news. People today will be encouraged by seeing others great people getting together and do some amazing things. In order to keep these programs going we are in need of a new space, computers, uniforms,vehicle,printer ink and paper just to name a few. We will be hiring for the following positions: Customer Service reps,Teachers, Delivery Drivers,Janitors, Receptionists, Office techs, Graphic Designers, Managers, Interns, volunteers and many more..We are exciting about this opportunity to give back to those in need.

This online campaign is a part of our larger goal of raising $250,000. Can you help us reach that goal? With the money we will be able to support the following:

GOTG LLC 

Hire and Train unemployed families to get back to work

Hire interns to continue education and offer skill training and job enrichment in exchange for accepting a job within the company

The NEXT LEVEL UP Ministries (First Institution Missionary Program)

Helps domestic violence women and children cover temporary housing,job training and placement, counseling,health and beauty services food and clothes closet.

Bobby Jones Kidney Foundation (BJKF)

financially and mentally assist families suffering from kidney diseases. BJKF crisis program: Provides financial support,transportation,nutrition,rent/mortgage assistance, utilities,health and life insurance and health check ups & education

I know this all seems complicated but we are just asking to help us however you can. If its $5 or $10,000 . Wherever your heart leads you to give, every penny given will be used to change someone's life. All money donated will be used for the the 3 listed organizations.

If everything goes planned we are expecting someone to match whatever we raise . So please support TODAY. If you have a heart to give. We have an open heart to receive.

Whether you are able to donate or not please help us out by sharing our campaign on Facebook ,Instagram, Twitter, your email lists everyone needs to hear about this. Make some noise for us helping our own community. If you cant,can you find someone who's willing?


We are a registered 501(c)3 non profit company, so all your donations are tax deductible

story:
Four months ago I got introduced to the New Life Orphanage in Ghana by a colleague of mine. Although our visit was as short as only one morning these kids stole my heart.
As this was my first time of actual visiting a home of under privileged children I was afraid that there would be a gap of mutual understanding. I was a ''white tall strange girl'' and they lived in a world far different from mine. And god knows what these little souls have been through in their short lives. Who was I to step in just as briefly as I did and then disappear again, and who knows maybe never return? What could I contribute in just a few hours without being an intruder or even worse, a tourist?

I was happy that we didn't come empty handed as my colleagues were prepared and been before. We had a very warm welcome by Mr. Chepas the founder and two Danish girls who were volunteering for their second summer. They told us their story obout New Life. As it turned out I was already more connected with this special little place as I had initially thought. Not only did my mom use to have her own maternity agency with the same name, New Life. It also turned out that Mr. Chepas had lived in Holland for 14yrs before he decided to come back to his homeland and founded the orphanage.

After a little tour inside and outside the orphanage, we went 'next doors' to the school that not only held the 46 New Life kids but the other children from the town as well. The kids were just finishing up their tests which meant we came in on the right moment, play time!

We went to different classrooms of different grades and introduced ourselves. We made little chats with the kids, asking about how they did on their tests and their favorite school subjects. Soon all kids started to come out of the classrooms around and we had a hallway full of running, clapping, dancing and laughing little people. Outside some of the older kids were playing soccer and girls where teaching each other to dance.
As I watched them play and played with them I felt all barriers breaking down. These were the same kids like I know how kids are from back home and from a places I've been around the world: Curious, energetic, happy and cheeky kids. And just like kids can be, some of them were shy; others grabbed my hand and my skirt and longed for a hug or a pat on the head. These kids are just like the kids you and I once were and the kids we know today from friends and family or the ones we see at the playground near our house. And I realized this is what being a kid is all about: being able to be a kid in every sense of the way. To be able to play, laugh and learn and to be able to love and be loved in return without fear, stress or sorrow. The only thing what makes these kids just a little different from the rest is the way we see them. What we see is what they don't have or as I would like to say, what we see is what can be better. That they can have better, in terms of food, health, sanitary and education. And this is where I felt I CAN make a difference, even if it is a small one. The fact that these kids crossed my path meant that I could choose to walk out of their lives and never return to anything less than a cherished memory. OR I could come back once more and this time to bring more than just my smile and love. This time I could come back and actually contribute to their lives and make it a little better.

When I left I didn't know when exactly I would be able to return and in what way. But I knew I would one day. And as if the universe couldn't have planned a more symbolic time for me to return I will be going back to Accra, Ghana for two days during Christmas. For me it is a sign that this is my chance, to realize my Christmas thought to make a difference.

And yes, this is the point where I want to ask you to help and share in my Christmas thought and help me make a small contribution to the life of these children. Who are, in plane words, in need of school supplies, sanitary improvements and expanding of living space. During my visit I learned that they just put up a brick wall to create a safe surrounding for the schools courtyard. This had cost all the $1000 raised by the volunteer girls in their home country Denmark. So I thought if they can do that so can I!

I only have 20days left (as it is) and might not have a marathon to run or a talent that I can exploit. But I can share this story which I know will reach all of my new and old connections from all over the world who all have an incredible strong network of their own. And I know how much holidays are always about togetherness, family and sharing love. As well as it is a moment when we count our blessings and are more aware of the less fortunate in this world. Around this time we donate a little more here and there to the man with the violin in the metro or at the occasional visit to the church. 

Let me make it easy for you: By not making you feel obliged to make a random donation to clear your conscience and share the Christmas spirit. But let ME make YOU part of a small but very real story. And help make a genuine difference in the life of 46+ happy, full of life children, who have been given a New Life and a better future. Will you help me make it even a little better?

Every gesture small or big would be highly appreciated and the total amount will be delivered in hand on the 24/25th of Dec. to Mr. Chepas by me.

And I promise that I will tell you afterwards what direct effect your donation has made on the life of these beautiful children and their amazing care takers. I am even planning another and longer visit next year when I get the chance. And maybe actually be able to help put the money to use or contribute more in physical presence. In any way your money will go directly to the cause instead of to some promising organisation. 

Share the love and this story and I can assure you that not only I but above all the New Life kids in Ghana will be ever so grateful to you!!
