story:
We are AIRC, the Alternative Intervention Research Clinic, a non-profit 501 (c3) focused on “balancing your being” form the inside out.

We work with individuals on important life skills such as self-regulation, breathing, and other techniques to calm yourself. Using vibration and frequency, we help balance your energy to get into a better place to learn, grow, and overall be happier. We use all non-drug alternatives: vibrations, frequency, fun interactive games for processing, cognitive therapy, holistic wellness, nutrition, art/play therapy, and neurofeedback.

All of our therapies are research-based, coordinated by our Director Debbie Crews, Ph.D. With over 25 years of research, Dr. Crews has developed her own neurofeedback system (patent pending) used to analyze and train each child’s progress throughout care.

We have spent roughly a year and a half conducting research, acquiring therapies, and improving our care. We are now ready to take our therapies and technology on the road! 

With your generous donation, we will be able to go mobile to schools and facilities in the area (Phoenix and surrounding areas). This will allow us to reach more kids of all ages and backgrounds with various behavioral, social, or academic needs.

We already have the Mobile (currently on loan) set up as a learning center. We have all of our equipment and the schools and facilities lined up (pending this campaign). 

The funding we are asking for, $10,000, will cover the expense of the mobile (two qualified and trained employees, lease, gas, insurance, maintenance, etc.) for one year.

You will be helping us reach community members who cannot reach us.

Now the dreaded question is, what happens if we do not make our goal? Well hopefully, that is not an issue, but if so, we will have to adjust our schedule and go to fewer schools less frequently.

Our hope is just the opposite, we would love to exceed our goal and add more schools and facilities to our list! Take the mobile out more days a week, and touch more lives. We know with your help this vision can come true!

The Impact

The impact of this campaign is tremendous! Not only are you allowing us to balance hundreds of children, improving their performance both socially and academically, but you will also help our non-profit grow and be eligible for more grants. This will enable us to build a stronger foundation for kids for years to come.

More Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially at this time, there are other ways you can help us move forward.

  • Make some noise about our campaign! Give us a shout out on Twitter, Facebook, email, or call a friend - however you connect. Please feel free to share with the share tools.
  • Volunteer your time. We can always use more hands with the kids. Please contact us at eim@cox.net if you are interested in volunteering some of your time.

And that's it, I hope you have a great day and are inspired to help!!!

story: Hello I am a scout who is seeking funds to help me get to Sea Base in Florida this June. I am finishing up my Eagle Scout project and will be going on this adventure as my last major Boy Scout Trip. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity and would like to do everything possible to achieve this on my own. Your support and donation would really help!

story:
--> Please scroll down to find the German version of the text

--> Bitte herunterscrollen, um den deutschen Text zu lesen

The room on the cover picture is one of the two tiny classrooms of Milechild Nursery School in a small village close to Masaka, Uganda. 43 Ugandan children who can’t afford to go to a profit oriented private school study in our baby or middle class and spend their school time in one of these approximately 20 m² classrooms to learn English, Science, Reading, Writing, Drawing/Art, Music and Math.

I am Max Windsheimer from Germany and I started volunteering with MILECHILD Foundation four weeks ago as part of a trip throughout Southern and Eastern Africa. Even on first sight, it was obvious that the classrooms are way too small. All the 43 children together have to get along with only one table and a few chairs. Because of the children being so close to each other, they sometimes even show aggression against each other.

MILECHILD Foundation is a community based, local non-profit organisation passionately supporting children in schools, orphanages, families and communities. The organisation was founded by Martin Mubiru, who was born just a few kilometres away of the village Kabale Lutete Kisoso, where the nursery school is located. The living conditions in the Lutete Kisoso village, where the school is located, are still very poor. Nearly all of the villagers live on farming and subsistence agriculture. The monthly income of a whole family is between 7.7 US$ to 38.5 US$. Obviously, many families can’t even afford health care or school fees, what we consider in Europe as basics. The vision of MILECHILD is to offer these financially underprivileged children a good education and a safe place, far away from the problems many children face at home. We believe that a good education is the best condition for improving their situation in the future. The school is run by four local teachers and helpers. The project is funded by donators from around the world and by many volunteers who work for free to fight poverty. Check out our website for more information: www.milechild.org

Martin, the local leader of the organisation, has already identified the issue and started to build a new, bigger school. In the end, the new school building shall include three classrooms, what will allow separate classrooms for children of different ages and thus different education levels. By the hard work of Martin, many volunteers, local workers and the financial support of both international and local donators, one classroom has already been finished within the last year. This is one big step in the right direction, but there is still a need for at least a second classroom to further relax the situation.

The second classroom is really, really necessary to provide the children with a beautiful and safe environment. Our goal is to let them feel that they are not always on the poor side of life and worth visiting such a school. Since MILECHILD Foundation is currently struggling to raise enough money for being able to finish the second classroom, your contribution for a blackboard, softboards, tiles, windows, a door and paint would be a huge step forward for this project. Our current aim is to raise 1000 US Dollar, what will enable us to start with the work. All in all, an amount of approximately 3000 US Dollar is necessary in order to totally finish the work on the classroom.

Help us to turn miles of problems into smiles in the faces of the children. Every donation supports them. As a small “Thank you” for your support, check out the perks we promise to send to every fundraiser. Of course, every donor will be kept up to date about the progress of the classroom construction. If you should have any questions, feel free to contact me at Windsheimer.Max@googlemail.com.


_____________________________________________________________________________



Der auf dem Titelbild abgebildete Raum ist eines der zwei winzigen Klassenzimmer der Milchechild Nursery School, die sich in einem kleinen Dorf nahe der Stadt Masaka in Uganda befindet. 43 ugandische Kinder, die sich den Besuch einer profitorientierten Privatschule nicht leisten können, gehen hier zur Schule und lernen in den ungefährt 20 m² großen Klassenzimmern Englisch, Naturwissenschaften, Lesen, Schreiben, Kunstunterricht, Musik und Mathematik.

Ich bin Max Windsheimer aus Deutschland und hatte vor etwa vier Wochen im Rahmen einer Reise durch Süd- und Ostafrika bei MILECHILD ein freiwilliges Praktikum begonnen. Direkt am ersten Arbeitstag war offensichtlich, dass die beiden Klassenzimmer für die Kinder viel zu klein sind. Alle der 43 Schulkinder teilen sich einen einzigen Tisch und ein paar Stühle. Weil die Kinder so eng aufeinandersitzen, neigen sie untereinander immer wieder zu kleineren Aggressionen.

MILECHILD Foundation ist eine lokale, gemeindebasierte und gemeinnützige Organisation und somit im Gegensatz zu „normalen“ Unternehmen nicht auf den monetären Profit ausgelegt. Wir unterstützen leidenschaftlich Kinder in ihren Schulen, Weisen, Familien und die gesamte Dorfgemeinde. MILECHILD Foundation wurde von Martin Mubiru gegründet. Martin wurde nur wenige Kilometer von Kabale Lutete Kisoso, wo sich die Nursery School befindet, geboren. Die Lebensbedingungen im Lutete Kisoso Dorf sind noch immer sehr schlecht. Nahezu alle Dorfbewohner leben als Bauern und damit vor allem von der Subsistenzwirtschaft (sie leben also von ihren eigenen Erzeugnissen). Das durchschnittliche Monatseinkommen einer gesamten Familie liegt zwischen 7,7 US$ und 38,5 US$. In Anbetracht dessen ist es offensichtlich, dass viele Familien Dinge wie medizinische Hilfe und Schulgebühren, die für uns in Europa selbstverständlich sind, nicht selbst bezahlen können. Die Vision von Milechild ist es, finanziell benachteiligten Kindern eine gute Bildung und einen sicheren Ort zu bieten, weit weg von den Problemen, denen die Kinder zu Hause ausgesetzt sind. Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass eine gute Schulbildung die beste Voraussetzung ist, die Lebenssituation der Kinder und Gemeinde in Zukunft zu verbessern. In der Schule arbeiten zwei lokale Lehrerinnen und zwei Unterstützerinnen von diesen. Finanziert wird das Projekt von Spendern und anderen Unterstützern weltweit und vielen Voluntären, die unbezahlt an ihrem Ziel arbeiten, Armut zu bekämpfen. Schau doch mal auf unsere Website, dort findest du noch mehr Informationen (wenn auch nur in Englisch): www.milechild.org

Martin, der lokale Vorsitzende der Organisation, hat das Platzproblem schon erkannt und damit begonnen, eine neue, größere Schule in nur fünf Minuten Entfernung von der alten Schule zu bauen.Wenn das neue Schulgebäude fertiggestellt ist, soll es drei Klassenräume enthalten. Dies erlaubt es, Kinder verschiedenen Alters und verschiedener Bildungslevel getrennt voneinander zu unterrichten. Durch die harte Arbeit von Martin, vielen Freiwilligen und der Unterstützung von sowohl nationalen als auch internationalen Spendern konnte ein Klassenzimmer im Laufe des letzten Jahres bereits fertiggestellt werden. Dies ist ein Schritt in die richtige Richtung, aber es besteht immer noch eine große Notwendigkeit für ein zweites Klassenzimmer, mit dem die Situation deutlich entspannt werden könnte.

Der zweite Klassenraum ist wirklich notwendig, um den Kinder tatsächlich eine schöne und sichere Umgebung bieten zu können. Unser Ziel ist es, dass die Kinder auch fühlen können, dass sie nicht immer auf der armen Seite des Lebens stehen und es Wert sind, eine solche Schule besuchen zu können. Da MILECHILD Foundation derzeit damit zu kämpfen hat, genug Geld für die Fertigstellung des zweiten Klassenzimmers zu sammeln, wäre eure Unterstützung für eine Tafel, Softboards, Fließen, Fenster, eine Tür und Farbe für unser Projekt ein großer Schritt nach vorne. Unser derzeitiges Ziel ist es 1000 US Dollar zu sammeln, womit wir mit den Bauarbeiten beginnen könnten. Alles in allem sind noch etwa 3000 US Dollar nötig, um die Arbeiten am neuen Klassenzimmer komplett fertigzusstellen.

Hilf uns, den Kindern trotz aller Probleme ein Lächeln ins Gesicht zu zaubern. Jede Spende unterstützt sie. Werfe doch mal einen Blick auf die Perks, die wir jedem Spender als kleines Dankeschön zukommen lassen werden. Natürlich wird jeder Spender über den Fortschritt der Bauarbeiten auf dem Laufenden gehalten. Solltest du irgendwelche Fragen haben, dann kannst du mich gerne kontaktieren: Windsheimer.Max@googlemail.com
story_txt:
--> Please scroll down to find the German version of the text --> Bitte herunterscrollen, um den deutschen Text zu lesenThe room on the cover picture is one of the two tiny
classrooms of Milechild Nursery School in a small village close to Masaka,
Uganda. 43 Ugandan children who can’t afford to go to a profit oriented private
school study in our baby or middle class and spend their school time in one of
these approximately 20 m² classrooms to learn English, Science, Reading, Writing, Drawing/Art,
Music and Math. 
I am Max Windsheimer from Germany and I started
volunteering with MILECHILD Foundation four weeks ago as part of a trip throughout Southern and Eastern Africa. Even
on first sight, it was obvious that the classrooms are way too small. All the
43 children together have to get along with only one table and a few chairs. Because of
the children being so close to each other, they sometimes even show aggression
against each other. 
MILECHILD Foundation is a community based, local
non-profit organisation passionately supporting children in schools,
orphanages, families and communities. The organisation was founded by Martin
Mubiru, who was born just a few kilometres away of the village Kabale Lutete
Kisoso, where the nursery school is located. The living conditions in the
Lutete Kisoso village, where the school is located, are still very poor. Nearly
all of the villagers live on farming and subsistence agriculture. The monthly income of a whole family is
between 7.7 US$ to 38.5 US$. Obviously, many families can’t even afford health
care or school fees, what we consider in Europe as basics. The vision of
MILECHILD is to offer these financially underprivileged children a good
education and a safe place, far away from the problems many children face at
home. We believe that a good education is the best condition for improving
their situation in the future. The school is run by four local teachers and
helpers. The project is funded by donators from around the world and by many
volunteers who work for free to fight poverty. Check out our website for more
information: www.milechild.org
Martin, the local leader of the organisation, has already identified the issue and started to build a new, bigger school. In the end, the new school building shall include
three classrooms, what will allow separate classrooms for children of different
ages and thus different education levels. By the hard work of Martin, many
volunteers, local workers and the financial support of both international and
local donators, one classroom has already been finished within the last year.
This is one big step in the right direction, but there is still a need for at
least a second classroom to further relax the situation.
The second classroom is really, really necessary to
provide the children with a beautiful and safe environment. Our goal is to let
them feel that they are not always on the poor side of life and worth visiting
such a school. Since MILECHILD Foundation is currently struggling to raise
enough money for being able to finish the second classroom, your contribution
for a blackboard, softboards, tiles, windows, a door and paint would be a huge
step forward for this project. Our current aim is to raise 1000 US Dollar, what
will enable us to start with the work. All in all, an amount of approximately
3000 US Dollar is necessary in order to totally finish the work on the
classroom.
Help us to turn miles of problems into smiles in the faces of the children.
Every donation supports them. As a small “Thank you” for your support, check
out the perks we promise to send to every fundraiser. Of course, every donor
will be kept up to date about the progress of the classroom construction. If
you should have any questions, feel free to contact me at Windsheimer.Max@googlemail.com._____________________________________________________________________________
Der auf dem Titelbild
abgebildete Raum ist eines der zwei winzigen Klassenzimmer der Milchechild
Nursery School, die sich in einem kleinen Dorf nahe der Stadt Masaka in Uganda
befindet. 43 ugandische Kinder, die sich den Besuch einer profitorientierten
Privatschule nicht leisten können, gehen hier zur Schule und lernen in den
ungefährt 20 m² großen Klassenzimmern Englisch, Naturwissenschaften, Lesen,
Schreiben, Kunstunterricht, Musik und Mathematik.
Ich bin Max Windsheimer
aus Deutschland und hatte vor etwa vier Wochen im Rahmen einer Reise durch Süd-
und Ostafrika bei MILECHILD ein freiwilliges Praktikum begonnen. Direkt am
ersten Arbeitstag war offensichtlich, dass die beiden Klassenzimmer für die Kinder
viel zu klein sind. Alle der 43 Schulkinder teilen sich einen einzigen Tisch
und ein paar Stühle. Weil die Kinder so eng aufeinandersitzen, neigen sie
untereinander immer wieder zu kleineren Aggressionen.
MILECHILD Foundation ist
eine lokale, gemeindebasierte und gemeinnützige Organisation und somit im Gegensatz
zu „normalen“ Unternehmen nicht auf den monetären Profit ausgelegt. Wir
unterstützen leidenschaftlich Kinder in ihren Schulen, Weisen, Familien und die
gesamte Dorfgemeinde. MILECHILD Foundation wurde von Martin Mubiru gegründet. Martin
wurde nur wenige Kilometer von Kabale Lutete Kisoso, wo sich die Nursery School
befindet, geboren. Die Lebensbedingungen im Lutete Kisoso Dorf sind noch immer
sehr schlecht. Nahezu alle Dorfbewohner leben als Bauern und damit vor allem
von der Subsistenzwirtschaft (sie leben also von ihren eigenen Erzeugnissen).
Das durchschnittliche Monatseinkommen einer gesamten Familie liegt zwischen 7,7
US$ und 38,5 US$. In Anbetracht dessen ist es offensichtlich, dass viele
Familien Dinge wie medizinische Hilfe und Schulgebühren, die für uns in Europa
selbstverständlich sind, nicht selbst bezahlen können. Die Vision von Milechild
ist es, finanziell benachteiligten Kindern eine gute Bildung und einen sicheren
Ort zu bieten, weit weg von den Problemen, denen die Kinder zu Hause ausgesetzt
sind. Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass eine gute Schulbildung die beste
Voraussetzung ist, die Lebenssituation der Kinder und Gemeinde in Zukunft zu
verbessern. In der Schule arbeiten zwei lokale Lehrerinnen und zwei
Unterstützerinnen von diesen. Finanziert wird das Projekt von Spendern und
anderen Unterstützern weltweit und vielen Voluntären, die unbezahlt an ihrem
Ziel arbeiten, Armut zu bekämpfen. Schau doch mal auf unsere Website, dort
findest du noch mehr Informationen (wenn auch nur in Englisch): www.milechild.org
Martin, der lokale
Vorsitzende der Organisation, hat das Platzproblem schon erkannt und damit
begonnen, eine neue, größere Schule in nur fünf Minuten Entfernung von der
alten Schule zu bauen.Wenn das neue Schulgebäude fertiggestellt ist, soll es
drei Klassenräume enthalten. Dies erlaubt es, Kinder verschiedenen Alters und
verschiedener Bildungslevel getrennt voneinander zu unterrichten. Durch die
harte Arbeit von Martin, vielen Freiwilligen und der Unterstützung von sowohl
nationalen als auch internationalen Spendern konnte ein Klassenzimmer im Laufe
des letzten Jahres bereits fertiggestellt werden. Dies ist ein Schritt in die
richtige Richtung, aber es besteht immer noch eine große Notwendigkeit für ein
zweites Klassenzimmer, mit dem die Situation deutlich entspannt werden könnte.
Der zweite Klassenraum
ist wirklich notwendig, um den Kinder tatsächlich eine schöne und sichere
Umgebung bieten zu können. Unser Ziel ist es, dass die Kinder auch fühlen
können, dass sie nicht immer auf der armen Seite des Lebens stehen und es Wert
sind, eine solche Schule besuchen zu können. Da MILECHILD Foundation derzeit
damit zu kämpfen hat, genug Geld für die Fertigstellung des zweiten
Klassenzimmers zu sammeln, wäre eure Unterstützung für eine Tafel, Softboards,
Fließen, Fenster, eine Tür und Farbe für unser Projekt ein großer Schritt nach
vorne. Unser derzeitiges Ziel ist es 1000 US Dollar zu sammeln, womit wir mit
den Bauarbeiten beginnen könnten. Alles in allem sind noch etwa 3000 US Dollar
nötig, um die Arbeiten am neuen Klassenzimmer komplett fertigzusstellen.
Hilf uns, den Kindern
trotz aller Probleme ein Lächeln ins Gesicht zu zaubern. Jede Spende
unterstützt sie. Werfe doch mal einen Blick auf die Perks, die wir jedem
Spender als kleines Dankeschön zukommen lassen werden. Natürlich wird jeder
Spender über den Fortschritt der Bauarbeiten auf dem Laufenden gehalten.
Solltest du irgendwelche Fragen haben, dann kannst du mich gerne kontaktieren:
Windsheimer.Max@googlemail.com

story:
Short Summary

Primary Colours Academy aims to equip students with the skills they need to leave education and enter the workplace.

Claudine Adeyemi set up The Student Development Co. C.I.C earlier this year to help support students in any way she could!  She constantly came across young people who had concerns about their future careers and life after college or university and wanted to provide them with a framework of support.

Primary Colours Academy is the organisation's first initiative which was successfully piloted earlier this year.  It is a series of employability skills workshops combined with opportunities for delegates to network with professionals and recruiters.  Each series will be able to accommodate around 60 students.  Primary Colours Academy is completely free for students and Claudine wants to ensure that it stays this way!

Claudine is passionate about the development of young people and has recently been nominated for a National Diversity Award for being a positive role model to young people.

By contributing from as little as £5, you will give students across the UK the opportunity to attend Primary Colours Academy to prepare for working life.

The Contribution. The Reward.

Claudine is seeking £4,000 to cover the cost of running Primary Colours Academy for a whole academic year.  The money will be used to meet the cost of venues, workshop facilitators, workshop materials and refreshments as well as the costs of marketing the initiative.

If for some reason the goal is not reached, the money will be used as far as possible to run Primary Colours Academy but may mean a reduction in the number of students able to benefit from the sessions and/or the frequency of the series throughout the academic year.

If the £4,000 goal is exceeded the funds will be used towards increasing the frequency of the series throughout the academic year and continuing to run Primary Colours Academy after the first academic year.

Once this initial £4,000 has been used, the aim is for Primary Colours Academy to be sponsored by businesses who are interested in helping young people to succeed - potentially young people those businesses will employ!

Aside from the tingling feeling you'll get inside when you donate, we will show our appreciation with one of the rewards on the right --------------------------------------->

Impact


Claudine has spent a considerable amount of time researching this area and found that employers are constantly citing a lack of employability skills as the reason many young people fail to succeed in the workplace.  

In addition, students themselves have regularly told Claudine that they do not feel ready for work, for example, they are concerned that they do not have enough confidence or do not think they have the skills to effectively communicate with colleagues, clients and customers.

The pilot sessions of Primary Colours Academy received amazing feedback:

  • "Very good indeed :)"
  • "Very informative session"
  • "Really amazing and inspiring and I am thankful that this programme was created - it really re-enforced my motivation"

Some of the things our students said they learnt at the pilot session:

  • "How to manage my mind"
  • "Ways to improve confidence"
  • "The importance of active listening"

Claudine believes it is important that those in a position to help young people do as much as they can; it's a cliche but there is no doubt that young people are the future! 

So whether you can share a story to inspire, give some advice based on your knowledge and experience or contribute a sum to this initiative - please do something!



THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

story:
Summary

My name is Sonam Choden. I am 23 years old and from Sumthrang, a village in Central Bhutan. I hail from an old religious lineage called Ngoe lineage of which the famous Tibetan saint Pema Lingpa also was a descendant. All my life I have been passionate about Buddhism in all its facets and particularly about Buddhist philosophy. Finally, my dream has come true when I was offered a place at the University of Hamburg to pursue a Master of Arts in Tibetan Studies. You can find my acceptance letter in the image galery. It has always been my dream to study Tibetology particularly with Prof. Dorji Wangchuk, who is originally from Bhutan and one of the most eminent scholars in the field: 

http://www.kc-tbts.uni-hamburg.de/index.php/startseite/46-cvs/60-dorji-wangchuk

I am determined and very passionate about gaining knowledge in Buddhist studies from an Academic perspective. I have everything I need to study... except the financial requirements.  

What I Need & What You Get

  • I need to produce at least 8000 EUR on a German blocked bank account to get my visa to Germany and to commence my studies in October 2014
  • The sole purpose of the 8000 EUR will be for living expenses, health insurance, transport and student fees in my first year of studies
  • While in Germany I can apply for funding for my second year which I am confident to secure but first I have to get there
  • To be honest: it is difficult for me as a young Bhutanese student to offer you much in return but I am sure that you will gain a lot of merit by supporting me. Also I will set up a blog or website where you can follow my progress and keep in touch.
  • Furthermore I will try my best to send a letter of thanks enclosing a small gift from Bhutan 

The Impact

If I get to go and study Tibetology at Hamburg University it would be a breakthrough for Bhutanese women who would like to become Buddhist scholars but are not nurtured in their aspiration in a country where males have been favored in such a field. But not only that. It will also proof to young women in general that it is worthwhile pursuing your dream - even as a young woman - and that there is a real chance to achieve what you dream to become for yourself. I hope to become an example for young women of humble background.  

Furthermore, if I pursue my studies in Tibetology at Hamburg University, it will have a major impact on the textual research community in Bhutan because as of now there are not much textual scholars in Bhutan who possess the tools and methods of a Western Academic approach. I would love to contribute to the work of the Khentse Center for Tibetan Buddhist Textual Scholarship in the future: http://www.kc-tbts.uni-hamburg.de/

Other Ways You Can Help

I am deeply grateful for any contribution. However, if you do not have the means I will understand. But please try to share my story with others so that they will have a chance to contribute by using the Indiegogo share tools

story:
Welcome to My Slice of Paradise!

Hello! My name is Ashley Sherman, I am 19 years old and am from a small town called Chuluota. My whole life my twin and I have grown up working in the barn with horses and training and riding these beautiful animals. But my love for animals doesn't stop there. Recently I have decided to pursue mine (and every child growing up with SeaWorld)s dream as a marine mammal trainer!


Growing up with one arm was difficult for me in my earlier years. I could never figure out why people and other children would stare at me or why I could never do things that my able bodied twin could do. For me, I never saw anyone who was like me and as a result of that started to believe that I was the only one in the world with this disability. As I grew older I later figured out that was not true, and became inspired by so many individuals who grew up with a disability.

My Goal in life is solely to inspire others, and encourage them by saying "Its okay to be yourself" and "Don't let your disability hold you back from anything you want to do." But I would like to express that through performance and connection with animals. Because I believe that animals have the power to say things that humans cannot.

To become a marine mammal trainer at SeaWorld Parks and Entertainment, I need to be SCUBA certified. Unfortunately, that is the only thing holding me back from achieving my dreams. Working two jobs is only enough to pay the bills, and buy gas to drive to and from work. Also the money that I make goes directly to my horse and helping with the house payment.

    The Cost of the course itself is;

    $440

    This is for the following

    • Education Packet (Books, DVD, log book, dive tables)
    • Equipment Rental
    • Classroom Fees
    • Pool Fees
    • Lake Fees
    • Boat Fees
    • Certification Fees

story:
NOTE: This campaign was started on Fundrazr.com, but due to some logistical  issues, I've transferred it over to Indiegogo. Worry not, supporters! All the money we had collected is now in this fundraising website. So the campaign is still going strong!


Short Summary

My name is Attilio Rigotti, a undergraduate theater student from Chile, currently about to graduate from NYU Abu Dhabi. My college experience has been incredibly transformative and has allowed me to discover my passion for the arts, and particularly, my desire to pursue an acting career in the upcoming years. In these past four years, I have worked with companies and artists throughout Europe, North and South America and the Middle East, acting in shows in Florence (Italy), New York City (USA), Santiago (Chile) and Abu Dhabi (UAE). As college comes to an end, I find myself asking about my role as an artist in telling stories, acting and making theater as well as what I want life to be. The future is uncertain, but also exciting due to some amazing opportunities that have come up in the last couple of months.

I have been invited to study this summer with Witness Relocation and Theater Mitu, two ground-breaking NYC-based theater companies. I was lucky enough to work with Witness Relocation last year and with Theater Mitu since 2011.

Here's some info on Witness Relocation:
witnessrelocation.org
http://witnessrelocation.org/past-workshops/summer-bootcamp/


Here's some info on Theater Mitu and their program:
www.theatermitu.org
http://www.theatermitu.org/education/international-intensives/siai-2014/

I would begin training with Witness Relocation from June 22nd until July 4th in the Catskills Mountains of Upstate New York, and then take a plane to India with Theater Mitu, where I will practice in Bangalore with Indian artists from the region.

But I can't do it without your help! I'm thrilled to share these opportunities with you, but I will need your support to make them happen. Working with these companies is an incredible start for a more advanced training as an actor, allowing me to begin strong in my goal to be an actor. It would be a dream come true to be able to actually work with these companies not as student anymore, but as an actor-in-training!


What We Need & What You Get

The total cost of both programs is $5700 ($1800 for Witness Relocation and $3900 for Theater Mitu's program). This includes the trip to/from India (for Mitu's intensive), all classes training, room, board, food, tourist visas, etc.  

If we collect more than our goal, then that will go into helping me pay for a flight from Chile to NYC, where the first intensive (Witness Relocation's) is happening. 

I have never made an appeal to my community like this before, but the truth is, I won't be able to accomplish it without your help! I will be forever grateful! I'll owe you one, and a Chilean always keeps his promises.

Every single person who supports this campaign will be able to keep track of my summer training through a written and video blog, that will start on June 22nd and be updated daily!

We are also working on other perks! Stay tuned! 


The Impact

In this coming spring, I will have to face one of the most important transitions of my life, moving from being a college student to continue my training to become a skilled drama professional. Throughout my college education, I have become obsessed with storytelling, in particular, theater, film and interactive art. As I move out into the world, I have begun to ask myself:

What do I think an artist is? What exactly are the stories I want to tell? What are the beliefs and myths and tales I find exciting and what are the tools I need to express them? What do I find exciting about the world itself, and how can I use that to empower my work? How can I stay true to myself and avoid the pressure to become someone I'm not?

I believe working with these companies can help answer these questions, and with your help, begin my journey as an artist. I cannot think of any better moment to do these intensives than now, and I'm inviting you to become my artistic sponsor! You will be directly helping me become a better artist. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate but still want to help? Share this fundraiser effort with anyone who would be interested! Spread the word! I'd be eternally grateful.

Or use some of the Indiegogo tools to share this campaign through Facebook, Twitter and other social media!



As we say in Chile, un abrazote gigantezco! (An enormous hug!)
story_txt: NOTE: This campaign was started on Fundrazr.com, but due to some logistical  issues, I've transferred it over to Indiegogo. Worry not, supporters! All the money we had collected is now in this fundraising website. So the campaign is still going strong!Short SummaryMy name is Attilio Rigotti, a undergraduate theater student from Chile, currently about to graduate from NYU Abu Dhabi. My college experience has been incredibly transformative and has allowed me to discover my passion for the arts, and particularly, my desire to pursue an acting career in the upcoming years. In these past four years, I have worked with companies and artists throughout Europe, North and South America and the Middle East, acting in shows in Florence (Italy), New York City (USA), Santiago (Chile) and Abu Dhabi (UAE). As college comes to an end, I find myself asking about my role as an artist in telling stories, acting and making theater as well as what I want life to be. The future is uncertain, but also exciting due to some amazing opportunities that have come up in the last couple of months.I have been invited to study this summer with Witness Relocation and Theater Mitu, two ground-breaking NYC-based theater companies. I was lucky enough to work with Witness Relocation last year and with Theater Mitu since 2011. Here's some info on Witness Relocation:witnessrelocation.orghttp://witnessrelocation.org/past-workshops/summer-bootcamp/Here's some info on Theater Mitu and their program:www.theatermitu.orghttp://www.theatermitu.org/education/international-intensives/siai-2014/I would begin training with Witness Relocation from June 22nd until July 4th in the Catskills Mountains of Upstate New York, and then take a plane to India with Theater Mitu, where I will practice in Bangalore with Indian artists from the region.But I can't do it without your help! I'm thrilled to share these opportunities with you, but I will need your support to make them happen. Working with these companies is an incredible start for a more advanced training as an actor, allowing me to begin strong in my goal to be an actor. It would be a dream come true to be able to actually work with these companies not as student anymore, but as an actor-in-training!What We Need & What You GetThe total cost of both programs is $5700 ($1800 for Witness Relocation and $3900 for Theater Mitu's program). This includes the trip to/from India (for Mitu's intensive), all classes training, room, board, food, tourist visas, etc.  If we collect more than our goal, then that will go into helping me pay for a flight from Chile to NYC, where the first intensive (Witness Relocation's) is happening. I have never made an appeal to my community like this before, but the truth is, I won't be able to accomplish it without your help! I will be forever grateful! I'll owe you one, and a Chilean always keeps his promises.Every single person who supports this campaign will be able to keep track of my summer training through a written and video blog, that will start on June 22nd and be updated daily!We are also working on other perks! Stay tuned! The ImpactIn this coming spring, I will have to face one of the most important transitions of my life, moving from being a college student to continue my training to become a skilled drama professional. Throughout my college education, I have become obsessed with storytelling, in particular, theater, film and interactive art. How can I stay true to myself and avoid the pressure to become someone I'm not?I believe working with these companies can help answer these questions, and with your help, begin my journey as an artist. I cannot think of any better moment to do these intensives than now, and I'm inviting you to become my artistic sponsor! You will be directly helping me become a better artist. Other Ways You Can HelpCan't donate but still want to help? Share this fundraiser effort with anyone who would be interested! Spread the word! I'd be eternally grateful.Or use some of the Indiegogo tools to share this campaign through Facebook, Twitter and other social media!As we say in Chile, un abrazote gigantezco! (An enormous hug!)

story:
Be a part of bringing the magic of birthday parties to disadvantaged children.

My purpose is to live out generosity in a way that makes a local and global difference. I am starting in my own backyard.  In my city of Columbus, Ohio.  I am bringing Confetti of Hope parties to my community and I want to invite YOU into the excitement!

the why.

In June, 2013, My son, Dallas, and I started volunteering at The Homeless Families Foundation.  They are an organization that educates and nurtures children while empowering families to achieve stable housing and self-sufficiency.  After just a short time of working with the team at HFF and learning more about homelessness, my heart broke and I knew I had to do something about it.

I have a passion for children, serving in my community & throwing awesome parties.  With my desire to make a difference in the life of children, I started my non-profit organization, Confetti of Hope Foundation.

the mission.

The mission is to bring birthday parties to disadvantaged children in the community of Columbus, Ohio.

Many disadvantaged children are living in shelters, group homes, foster care or other non-traditional living situations where events like birthday parties are secondary in importance and often overlooked.

Confetti of Hope believes that all children, regardless of their living situation, should be celebrated on their birthday and experience the magic of a birthday party. 

what we do.

From birthday parties, back-to-school parties to big community parties, our charity is committed to making a difference in the lives of children in Columbus, Ohio.

We offer more than balloons, streamers and birthday cake – we offer hope & joy. We create a positive memory for children that will give them a sense of normalcy & empower their caregivers.

Ever wonder what your donation is used for when helping our project?

I could not do this without YOU.

I am truly grateful for each and every one of you & your support.  Thank you for supporting my mission and helping me bring hope & joy to children's lives.

Other ways you can help.

If you can’t contribute with money, I understand but there are other ways to help me bring birthday parties to disadvantaged children in Columbus, Ohio:

  • Share your mad designing skills and become a contributor

  • Share this page. Maybe someone else you know can help! 

  • Volunteer your time and celebrate with us at the first birthday party. Hop on over to our facebook page & send me a message.  I would love to hear from you.

Changing the world.  Not yet.  Changing little hearts.  Absolutely!

Thank you,

story:
UPDATE ON CAMPAIGN -

Today 17 August there are many children who have managed to get to safety.. but they are in dire need of basic supplies..... they need safekeeping and protection - they are still at risk...
Please help me help those on the ground provide safekeeping for these children who deserve the love and nurturing that all children require. 

These children are at risk still - please contribute and let's do what is right and protect those that will be our leaders in the next generation! 
As of now Friday 15 August most of the people have been rescued off the mountain! There does remain a few thousand people stranded still.  But the situation is being dealt with!
There is still urgent requirement for assistance in this project!
There are thousands of children who have lost parents in the massacre during their escape to the mountain - The funds raised in this campaign will now be sued towards supporting these children.
Ensuring that they have their basic needs met, food, shelter, clothing and education.


I will partner with organisations, agencies and charities on the ground who will manage the requirements of the children and together we will assist in rebuilding the lives of these children - they are the adults of our future - when they receive nurture today - they will grow up to be nurturing adults - and will contribute to the stabilisation of their nation! 

Short Summary

This is a reach out to you - to please help the folk who are at serious risk of dying of starvation and dehydration and are stranded on top of barren mountains in Iraq  as they escape certain death should they go down.

Relief helicopters have started evacuating some - but according to the Iraqi authorities it could take up to 500 days to remove the 50 000+ refugees at the current rate is evacuation - THEY WILL NOT LIVE THAT LONG!

The Iraqi authorities have reached out to the US and UK governments but as we all know it is August and holiday time -  and the leaders of both countries are on holiday - and whilst I appreciate they may have their respective fingers on the pulse - they will need to deliberate, discuss, negotiate (peerages etc) before anything gets done - in the meantime how many more people including young kids will die in agony???

There is a lot of debate and promises... but nothing concrete happening - and as we all know any assistance will undoubtedly have an element of political motivation (here is a link to a report in today's dailymail)

THIS IS NOT A POLITICALLY MOTIVATED CALL FOR ACITON guys - this is me - an ordinary person who just can not stand by any longer and do nothing asking you to join me as ordinary folk in making a difference to the lives of as many as we can - even if it is just ONE PERSON..OR ONE CHILD!

There is so much strive and struggle all over the world at the moment and so many lives being lost - but this is something I think we can do something about...

We need to get aircraft over there  - AS QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE to get these stranded people out!

We need to supply them with water, food and medical supplies..

EVEN IF WE JUST SAVE THE LIFE ON 1 CHILD - surely that is worth it??

I see on Facebook so many people making references to the conflict over Gaza - hundreds of comments from people saying - we can't stand by and let this happen - and yes I agree - but sometimes the solution is more challenging for ordinary folk like you and me - but in this case it is different - YOU AND I CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE!

It is my wish and intention with this campaign to achieve two things -

1) Raise money to engage the services of providers who can fly in and rescue to stranded men, women and children.

2) Challenge (in the most respectful manner) those with the resources and social connections to rally in and engage their network in assisting this humanitarian cause.

Yesterday (11 August 2014) an amazing and gifted person left this planet - Robin Williams - he left a phenomenal legacy, the outpouring of sincere sorrow at his passing has been INCREDIBLE -  we all remember the pure joy he gave us and the wonderful belly laughs he allowed us - I recall watching him during the darkest years of my life - when I was incarcerated against my will, raped, beaten and shot over a period of almost 2 decades - but his shows Morc and Mindy were the highlights of my week and watching him was a tonic for my soul..... his legacy was the joy he brought to people - your legacy can be the lives you save of innocent children...

Robin Williams is quoted as saying "No matter what people tell you words and ideas CAN CHANGE the world"

And he is right!  you and me can send a clear message that we will not stand by as our brothers, sisters, mothers, fathers, aunts, uncles are being slaughtered - and abandoned!

In doing so we will be saving the lives of many - the number of which depends on how much this campaign is supported!!


What We Need & What You Get

This call to action is unlike ANY other crowd fund campaign and is certainly going against everything I advise my clients on raising money with crowd funding..

I am launching this without any joint venture plans - without any strategy - other than to rely on millions of people who feel the same as I do about this!

Time is critical - we need to act quickly - lives are at high risk! 

I have no rewards to offer - in fact I can not think of any at this stage - other than the pure soul felt compassion of knowing that you did something today to save the life of a child!

And hopefully at the end of the campaign more than a child but tens of thousands of people!

If you would love to recommend or suggest what could be offered as reward I am open to ideas!!

I also invite as much assistance as possible!! 

I intend to raise enough money to engage the services of those that can proactively rescue those people stranded on top of the barren Mountain in Iraq and furthermore to supply them with immediate relief in the form of shelter - in whatever form that takes - food, water and medical supplies - AS QUICK AS HUMANLY POSSIBLE!

And that depends on you - donating and sharing this campaign with your network as quickly as possible!


    The Impact

    You and I as ordinary folk going about our daily lives - comfortable with our daily challenges of making ends meat, or saving for annual holidays, or cramming in studies or experiencing hiccups in marriages, or naughty teens giving headaches... can not comprehend what desperation the men, women and children are experiencing as they languish on the mountain with no way of escaping alive! 

    It puts our stresses, worries, frustrations all into harsh perspective! 

    Donating even £10 and sharing and encouraging your network to match or better your donation has the collective potential to make a real difference to the lives of tens of thousands of people - so please do it!

    I also urge you to send this link to your local media - to blog posts and online magazines... 

      Risks & Challenges

      I know that I can not make a difference on my own!  I can not promise that I will reach enough people in enough time to make a difference even to the life of 1 child!

      I have no plan cast in stone as yet - I do not have helicopters on stand by - I do not have access to the likes of Richard Branson who amazed the world with his brave rescue mission many years ago sending in a Virgin Atlantic 747 to Iraq with much needed and valuable supplies here is the link with more info on that story. (courtesy of dailymail.co.uk) 

      But I do know that with enough traction - enough support - enough awareness - this campaign can raise enough funds and engage the interest of many with phenomenal influence and resources so that collectively we can make a plan that is concrete - and more importantly - save the lives of thousands!! 

      Look at what you and I did a couple of decades ago when Bob Geldof called on us to assist with Live Aid! I do not even dare to compare this campaign with the enormity of what he did - but I highlight it to demonstrate what we individuals can do! 

      History has proven that ordinary folk can make a difference!

      I do not have a charity - I do not have the resources on standby at this stage - but I have the intention!

      Without funds I am unable to engage the services of those who can do the practical work of saving the lives of those children stranded - many of whom have lost their families as they escaped the villages!

      I ask you to take the risk with me - make a donation and be part of a movement and do what you can to encourage others to donate!

      With enough traction and awareness we will attract, cajole and encourage the involvement of those with tremendous resources to assist us in our endeavours! 

      I can not think of a quicker more powerful way to mobilise and engage a large number of people than through a crowd fund campaign! 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you really are unable to contribute then please send this campaign to your network - daily - and to your local media - or mention it in your blog posts - whatever you can think of to assist in making this venture globally viral!

        If you can assist in any other way - like connecting this campaign with someone with influence and resources please do so!

        If you can assist in a practical manner in any way that would be much appreciated and most welcome! 


          You and I can save the lives of tens of thousands of people with this simple campaign!  Thank you for taking the time to read this! Wishing you a blessed day, love and gratitude Judy.

story:
Short Summary

  • I am an adult learner who just graduated from college at the age of 30.  
  • I overcame a lot of adversity to get here (including some very difficult times with my family after coming out to them as a member of the LGBT community).
  • I need to get a better job in order to pay my student loans, but almost all HR Management openings require a Professional Human Resources (PHR) Certificate.
  • My 7 month old eats all my money.  Please help fund me to get my PHR so that I can support my family and pay my student loans!

What I Need & What You Get

  • All funds will go towards the cost of the PHR exam.
  • In exchange for your monetary donation, I will be happy to provide you with feedback on your resume!  I can also provide you with advice on good questions for candidates to ask during the interview stage.  I have worked in Talent Acquisition for the last 3 years.
  • If I do not reach my goal, all funds will go into a dedicated savings account that I will continue to contribute to until I have enough funds to take the exam.

    Risks & Challenges

    • The risk is that I will fail the exam.
    • What qualifies me to overcome these hurdles? I graduated with a degree in Human Resources with a 4.0 GPA.  The knowledge is all still fresh in my mind.
    • I will study my butt off!
    • There is also a risk that I will not qualify to take the exam (they don't tell you if you qualify until you apply and pay the fee).  If this is the case, I will use the funds to take the HRBP exam instead.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

    • Please help get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My story

I want  to share my story, After leaving Somalia in the 1994 civic war , I went to Ethiopia and stayed there for three years without any schooling or work. After that I got my visa for Canada in 1997 and I moved to Toronto and then I started my high school and along with that working full time for my survival. I had worked hard on my English skills and integrating to Canadian community. In 2007 I moved to  Calgary Alberta and there I completed a child care certification and worked for two years as a day home provider . From there I moved to Red Deer for my social worker Diploma for two years. After graduating , I got full time job with Central Alberta Immigrant Women's Association (CAIWA). I am also working as Breast cancer screening Project  Coordinator. This was not as simple as it sounds, this phase of life was full of struggles, pains and sorrows. But I was always a focused and determined person who wanted to do something for my community, so they would not have to face difficult phases in their lives.  I would love to see children in Somalia flourish, and get the best of the best in their home country. So this is time that we all should put hands together to come forward for promoting education in Somalia for each child so he and she can have  his or her own secure future full of opportunities. 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 We need $ 20,000 CAD dollars to build school building, furniture, staff salaries and books for students. By this each child will get good education.
We are seeking good and motivated people to join their hands with us and donate land, raise money and educate people about this project to come ahead to sustain for long time. 

I did open account for the school funds, please feel free to donate direct "Education for Somalian Girls and Boys" " Community Plan #221-523-4043 " 
Thank you so much for your kindness support and contribution in advance:)! Peace/love to you all:)!!!! 


The Impact

We are seeking to create a global impact and need hundreds of more people to come forward to raise campaign awareness, so that we can contribute maximum to this project.

As for 22 years Somalia suffered from so many problems like civic war, drought, famine and so many kids die of malnutrition. So now we should educate people as much as we can to bring Somalia from all troubles which Somalia has gone through. 

This is the first project, we are working on and it needs a lot of support to succeed.  We also hope to have many more projects in future.


Risks & Challenges

 If this campaign is promoted by all of us by telling a lot of people and for whom we are working and what will be the benefit to the community, half the battle will be won.
All that is needs is focused, determined individuals and social workers for this project and their support will be valuable.
 

Other Ways You Can Help 

We ask whosever is aware about this campaign to promote it through social media, television and radio channels. 

Thank you
story_txt:
My story
I want  to share my story, After leaving Somalia in the 1994 civic war , I went to Ethiopia and stayed there for three years without any schooling or work. After that I got my visa for Canada in 1997 and I moved to Toronto and then I started my high school and along with that working full time for my survival. I had worked hard on my English skills and integrating to Canadian community. In 2007 I moved to  Calgary Alberta and there I completed a child care certification and worked for two years as a day home provider . From there I moved to Red Deer for my social worker Diploma for two years. After graduating , I got full time job with Central Alberta Immigrant Women's Association (CAIWA). I am also working as Breast cancer screening Project  Coordinator. This was not as simple as it sounds, this phase of life was full of struggles, pains and sorrows. But I was always a focused and determined person who wanted to do something for my community, so they would not have to face difficult phases in their lives.  I would love to see children in Somalia flourish, and get the best of the best in their home country. So this is time that we all should put hands together to come forward for promoting education in Somalia for each child so he and she can have  his or her own secure future full of opportunities.      What We Need & What You Get We need $ 20,000 CAD dollars to build school building, furniture, staff salaries and books for students. By this each child will get good education.We are seeking good and motivated people to join their hands with us and donate land, raise money and educate people about this project to come ahead to sustain for long time. I did open account for the school funds, please feel free to donate direct "Education for Somalian Girls and Boys" " Community Plan #221-523-4043 " Thank you so much for your kindness support and contribution in advance:)! Peace/love to you all:)!!!!   The Impact We are seeking to create a global impact and need hundreds of more people to come forward to raise campaign awareness, so that we can contribute maximum to this project.As for 22 years Somalia suffered from so many problems like civic war, drought, famine and so many kids die of malnutrition. So now we should educate people as much as we can to bring Somalia from all troubles which Somalia has gone through. This is the first project, we are working on and it needs a lot of support to succeed.  We also hope to have many more projects in future.
  Risks & Challenges If this campaign is promoted by all of us by telling a lot of people and for whom we are working and what will be the benefit to the community, half the battle will be won.All that is needs is focused, determined individuals and social workers for this project and their support will be valuable.   Other Ways You Can Help  We ask whosever is aware about this campaign to promote it through social media, television and radio channels. 
Thank you

story:
Help Independence Live crowdfunder to continue to deliver genuine & authentic voices like Yanis Varoufakis...
INDY LIVE CHRISTMAS CROWDFUNDER

What our supporters say...

Lesley Riddoch, Marie, John Drummond, Alan Bissett, Derek Bateman, Jonathon Shafi, Pat Kane, Jim Sillars, Ivan McKee, Stewart Bremner, Cliff Purvis (veterans for indy)...

Independence Live is now over 2 year old. We have done over 550+ livestreams and counting. We would like to ask you for you continued support through this Christmas & New Year period to help keep our only Indy Live full-timer with us.


What have we been up to & what are we doing?

* through collaborations we are building closer relationships with the new Scottish media
* expanding our team of volunteers through our own efforts and collaborations with other groups (see NationalYesRegistry below)
* continued development of our new iOS and Android apps


Collaborations with the new Scottish media...

KILTR, CommonSpace, Bella Caledonia and IndepenenceLive.net collaboration

No to Trade Union Bill: No to Austerity SPEAKERS: Nicola Sturgeon MSP (7:15pm) Jeremy Corbyn MP (9pm), Grahame Smith, Chris Stephens MP, Aamer Anwar Jenny Marra MSP. MUSIC: The Wakes Maeve Mackinnon Glasgow Royal Concert Hall, 10th of December 2015.

Watch livestream here: Click for Liveststream Video


CommonSpace.scot and IndepenenceLive.net collaboration.


In collaboration with Scotland's very own social network KILTR.com & online media CommonSpace, IndependenceLive.net brings you an interview with academic and economist Yanis Varoufakis.

In collaboration with KILTR.com, IndependenceLive.net brings you an interview with Professor Noam Chomsky.


NationalYesRegistry

With Jason Baird founder of the National Yes Registry we aim to offer our expertise and help to local pro-indy groups through Scotland on how-to-livestream and will be providing workshops at the NationalYesRegistry event for pro-Indy groups in Largs on December the 5th. http://nationalyesregistry.scot/

Independence Live chatting with Jason Baird about the National Yes Registry.

Please support us, thanks :)

story:
Our Story:

God has given us the vision of starting Veritas Academy, a Classical Christian educational option for those looking for an alternative to today's culture and government run schools.

It has been a long journey over the past two years of God leading us to the decision of purchasing our own building. Leasing space, our initial goal, would have meant submitting our school's goals to those of a different entity, paying large sums of money towards someone else’s goals, and living at the mercy of another who can expel us at anytime that our presence becomes inconvenient to them.

At last, an opportunity to purchase our own property has opened up, with the permanence, flexibility, and security that accompanies it. This structure, originally built in 1991, and updated and expanded over 23 years, features 17,000 square feet of usable space, 10+ acres, and a secluded setting in which students will be able to grow in moral character and civic virtue.

Our Need:

In order for Veritas to open its doors this fall, we need to raise $165,000. We believe that this structure will provide a home in which children can learn, grow, and expand their love of truth ("veritas" in Latin) in a world where truth is often dismissed. Beyond truth, investing in Veritas' high quality program is investing in our community, our state, and our country. 

The Impact:

The need for an affordable, quality Christian school in the classical tradition has never been greater; Veritas Academy is committed to providing the best possible education to help increase leadership potential in Minnesota's north metro area. As evidenced through the Association of Classical and Christian Schools (ACCS) data from 2013, ACCS member schools like Veritas Academy that offer classical Christian education consistently achieve higher than public, independent and other religious schools. Yet families in communities such as North Branch lack the opportunity to make these choices. Consider your ability to join in the great work of raising the next generation of moral leaders in business, academy, society and the church.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends about us. Ask your friends to contribute.

story:
My name is Alexandra Thompson and I am a junior and the University of Kentucky studying Psychology and Spanish. I have been accepted into a program that will be traveling to Lima, Peru for six weeks. During this six weeks we will be visiting various healthcare establishments assisting and providing care those we meet. This program is important to me because for years I've wanted to go on a mission trip and now that I have been granted the opportunity my soul is excited. Some the specific places that we will be visiting are a children's rehab for kids who are intellectually, physically and sensorially disabled, a daycare for children 5 years and younger, various hospitals and labs. We will be participating in therapy programs and work shops, coordinating and implementing healthcare campaigns and working directly with chemistry and biology technicians. I have the heart of a servant and desire to help those who can't themselves or don't have the resources to do so. Traveling to Peru for this program is the perfect opportunity for me to accomplish one of the things I've always wanted to do which is to travel for a better cause as well as give me experience for my career goals.

. Although this is a service abroad program I will be receiving class credit from the University. All contributions will go towards program fees, tuition and airfare.

The Impact

This program will not only benefit those that we will be helping during our stay in Peru but it will allow me to
  • Gain a deeper understanding of service provision in other countries
  • Examine what it means to be an "active citizen" in a global community through engagement and active reflection
  • Develop proficiency in Spanish language and gain a deeper understanding of the impact and importance of a global perspective on healthcare
  • Experience the language, history and culture of Peru - including a group excursion to Machu Picchu

story:
Short Summary

Since 2010, Apiaries and Bees for Communities (A.B.C) is a Calgary based social-entrepreneurial business that has been dedicated to improving the accessibility of beekeeping education and fostering a supportive community of urban beekeepers in Alberta.

In the spirit of community, A.B.C has created The Community Hive as our socially responsible arm of our business that does not garner a profit. The Community Hive is responsible for:

·  Collaborative purchase of Honeybees and Equipment since 2010, and has brought in over 400 colonies of bees in to Alberta for hobbyists.

·  Creates a regulating body for these beginners ensuring the beekeepers are knowledgeable and can responsibly manage the honeybees through online examinations and applications before selection and distribution

·  Hosts the Community Hive website and training sessions, which parents the Plan-Bee Swarm Catchers group allowing for citizens to remove honeybees from public and private locations FREE of charge, and offers free bees to the community (www.thecommunityhive.org)

·  Hosts the Community Hive online discussion board, home to over 400 beekeepers. Offering an opportunity to share and care for the learning process of its members (http://chat.thecommunityhive.org)

·  Free or pay-what-you-can $15 monthly hive inspections and field days for the public. These are also a potluck, allowing for community members to connect and support one another (www.backyardbees.ca)

·  We also do events! These events range from small community gatherings to iconic Calgary events like Lilac Fest and the Calgary Horticultural Society’s Garden Show. We also host our own events (Day of the Honeybee and the Yellow Tie Affair fund raisers for local charities) at the start and end of the season.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign will help to cover our costs to attend these events with any surplus going towards the Yellow Tie Affair, our year-end fundraiser in support of Women in Need Shelter. If you enjoy what we do and you appreciate the need for businesses to incorporate social and environmental investment into their activities, please help us spread the word about our campaign! If you can, pledge an amount that works for you.

Our 2014 Budget

Community Hive Bee Meeting Venue    $150

Swarm Catchers Meeting Venue     $150

Home and Garden Show Info Booth  $800

Lilac Festival  Booth $300

Discussion Board@ $53.50/mo    $642

Day of the Honeybee Event  $250

Yellow Tie Affair $500

Website  $275

TOTAL  3067.00

The Impact

At these events, ABC staff and volunteers teach the public about

·  Urban beekeeping, share educational opportunities and help them to connect with other beekeepers.

·  Threats to pollinator and honeybee health and what they can do to help.

·  How to engage with nature and recognize the potential of their own back yards to improve biodiversity

We love attending these events and connecting with other bee-lovers and have a wonderfully dedicated team of volunteers to help us. However the time and costs associated with some of the larger events limits our reach. A.B.C has been funding these events for 4 years, and although we will continue to do so, the demand and our finances aren’t there to do it all!

Other Ways You Can Help

We aren’t trying to save the world, we are only trying our best to Build the Hive Mentality in Alberta, and we would like you to join us!

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story: My name is Jules Mitchell and I am 15 years old and live in Antigua and am an avid dinghy sailor. I usually sail Laser but I want to try and qualify for Antigua to have a sailing spot at the Youth Olympic Games in China this summer. The International Byte CII Championship and Youth Olympic Games Qualifier for North America and the Caribbean will be held in Jensen Beach Feb 27 - March 2nd 2014. It is going to cost around US$9,700 per sailor to get there, Rhone Kirby, another 15 year old and me. This covers coach expenses, flights, accommodation, registration, boat rental, coach boat rental, taxi fares, etc., and we have less than 2 weeks to raise the money. The Olympic Office have generously given us some help and we have had a few donations in cash. We have now paid for the registration, boat rental and flights, so there is no turning back now. Fund raising was left very late because we were told in October that Antigua could not send sailors to the Youth Olympics, but now we know that if we qualify, Antigua can be represented. There are 4 spots left and only 8 countries that have not qualified yet, which gives us a 50 50 chance. We know the competition from previous regattas and know we have a good chance of qualifying. This is only open to sailors born in 1998 and 1999 so there is an exceptionally good chance we will win a spot in the Youth Olympics to represent Antigua in China. Rhone and I appreciate any and all help we get so that we can make it to Jensen Beach and make everyone proud. We can do this! If you do decide to donate to us on this page, it is linked to Paypal and so it is safe. We welcome your support.

story:
On Saturday, March 29th a group of four 4th grade and five 6th grade Arroyo Grande girls competed at the State of California Destination Imagination Finals and qualified to compete at the Global Finals for Destination Imagination.  These girls along with their coaches will be heading to the University of Tennessee, Knoxville as members of team California to compete at this international academic competition from May 21-24, 2014.  They need your help to make this dream come true.

Destination Imagination (DI) is a project base learning academic program where teams of 2-7 members compete to solve a Main Challenge task and an Instant Challenge.  The program encourages teams of learners to have fun, take risks, focus, and frame challenges while incorporating STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics), the arts, and service learning.  DI has over 200,000 participants with kids (3rd – 12th grade and University level) competing from over 48 States and 15 countries world-wide.  The top teams representing their respective state/country compete at the Global Finals.

“The Bananas” consists of Sarah, Lorena, Claire, and Felisa (shown below).  These girls compete in the elementary Science category of DI.  They have to research an extreme environment and create survival gear all while incorporating facts into an entertaining performance.

“The Ninjas” are Olivia, Kimberly, Shea, Claire, and Kiana (shown above) and they are competing in the middle school Fine Arts category, where they have to research a piece of artwork and turn it into a living comic strip along with an inspired “art-ifact”. Both teams also prepare for Instant Challenges which are typically engineering, technology, performance and science based tasks to solve immediately within a 5 minute or less time period. 

Central Coast DI needs to raise approximately $24,000 to cover travel expenses for these impressive young women. They are asking for your support. 

Thank you in advance for your support of our “future leaders”.
