story:
Your contribution will help to provide the resources to expand a proven, successful model of early literacy education, supporting Aboriginal mom and their preschool aged children.

HIPPY:  Home Instruction for Parents with Preschool Youngsters

  • Nanaimo Aboriginal HIPPY is a program of the Nanaimo Aboriginal Centre
  • Nanaimo Aboriginal HIPPY is free to all participating families
  • Nanaimo Aboriginal Centre is a non-profit society with a vision to support the realization of a 100% high school graduation rate for Aboriginal students.
  • A key to realizing our vision is to develop programs and services that support early childhood development from birth to Kindergarten.
  • Nanaimo Aboriginal HIPPY is one of two in British Columbia.

Research shows that when a child living in poverty is provided access to quality, early years programs, they are 30% more likely to graduate high school.  Research also shows that children living in poverty have a significantly smaller vocabulary than their classmates in Kindergarten.  Finally, research shows that the grade 3 literacy rate is now they key indicator for a student's success in high school.  HIPPY addresses all three of these issues.

Please help our program grow.

Our Goal

The goal of this campaign is to raise $32,000 during the month of April.  All funds raised will support the growth of our existing Aboriginal HIPPY program in Nanaimo, including the following items:

  • HIPPY Home Visitor - employ part-time a mom who will be trained to lead home visits and weekly sessions with program parents
  • Program supplies - each week every participating child is given a new book to keep.  Over the length of the program each child will have accumulated 30 new books.
  • Administration - a maximum of 15% of funds will cover the cost of program licensing fees, travel for the Home Visitor and office supplies.
To recognize your support, we are offering some beautiful, west coast art pieces like a hand carved red cedar panel, silver pendent, a delicious salmon/bannock lunch or a once in a lifetime chance to build an elk hide hand drum.
 
Please give generously.  Please spread the word.

If we don't raise $32,000 we will still hire a Home Visitor and increase the number of families who can participate proportional to the amount we are able to raise.

The Impact

Check out these impacts listed on the HIPPY Canada website:

HIPPY Children Demonstrate:

  • Improved academic performance in comparison to similarly situated children with positive outcomes for school readiness, reading ability and school behaviour.
  • Improved school readiness skills, school performance, English skills, self-esteem andself-confidence.

HIPPY Mothers Report:

  • Improved parent-child relationships, greater self-confidence, reduced isolation,improved opportunities for expanding social networks and social support.
  • Acquisition of skills necessary to work with her child, confidence in her role as her child’s first teacher, improved language skills, greater participation in her child’s school, and more time spent with her child on learning activities.

HIPPY Home Visitors Benefit from:

  • Employment (often first-time) for mothers who typically experience multiple
    employment barriers.
  • Home Visitors, once isolated mothers, are now highly employable members
    of society who contribute to the economic well-being of their families and communities.

Our Campaign Team

We have pulled together a great team of supporters to help us manage a successful campaign.   At Nanaimo Aboriginal Centre we believe passionately about our work, about culture, early childhood education, literacy and family.  Our campaign team is just as passionate.  If we haven't answered all your questions, please contact us, we'll do everything we can to respond quickly.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every contribution matters to us, financial and non.  Please take a moment to share our campaign on Facebook and by email with your friends and family, encourage them to take a look at our project and ask them to consider making a donation.

Hych'ka.... Kleco Kleco.... Gilakasla.... Kinanaskomitin.... Merci.... Thank you....!!
story_txt:
Your contribution will help to provide the resources to expand a proven, successful model of early literacy education, supporting Aboriginal mom and their preschool aged children.

HIPPY:  Home Instruction for Parents with Preschool Youngsters
  Nanaimo Aboriginal HIPPY is a program of the Nanaimo Aboriginal Centre
Nanaimo Aboriginal HIPPY is free to all participating families
Nanaimo Aboriginal Centre is a non-profit society with a vision to support the realization of a 100% high school graduation rate for Aboriginal students. A key to realizing our vision is to develop programs and services that support early childhood development from birth to Kindergarten.
Nanaimo Aboriginal HIPPY is one of two in British Columbia. 
 Research shows that when a child living in poverty is provided access to quality, early years programs, they are 30% more likely to graduate high school.  Research also shows that children living in poverty have a significantly smaller vocabulary than their classmates in Kindergarten.  Finally, research shows that the grade 3 literacy rate is now they key indicator for a student's success in high school.  HIPPY addresses all three of these issues.
Please help our program grow.   Our Goal The goal of this campaign is to raise $32,000 during the month of April.  All funds raised will support the growth of our existing Aboriginal HIPPY program in Nanaimo, including the following items:  HIPPY Home Visitor - employ part-time a mom who will be trained to lead home visits and weekly sessions with program parents
Program supplies - each week every participating child is given a new book to keep.  Over the length of the program each child will have accumulated 30 new books.
Administration - a maximum of 15% of funds will cover the cost of program licensing fees, travel for the Home Visitor and office supplies.
To recognize your support, we are offering some beautiful, west coast art pieces like a hand carved red cedar panel, silver pendent, a delicious salmon/bannock lunch or a once in a lifetime chance to build an elk hide hand drum. Please give generously.  Please spread the word.




If we don't raise $32,000 we will still hire a Home Visitor and increase the number of families who can participate proportional to the amount we are able to raise.




The Impact 
Check out these impacts listed on the HIPPY Canada website:

HIPPY Children Demonstrate:

Improved academic performance in comparison to similarly situated children with positive outcomes for school readiness, reading ability and school behaviour.
Improved school readiness skills, school performance, English skills, self-esteem andself-confidence.

HIPPY Mothers Report:

Improved parent-child relationships, greater self-confidence, reduced isolation,improved opportunities for expanding social networks and social support.
Acquisition of skills necessary to work with her child, confidence in her role as her child’s first teacher, improved language skills, greater participation in her child’s school, and more time spent with her child on learning activities.

HIPPY Home Visitors Benefit from:

Employment (often first-time) for mothers who typically experience multipleemployment barriers.
Home Visitors, once isolated mothers, are now highly employable membersof society who contribute to the economic well-being of their families and communities.

  Our Campaign Team We have pulled together a great team of supporters to help us manage a successful campaign.   At Nanaimo Aboriginal Centre we believe passionately about our work, about culture, early childhood education, literacy and family.  Our campaign team is just as passionate.  If we haven't answered all your questions, please contact us, we'll do everything we can to respond quickly.
    Other Ways You Can Help Every contribution matters to us, financial and non.  Please take a moment to share our campaign on Facebook and by email with your friends and family, encourage them to take a look at our project and ask them to consider making a donation.  Hych'ka.... Kleco Kleco.... Gilakasla.... Kinanaskomitin.... Merci.... Thank you....!!

story:
This summer marks Pinson Public Library's 4th Summer Reading Program. We have grown so much in a short amount of time and we need your help to continue to grow! 

In 2012, during our first year of SRP, we offered 14 programs for teens and children. In 2013 we offered 40 programs for teens, children and adults. Last year we offered a program a day and want to do the same this summer!!!

We will offer activities for children, events for teens, programs for adults and more! This includes programs about music/art/science, craft events, animal visits and family night programs.

Here are our statistics from last summer:

  • 2,197 people attended 59 programs at the library
  • Over 700 kids, teens and adults registered for the program
  • More than 7,000 books were read!

Just a few reasons it is important to have an engaging Summer Reading Program: 

  • offers encouragement that reading become a lifelong habit
  • reading over the summer helps children prevent the "summer slide"
  • programs provide an opportunity for family time

Please consider making a donation:

Your donation, no matter what the amount ($5, $20, $50, $200) will help us offer more programs! We can stretch your dollars to provide quality programming and entertainment for you and your entire family.

We understand that everyone can't contribute, but please share this with your friends, family and local businesses! Every contribution will help us reach our goal!

Help us reach our goal of "A Program a Day!" for our 2015 Summer Reading Program!

story:
Our Mission:

Lehigh Bridges to Prosperity helps provide an isolated community in Panama with access to education, healthcare, and commerce, by designing, fundraising, and helping to construct a footbridge over an impassable river.

About our Organization:

Bridges to Prosperity (B2P) is a national organization that partners with university chapters to build footbridges for rural, isolated communities all over the world who lack access to basic needs during the rainy season. In many of these communities, children must cross the river to get to school and families must pass in order to access the main road that leads into town. The rainy season turns seemingly innocent rivers into dangerous and impassable obstacles. In these cases, a footbridge grants people year round access to these basic needs that many of us take for granted.

The process for a university chapter involves seeing the project through from conception to completion. B2P serves as a resource for our chapter throughout the project, including providing a design manual and a technical advisory board to support us in the design phase. We are also paired with an in-country manager who can help us connect and communicate with the community as well as provide us with information on the logistics and progress of the site. This is complimented by a team of support here at Lehigh, comprised of professors and faculty who can offer technical advice, ideas, and even on site safety supervision.

Impact:

The footbridges that university chapters build as a part of this organization are proven to increase school attendance, family visits to health care facilities, and pedestrian-livestock traffic. The community and student chapter work together to build the bridge. The community takes ownership over the bridge and learns how to maintain it. This project is empowering for everyone. It is an opportunity to apply what is being learned in class in a real world and hands on way. Students get to experience a different culture and way of living and working. Facing the challenges of a remote and isolated bridge site helps to shape a Lehigh engineer.

Our Goal:

National B2P subsidizes university chapter bridge projects. We are responsible for one third of the bridge cost as well as the support we receive from B2P staff. This adds up to $13,000. In addition, our team will be responsible for the travel of roughly 10 students to Panama. Our team is fully confident that we will be successful in changing the lives of another community in Panama. Every donation makes a difference as we work toward this important goal.

Last Year:

This past year, our student team successfully helped the community of Vallecito, Panama gain access to the main road during the rainy season by helping them construct the Vallecito footbridge. Working and living with the dedicated community was a learning experience and inspiration like no other for myself and the other students involved. We returned from Panama feeling proud of what we had accomplished, but also determined to it again.

This year our dedicated and eager team of students has already gotten started on preparing for our new project. Having witnessed the importance of this project first hand and learned from the challenges it presents, we are ready to truly make a difference this year as we continue to establish our legacy on this campus and in another, very far part of the world.

For additional information visit our Facebook page! https://www.facebook.com/BridgesToProsperityLehigh

And to learn more about the national organization please visit: http://bridgestoprosperity.org/

story:
Bless your souls, we've reached our goal!! Thank you to all our family, friends, friends o' friends, and beautiful strangers.

We have 3 days left - and if you are considering helping us on our way, theres still time and need!  Fine print y'all, oops! - we need to raise $225 past our goal to fully pay Indiegogo 5% of our funds raised. $177 left to go

Again, we've got hearts full of gratitude today. Can't wait to tell all of you tales from the permaculture front!


Our Story

We are active foodies and aspiring farmers from North Carolina, currently living in Austin, Texas. We have spent the last few years getting our hands dirty and ideas spinning, from becoming a part of a garden project with some of our best friends at Four Sisters' Farm in Hillsborough, NC, to a summer on the incredible Ferme du Jointout in Torpes, France.  We know we want to have a future farming and the next step is for us to continue our education. With your help, we will attend the Bullock's Permaculture Homestead's internationally accredited Permaculture Design Course located in Washington. This is a 2.5-week course with 144 hours of classroom and hands-on learning. We will come out of the course perma-certified and further along the path to creating our future in organic food production.


Permaculture
Permaculture is a creative, holistic design system used to create sustainable food production. It is a combination of the words permanent and agriculture. The word agriculture comes from agre; field and cultura; tillage of the soil....Hence, permaculture aims to till the same soil permanently. It is a facilitation and appreciation of the harmonious relationships between every element in an ecosystem; including humans! A few of its broadest and simplest goals are: to create a balanced input and output of energy, to produce a high yield in a little space, to increase biodiversity, and to reuse/recycle water.

 

The Impact 
We know we still have a lot to learn, but this will get us a little closer. Permaculture is one of the most exciting movements in today's food revolution and we want to share this with other people. Not only do we want to learn these skills to implement on our future land, we want to be able to help our friends and family plan their gardens, we want to be able to practice permaculture in our everyday lives, and we want to be proponents and educators.  Eventually we hope to initiate and be a part of a permanent homestead and small-scale production farm. When we do, you can come visit us anytime you want!

 

What We Need

Our fundraising goal is to cover the cost of combined tuition for both of us - $4,000

The additional $500 is to cover driving from texas to washington in Wayne, a 1992 toyota camry - gas, food, campsites, etc .

Anything we raise above that will offset the percentage we pay indiegogo once the funds come in...

Anything we raise above THAT will go into our savings account toward buying other important things in the future, like....land, goats, tractors, interns, etc. 

 

What You Get

We love you. We might love you a tiny bit more. 

We also have some delicious and enticing perks below.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love for you to help spread the word! Send this link to your friends and family, especially if they are interested and invested in youth and the food movement.


Or you could put this up on your facebook or blog or send a chain email and we would love you forever.

 

Links so you know a little more about us:

This is our blog from France: http://goatlandia.tumblr.com/

Here is some of Kellie's music: http://vaughnaed.bandcamp.com/

Here are some of Emily's words: http://handsintheweeds.wordpress.com/

Here is the band we're in with our dear friend Jesse Wooten: http://holyboats.com/

    Thanks to the brilliant Dan Bonne for shooting/editing the video   

Here is his media site: http://vimeo.com/imleavingyou

 

 Optimistically, Thank You!

Kellie Ann and Emily

story:
In 2011, a small group of university students started the Scientific Culture Society which provides educational programs to public schools and underprivileged communities. Through our Fun Science Program, we've worked with 300 Syrian refugee youth and over 500 public school students so far.

Now we want to expand and integrate our projects into the Science League, a project modeled after the Boy and Girl Scouts, that combines personal growth with scientific education and innovation.

The Science League: Through gamification and hands-on education, kids (ages 5-18) will work in teams to achieve learning objectives and earn badges by completing tasks and missions that encourage scientific learning, critical thinking and direct interaction with the natural world and their communities.

It is our belief that, through activities that build critical thought and scientific literacy, children can grow in character and realize their place in this AWESOME universe, giving them hope and unleashing their full potential.


Help Us Launch The Science League!

The Problem: 

Public school students, especially Syrian refugees and those who live in rural areas, have inadequate educational facilities and resources.  This puts them at a disadvantage when competing for jobs to bring back money for their families.

On a larger scale, the lack of proper education weakens Jordan's ability to solve its three main challenges: the severe lack of water resources, the ongoing energy crisis, and the surge in extremism that has developed due to poverty. 

Our Solution:

Through after school Science, Technology, Engineering and Math programs (STEM), we provide students with a safe space for scientific exploration and personal growth as well as career counseling. By working with university students and trained professionals, students will learn to express themselves and build their understanding of the natural world and the global community to which they belong.


While we already have a program and a dedicated team who are working for free, we now need a physical space to apply this program and hire some expert help. 

We've estimated our starting cost at around $55,000 USD. Although modest, this would cover everything we need from staff salaries to lab faculties and equipment, and pull us through the first year and a half. Ideally, we'd be self-sufficient by year two, sustaining the program on a small fee-basis. 

Goal: We set the scale for a minimum enrollment of 300 students for the first year. These estimates are based on an annual revenue obtained through the collection of a monthly fee of $30 USD from each student. These fees will be covered by your donations and our corporate sponsors.

- Give young boys and girls the power and the knowledge to take charge of their future and shape their country.


- The Scientific Culture Society will be able to stand on its own feet by becoming self-sufficient within two years!

- Your contribution will help launch our young non-profit organization to new levels. We will be able to effectively expand our programs to areas across the nation, reaching schools and communities in rural or disadvantaged locations.

Join the League, support science!

Perks are on the right of the page, here are visual representations and details of the perks:







For more info, visit our Facebook, website or twitter. Contact us on contact@scs.jo

story:
Hi I'm Anne and I'M IN MY LAST YEAR PRE-MED. I have successfully completed 3 Help me make it through the last!

Please don't let my HARD WORK & DREAM stop Here! SOMEONE MUST CARE ENOUGH TO HELP!

I need your Financial Help! I'VE COME SO CLOSE TO COMPLETING MY GOAL! ONLY A FEW DAYS  LEFT TO COMPLETE MY PAYMENT! The Time is running down, ONLY CASH will keep me in CLASSES! 

Caring People Like You can Make it happen for me!

For as long as I've known myself this has always been my desire; becoming a pediatrician and taking care of the children of the world!

Even as a small child I would speak to my pediatrician every office visit about what it takes to do the job that she is doing. My LOVE for her POSITION in helping and healing children was evident even from my younger days. Even after being told the number of years of schooling that would be necessary to reach my ultimate goal I would just smile and say "I can make it!" This for me is not a position its a DREAM Fulfilled!

The unexpected Obstacle:

Due to MEDICAL COMPLICATIONS, I've just been informed that my parent does not have the funds that are needed for me to return and continue my studies. I am devastated, my grades are great, I am in TWO Honor Societies and I'm also involved in a community service group. How could lack of funds destroy my dreams!

I AM CALLING OUT FOR HELP! $1.00, $5.00, $10.00 Any Amount will help me reach my goal!

Your kindness and generosity will be so much appreciated. It would afford me the opportunity to complete my course and go forward into Medical School!

What We Need & What You Get

We need you to help fund this campaign so that a life long dream will not become a nightmare.

Your funds will help complete the Fall/Spring balance that's due. It will help to cover my room and board, and provide the balance of funds needed for me to purchase some of my much needed study materials for the Year.

PERKS: HAVE BEEN DONATED BY IN-KIND GIFT GIVERS TO SHOW THEIR SUPPORT FOR ANNE, AND WE APPRECIATE ALL THEIR HELP!

We appreciate your help and would love to offer perks on behalf of Anne.

The total amount of $8,700.00 will cover Fall 2012/Spring2013 and I WILL BE ABLE TO GRADUATE ON TIME! 

The Impact

I would be an AWESOME Pediatrician and also open up a private practice that will cater to parents who may at some time in their life run across a financial BUMP in the road.

I would always remember how kind people like you made it possible for me to fulfill my desires and i would always do the same for others.

I am already in two honor societies and in two community service organizations; I would say I've started out on the right track and I promise I will continue on it.

My family and I have always been there for others I know someone will be here for us. THANK YOU SO MUCH IN ADVANCE

Other Ways You Can Help

I know in your heart you are willing to help; however if you can't at this time would you please tell your friends about this?

I am thankful that you took the time to help me. I appreciate it greatly!

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to notify your family and friends!

"Dr. Anne" (lol) saying thank you for making it happen for me!!!

I would always remember how kind people like you made it possible for me to fulfill my desires and i would always do the same for others.
I am already in two honor societies and in two community service organizations; I would say I've started out on the right track and I promise I will continue on it.
My family and I have always been there for others I know someone will be here for us. THANK YOU SO MUCH IN ADVANCE


Other Ways You Can Help
I know in your heart you are willing to help; however if you can't at this time would you please tell your friends about this?
I am thankful that you took the time to help me. I appreciate it greatly!
Please use the Indiegogo share tools to notify your family and friends!
"Dr. Anne" (lol) saying thank you for making it happen for me!!!

story:
Short Summary

Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.

My name is Marie-Gilberte, next august I will go back to Haiti after 10 years. I am exciting but at the same time anxious. For the past three weeks I was asking myself what can I do to  help rebuild my country. For me the obvious answer is helping some deserving and hard working families with their kids school supplies. I will be going to my old neighborhood (Carrefour) where I spent some of my childhood, to make that contribution. I know a great lady in Carrefour, who is doing a fabulous job with those kids and their parents ( mostly single mothers). She will be happy to receive this help.

What We Need & What You Get

$1500, will help me buy the school supply for almost 400 kids from the Centre communautaire de Carrefour, and also pay for the shipping from Miami to Haiti. All the money raise will go toward this project.

Perks:

.$1 Show your support to the project.

.$5 you will give a card signed by all the recipients.

.$10 you will receive a special shout out on my facebook page and twitter.

.$25 all of the above + a graphic tee shirt with the kids picture. 

$50 all of the above +special painting from an haitian artist. 

$100 all the above +haitian steel drum art.

If I do not reach the goal of $1500, the funds raise will be used to buy school supply.

Please, if you can not contribute financially, I steel need your help. Share this project with your friends and family members. Let them know a little bit count. Use Facebook, twitter, email please help me help, them.

Thanks.

story:
The Evolution Revolution is an Awakening of Consciousness arising on the planetï¿½the next leap in our evolutionary process. While overshadowed by the 'death throes of the old paradigm' wreaking havoc worldwide, it is manifesting quietly and inexorably, and patently evident to those with the eyes to see.

Saharadevi has been carried and driven by the Evolution Revolution since it came to her in India/1999, and has since devoted her life to carrying the message.

Recently, the energy increased exponentially with an event sponsored by the Bodhi Tree Bookstore/Los Angeles, and an invitation to The 4th International Conference and Gathering of the Elders in India/March 2012. 

The significance of this invitation and the impact it will have is manifold, enabling Sahara to share the message of this global manifestation with the Elders of Ancient Traditions, and the Elders to acknowledge and endorse the phenomenon, sharing it to their respective communities and building critical mass.

The importance of garnering awareness of the Evolution Revolution on the world stage lies in  Jeremy Rifkin's question, whether we can ï¿½reach biosphere consciousness and global empathy in time to avert planetary collapse.ï¿½ (The Empathic Civilization, Tarcher) There is no longer time to indulge the egoï¿½we must begin to activate the understanding of our Oneness. 
 
This campaign ($2400) will fund visa and travel expenses, the waiver of registration fee ($250) already granted by conference organizers. I have no doubt the goal will be reachedï¿½Grace has already signaled its presence. Click here to support. 12/27: $1785. received  in toto

Every contribution of $10 will receive an Evolution Revolution eBook, $50 will receive a signed copy of the handbook, $100 an autographed book & audiobook. 

The Evolution Revolution Organization is a non-profit corporation registered in Montanaï¿½all contributions are tax-deductible and receipts available.

Namaste, and welcome to the Evolution Revolution.

Click here to support

story:
We are extremely humbled by the love and generosity that you have shown us this week...

With your help, we have hit our first milestone and have raised the $15,000 needed to cover the funding gaps for the summer portion!

Our Expanding Horizons College Prep program is a year long endeavor and any additional funds we raise will go towards the costs of the fall and winter sessions.

If you can help us level the playing field for some amazing young people who deserve a chance, we'd be extremely grateful.


Thanks for taking the time to check out our campaign.

This summer Statement Arts is returning to Washington Heights and the esteemed United Palace of Cultural Arts to provide a free College Prep Program for 15 under-served New York City kids!


What We Want To Do

Last year we ran a College Prep Program for 10 New York City kids. The program was a HUGE success and every one of our kids is going onto higher learning institutions. Most of them got substantial scholarships. We are running it again this summer and will be drawing kids from all over the city. We have received tremendous support, not only from the community, but in past years, State Senator Adriano Espaillat and City Councilman Ydanis Rodriguez came to our Final Performance!


What We Need & What You Get

We'd like to offer every student an equal chance to participate at no cost to them. We have gotten several grants for this program but need to raise - at a minimum - an additional $15,000 to cover the summer portion.  All money raised will go towards paying for:

  • Classroom, rehearsal and performance spaces
  • College application fees
  • School supplies
  • SAT prep books and tutors
  • Individualized case management services
  • Teachers' stipends
  • Transportation and MetroCards for the kids
  • Supplies, props and costumes 

This is a yearlong project and any supplemental money raised will go towards the costs associated with running the fall and winter sessions. Whatever you are able to give: $10, $50, or $200, we promise it will make an impact.

As a 501(c)(3), all money donated to Statement Arts is tax-deductible!


The Impact

We have a 100% success rate at both getting our kids accepted and enrolled into college. Most of our kids get substantial scholarships and many get full rides. At Statement Arts, we believe that education is the great equalizer, and we want to continue our work and commitment to arts education and mentorship. With your generous support, our organization can make a difference in the lives of urban youth here in New York City.

Some of the schools where our kids have been accepted include;

  • Berklee School of Music
  • The Pratt Institute
  • University of Maine
  • Marymount Manhattan College
  • Pace University
  • Fashion Institute of Technology (FIT)
  • SUNY Oneonta
  • SUNY Purchase
  • Many CUNY schools

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this campaign with your friends can really make a difference. Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Like us on Facebook, tweet about us, forward our campaign on to all of your friends.

We'd like to thank everyone who helps us with this program and we look forward to empowering many more kids in the future.


About Us

Statement Arts is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization whose mission is to build self confidence and enrich under-served youth with creative experiences through arts education: music, acting, dance, photography, visual art, filmmaking and writing. We believe that these arts education channels enhance young people's intellectual performance and self esteem, enabling them to become ambassadors in their communities.

www.statementarts.org 

A HUGE thank you to Ari Espay for his amazing photos! You can follow him on instagram or check out his website: www.ariespayphotography.com

story:
Helllo Friends!

This year I am embarking on a year long coaching certification through the Academy for Coaching Excellence.  The first workshop is October 21- 25 and is led by Coaching for Social Change - an Oakland based organization fostering the development and leadership of activists through coaching. I am incredibly impressed with their work and very honored to be going through the Thriving Changemakers Intensive.  

Over the past 3.5 years I have had the opportunity to help develop new community organizers through my work at Leadership for Educational Equity.  One of the ways I’ve done this work is through coaching - a skill I didn’t know I had, or that would be needed in this work, but have discovered has been very meaningful. Through my coaching I have seen organizers take what they’ve uncovered about themselves and their work and use the information to transform how they know themselves as organizers, how they approach the work, and how they sustain themselves in the field. 

The world I want to live in is one where EVERYONE has access to the healthcare they need,  quality education, food that nourishes and sustains and a place to call home.  The way I know I can contribute to this vision is by continuing to develop new and mid-career organizers as thriving changemakers.  Activists who know how to manage burnout, continue to tap into inspiration and vision, and break down the walls of racism, oppression, and fear.  

This training will give me the foundational skills I need to have a deeper, more meaningful impact on those I coach. But I can't do this alone! I'm asking you to support me and this movement by making a donation today. 

I have included some handmade "perks" if you contribute at certain amounts.  I am a new metalsmith and want to share my love of jewelry with you! 

Thank you so much for your help in making this possible!

Love,

Katy

story:
Dear Everyone,

My name is Shenequa A. Brooks!! I am a recent graduate from Kansas City Art Institute (2014) with my Bachelors of Fine Arts, majoring in Fibers. Currently a Charlotte Street Studio Resident, I have the opportunity to make art in my studio in Kansas City, Missouri, free of charge for a year. I have recently been admitted into School of the Art Institute of Chicago to pursue my Masters in Design for Fashion, Body & Garment in the fall of 2015 to further my educational and artistic studies. This is a two year program which would allow me the opportunity to work
alongside some of the most influential contemporary artists of today such as Nick Cave. I want to attend graduate school to be in an environment where I am challenged as an artist. I want to continue a conversation of weaving the label of what being an African and African-American woman means to me at School of the Art Institute of Chicago. SAIC’s Fashion, Body, & Garment is an intensive program, allowing me the invaluable opportunity to explore creative ideas beyond fine art and fashion design with a network of peers, and elaborate on critical thinking of my body of work.

I am kindly asking for your generous financial support that will allow me to embark on this new journey. The funds from this campaign will cover my transportation, moving, and room and board for my first semester in the fall. All donors will receive a thank you card and a Shenequa A. Brooks original work of art to add to their personal collection. If you are not able to donate please spread the word by posting this link on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or any other social media site. Every bit helps!!!

“I am destined for greatness and so are you”- Shenequa A. Brooks. Make your dreams into reality as I am aspiring to do. Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,

Shenequa A. Brooks

Contact Info
shenequabrooks@gmail.com
shenequaabrooks.com

Special Thanks
Jon Lim- Videographer
soreun7.com
jlim@soreun7.com

Music
Davido- Aye (Instrumental)

story:
The Tragic Reality of Gaza | Beautiful Custom Necklaces For Your Donation 100% of funds received will be donated to an established non-profit (MECA).

Gaza is one on the poorest places on the globe: 70% of their 1,800 million people live in poverty on less than 3 dollars a day.

Thousands of people go to bed hungry at night.

Fully 95% of the water in Gaza is unsafe to drink. Most people do not have money to buy bottle water, so thousands of people go to bed thirsty at night.

Unemployment, at 45%, is the highest in the world. Almost one out of every 2 working age adults doesn't have a job.

Not enough food; not enough water; not enough jobs. In addition to these tragedies, the experts estimate that between 80 - 99% of the children in Gaza have witnessed attacks, killings and brutalization of family and friends, or experienced it themselves. No wonder 92% of the children suffer from psychological trauma and post-traumatic stress disorder.

I am a Jew, standing among many other Jews, distraught by the suffering in Gaza. I am a Jew, standing among Christians, Muslims, Buddhists, Hindus, and countless others who do not define themselves in terms of their particular religion, but in terms of their humanity. We suffer for the men, women and innocent children of Gaza and reach out to them.

What Can You Do to Help?

Help us help those who need our help. 100% of the donated funds will be given to the to the MIddle Eastern Children's Alliance (MECA), a 27-year-old non-profit humanitarian aid organization which offers food, clean water and medicines to support Palestinian families.

Why Should You Help?

As a Jew, you are spreading olem tikkun, by contributing actions toward mending the world.  As a Christian, you are living the values of a Righteous Christian and your name will be recorded in the Book of Righteous Christians.  As a Muslim, you are performing deeds of righteousness in the service of Allah, who will credit your good deed toward salvation.  As a Buddhist, you will earn karmic energy toward achieving the blissful, spiritual state of Nirvana and rejoining in spirit with god.

Why Should You Contribute TODAY!

You will want to contribute today because today you will get a beautiful custom made original designer necklace as a thank you gift for your contribution! These are one-of-a-kind necklaces made out of natural, semi-precious beads, many collected from all over the world. Each necklace has its own story, like each of the children you will be helping has his/her own story. By joining this campaign, not only do you contribute to an important and worthy cause, enjoying the warm comfort of giving, but you also enjoy the pleasures of looking beautiful in your smashing new necklace!

Give More!

I am offering these unique, hand-made necklaces – which take hours to make – at such modest prices because I am trying to spread the word and stimulate interest in the forgotten children of Gaza, especially at this very tumultuous time between Israeli and Palestinians. So if you can afford to pay for the real value of these creations, please, please add to your contribution.

Many thanks,

Constanza

The necklaces offered through this campaign are just an exclusive sample of the many creations that are available on my website, click the link below to be taken to my website to see more:

http://constanzajewelry.com

The necklaces pictured below all come carefully wrapped in a beautiful gift box.  Each necklace is made by hand, with carefully chosen beads and other materials.  There is only one of each necklace as they are 100% unique.  They sell in high-end San Francisco boutiques and on my website for 50%-100% more than offered here.
____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #1  
Amazing Africa
Large 50 mm blue and black striped Wooden beads, made in Africa, combined with black Porcelain squares, white Procelain twists, black and white Lampwork ovals and black Obsidian barrels. 19.5 " length. Large lobster claw pewter clasps. Overall, a fashion statement worth a milllion for a contribution of only $70.00.

_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #2
Carnival of Colors!
Five strands of multi-colored 8 mm Howlite disc beads with hand-carved Wooden clasps. 19" length. A veritable rainbow of color that will turn any outfit into a worthy cause for a contribution of only $65.00.

_____________________________________________________________________________

Custom Necklace #3

Turkish Turquoise Prayer Necklace

Turkish Turquoise mala prayer necklace with 3 one-eye dZi Agate beads, a yellow Burmese Jade round and gold plated spiral. 6 mm beads, 30" length. Wear this special necklace, full of the Bhudda spirit of compassion, and help children in Gaza by your contribution of only $65.00.

_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #4

Turkish Green Agate Prayer Necklace

Brazilian bottle green Agate mala prayer necklace, 10 mm beads, 36" length, with three deep-red Agate beads, a Yellow Burmese jade round and gold plated spiral. Wear this special necklace, full of the Bhudda spirit of compassion, and help children in Gaza by your contribution of only $75.00.

_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #5
Lapis Lazuli Prayer Necklace
Lapis Lazuli mala prayer necklace with 3 deep-red agate beads, a gold plated cut-out round, gold plated stamped cone and spiral. 10 mm beads, 36" length. Wear this special necklace, full of the Bhudda spirit of compassion, and help children in Gaza by your contribution of only $75.00.

_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #6
Spiritual Green Crystallized Agate
This unusual crystallized green Agate cylinder bead, 55 mm, has spiritual qualities of healing and calming, as well balancing yin/yang energies. It is combined here with a cream colored, luminescent Jade lion and vase-shaped flat beads, ending with 2 black Obsidian ovals and 2 Lampwork glass discs. This necklace, 30" in length, will bring you special joy for a contribution of only $75 to help the children of Gaza.

_____________________________________________________________________________

Custom Necklace #7

Purple Crystallized Agate

This purple cylinder of crystallized Agate has a special royal color and large size, 60 mm. On either end are 2 hand-made, beautifully colored Polymer rounds, with a black Onyx bead at the end. A piece that goes with blue jeans or party dress. Remember the children of Gaza and your contribution to their happiness when you contribute only $65.00.


_____________________________________________________________________________

Custom Necklace #8

Gold Plated Hematite Chain

This necklace is a chain of gold plated Hematite, which wraps around the neck twice and falls gracefully on the nape, 44 " in total length. Three handmade Lampwork red, white and gold beads, which can be placed anywhere on the chain, add a burst of color and interest. The gold hematite wists are 4mm x 10mm. Wrap yourself in gold and feel like a queen for only a $75 contribution.

_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #9 

Handcrafted Lady in Pink Agate and Pearl

This bold statement of pink is designed to enhance the feminine charms and secret powers of women. The woman who wears this fashion statement is saying, "Look at me. I'm not only a beautiful woman, but a formidable friend, colleague and confident. I am sensitive and tender, but I am also an assertive presence, with my own creative voice."

Two pink Banded Agate oval pendants are the centerpiece of the necklace, connected with pink pearlized baroque Shell, pink freshwater round Pearls, pink baroque Pearls, aqua Quartz rounds and 2 handcrafted Lampwork rounds. 24" in length. $135 contriibution.


_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #10

Custom Turquoise and Lavender Ceramic Beaded Necklace

Colors with attributes from both warm and cool colors, like turquoise (warm) and lavender (cool), can both calm and excite at the same time. They create a kind of seductiveness impossible to ignore. Wear this necklace, with its turquoise colored Magnesite barrel and two Magnesite melons, and its large lavender Ceramic rounds and create that magic look!  20" in length. $85.


_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #11

Handcrafted Sky Blue Floral Lampwork with Blue and Green Polymer, Camel Beads, Magnesite and Silver

Custom semi-precious bead necklace with a royal blue floral Lampwork focal bead and two exquisitely executed large, blue/green Polymer rounds on either side, with four antique Coin Silver discs separating them. With two amazingly bright 'apple blue' Camel beads on either side of two antique Tribal Silver balls, this necklace becomes a combination of the old and the new, intricately interwoven into a modern fashion statement.  16.5 -18.5" in length. $125 contribution.



_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #12

Custom Amethyst Nuggets, Lilac Pearls, Lampwork Rounds Beaded Necklace

Large Amethyst nuggets combined with pink/mauve freshwater Pearls and flowered Polymer rounds. Amethyst has been adopted by the American National Association of Jewelers as the official birthstone for February and 4th, 6th and 17th wedding anniversaries. So here is the perfect birthday gift you have been looking for. 19.5" - 21.5" length  $100 contribution.



_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #13

Custom Natural Turquoise, Royal Blue and Green Polymer and African Glass

Custom made, semi-precious bead necklace with a focal point of exquisitely hand-crafted Polymer beads in deep blues and mint greens, combined with 2 large natural Turquoise ovals, 2 deep blue African Padre drums and Pewter discs in between the beads. This necklace is for the woman who wants to exude coolness, calmness and sophistication. 19" length.  $110 contribution.


_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #14

Custom Two-Strand Necklace with an Ancient Rust Red Agate Focal Bead and Autumn Jasper Rounds

Custom semi-precious bead necklace with a vintage Agate focal bead from the Dorgonne Valley in Mali, Africa. The Indians of South-East Asia were making these very kinds of Agate beads 3000 years ago, so perhaps this is one of them! Two strands of autumn Jasper rounds and ovals complement the focal bead.

Jasper is considered "The Nurturing Stone," or a stone of gentleness, comfort and relaxation. It brings peace to endings, including to the end of relationships. Because of this, it a good stone for healing grief, as it can help lead to a sense of tranquility after emotional traumas. 19.5" in length. Your contribution of $100 will help the children of Gaza heal their grief.


_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #15 
Custom Vintage African Brass Beaded Necklace

Natural red Rhodonite heishis with yak Bone rounds and rondelles, in combination with rare, old African hand-made brass trade beads – eight brass bicones and five etched bells – make this unique and special necklace authentically out of old Africa.  18.5 " in length. $95 contribution.           



_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #16

Custom Emerald Faceted Glass Pendant on Gold Wash Hematite

Custom semi-precious bead necklace with an emerald faceted Glass pendant, wrapped in gold wash, on a chain of gold washed Hematite beads. Emerald green is considered an inspiring and uplifting color, suggesting material and spiritual wealth. Perhaps wearing this modest necklace will inspire you to great accomplishments, both materially and spiritually!  Certainly, your contribution of $70 will go far to helping some children in Gaza.


_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #18 
Amazing Amethyst
At one time, Amethyst was known as a "Gem of Fire," worth as much as a diamond, with its legendary powers to sooth the mind. The large Crystal Amethyst nuggets in this necklace, combined with the faceted Tourmaline rounds and cylinders make a unique statement which will take you anywhere in style. 21" in length. Sooth your mind and make a child smile with your $85.

_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #19 
Black Crystallized Agate with Motiff
This unusally large crystallized agate, 63 mm, with its beautiful copper and white motiff, and carnelian rounds at either end is hung on a gold wash bail and chain. It dresses up any outfit and makes a simple, elegant  statement, for a contribution of only $70.

_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #20
Ochre Bamboo and Wood
Three strands of ochre colored wooden beads, in various cylinder, round and heshi shapes, focus the eye on the long carved piece of bamboo with a silver metal bead on each end. It's an unusual piece, 28" long, that will catch people's eye, so you can tell them you made a forgotten child smile with your $60 contribution.

_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #21

Custom Ivory Shell and Pearl Double Strand Bead Necklace

Custom semi-precious bead necklace with two strands of beige and ivory Shell and Fresh Water Pearls, including an especially large, luminous baroque Pearl on the inside strand. This necklace, with its close relationship to the sea, glitters and glows like the sun reflecting off the waves. In reflecting the light, it creates its own soft and warm radiance. 18" in length  $100 contribution.

_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #22
A Barrel of Gold and Silver Lampwork Goodies
Seven strands of small gold and silver and flowered lampwork glass beads fall through the wooden barrel with silver applique, creating  a sassy 4 " tassel that sparkles. You'll love wearing this conversation piece, 25 inches long, and for a contribution of only $85.
_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #23

Custom Beaded Necklace of Apricot Marble Medallion and Fresh Water Pearls

This beautiful apricot colored necklace with its apricot colored marble medallion, apricot large fresh water pearls, copper wire rounds and copper beads makes a unique statement in its color and design. 18" in length. $85 contribution.


_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #24
Blue Cloisonne with Orange and Blue Czech Lampwork

We normally think of cloisonne as a particularly Chinese art form, but in fact, the technique originally came from the Near East, around Egypt and the Roman Empire and did not reach China until the 14th century, where it became an iconic feature in Chinese art. This beautiful double sided piece of Cloisonne probably did come from China, with its rich blues and luminescent oranges. 19" in length. $80 contribution.


_____________________________________________________________________________
Custom Necklace #25

Custom Crystallized Green Agate with Pearls Beaded Necklace

This necklace was inspired by Moroccan and Near East jewelry, where the focal bead is traditionally a silver pendant with a row of silver beads hanging down from it. Only in my version, I have used a large green crystallized agate as the pendant, and hung freshwater pearls from it. Just like the design, the combination of green and pink is unusual. The length is over 23.5."


_____________________________________________________________________________Custom Necklace #26

Purple and Green Mosaic Polymer

Green is the color of life, of nature; a restful color. Purple, on the other hand, is both a warm and cool color, as it is the combination of warm red and cool blue. So the combination of purple and green is especially enchanting and peaceful without being boring, as you can see in this necklace. 19.5" in length  $80.
story_txt:
The Tragic Reality of Gaza | Beautiful Custom Necklaces For Your Donation 100% of funds received will be donated to an established non-profit (MECA).

Gaza is one on the poorest places on the globe: 70% of their 1,800 million people live in poverty on less than 3 dollars a day.Thousands of people go to bed hungry at night.Fully 95% of the water in Gaza is unsafe to drink. Most people do not have money to buy bottle water, so thousands of people go to bed thirsty at night.Unemployment, at 45%, is the highest in the world. Almost one out of every 2 working age adults doesn't have a job.Not enough food; not enough water; not enough jobs. In addition to these tragedies, the experts estimate that between 80 - 99% of the children in Gaza have witnessed attacks, killings and brutalization of family and friends, or experienced it themselves. No wonder 92% of the children suffer from psychological trauma and post-traumatic stress disorder.I am a Jew, standing among many other Jews, distraught by the suffering in Gaza. I am a Jew, standing among Christians, Muslims, Buddhists, Hindus, and countless others who do not define themselves in terms of their particular religion, but in terms of their humanity. We suffer for the men, women and innocent children of Gaza and reach out to them.What Can You Do to Help?Help us help those who need our help. 100% of the donated funds will be given to the to the MIddle Eastern Children's Alliance (MECA), a 27-year-old non-profit humanitarian aid organization which offers food, clean water and medicines to support Palestinian families.Why Should You Help?As a Jew, you are spreading olem tikkun, by contributing actions toward mending the world.  As a Christian, you are living the values of a Righteous Christian and your name will be recorded in the Book of Righteous Christians.  As a Muslim, you are performing deeds of righteousness in the service of Allah, who will credit your good deed toward salvation.  As a Buddhist, you will earn karmic energy toward achieving the blissful, spiritual state of Nirvana and rejoining in spirit with god.Why Should You Contribute TODAY!You will want to contribute today because today you will get a beautiful custom made original designer necklace as a thank you gift for your contribution! These are one-of-a-kind necklaces made out of natural, semi-precious beads, many collected from all over the world. Each necklace has its own story, like each of the children you will be helping has his/her own story. By joining this campaign, not only do you contribute to an important and worthy cause, enjoying the warm comfort of giving, but you also enjoy the pleasures of looking beautiful in your smashing new necklace!Give More!I am offering these unique, hand-made necklaces – which take hours to make – at such modest prices because I am trying to spread the word and stimulate interest in the forgotten children of Gaza, especially at this very tumultuous time between Israeli and Palestinians. So if you can afford to pay for the real value of these creations, please, please add to your contribution.Many thanks,ConstanzaThe necklaces offered through this campaign are just an exclusive sample of the many creations that are available on my website, click the link below to be taken to my website to see more:http://constanzajewelry.comThe necklaces pictured below all come carefully wrapped in a beautiful gift box.  Each necklace is made by hand, with carefully chosen beads and other materials.  There is only one of each necklace as they are 100% unique.  They sell in high-end San Francisco boutiques and on my website for 50%-100% more than offered here.____________________________________________________________________________Custom Necklace #1  
Amazing Africa
Large 50 mm blue and black striped Wooden beads, made in Africa, combined with black Porcelain squares, white Procelain twists, black and white Lampwork ovals and black Obsidian barrels. 19.5 " length. Large lobster claw pewter clasps. Overall, a fashion statement worth a milllion for a contribution of only $70.00.

Carnival of
Colors!

Turquoise Prayer Necklace

Necklace

Prayer Necklace

story:
Hello! My name is Ashley Mendez and I am a Junior at Lighthouse Community Charter school in Oakland, CA. Last summer, I went to El Salvador. I visited my grandma and my aunt who was pregnant at the time. One day, we went out to el mercado. This is a place where they sell fresh fruits and vegetables out on the street. I was placing an order of cheese when I received a light tap on my shoulder. I looked down to see a small boy with a ripped up tee and no shoes. “Cómpreme una cora de tomates porfavor.” The little boy was asking me to buy him a quarter worth of tomatoes. My heart instantly dropped. I saw myself in the little boy because that could’ve been me if my parents hadn’t come to the U.S. I wondered why he wasn’t in school and why he was working so young. I am grateful that my parents escaped the poverty and starvation to provide a better lifestyle for me and my brother. In addition to being grateful for my family, I also felt sympathetic to those in need. 

Recently, I´ve been given the opportunity to change the lives of others through Global Glimpse, a non profit organization that provides students with the opportunity to study abroad. In June I will be going to Dominican Republic to teach and help students learn English and participate in various community service opportunities. By being a part of this program, I will be an adaptable leader that is ready for change. Much like an Olympian, the hard work,dedication, and continuous efforts will not go in vain. The training I will receive will prepare me for college and beyond. 

I would like to thank you for taking the time to read my campaign and for any and all donations towards this life changing experience. Please feel free to share this among your social networks.

story:
Barnet Refugee Service is a charity working in partnership with statutory and non-statutory agencies, schools, community groups and other refugee organisations in order to improve the physical, social and mental well-being of refugees and asylum seekers. We work in the London Borough of Barnet and surrounding boroughs, helping to reduce health inequalities, social exclusion and poverty. 

We support over 1,000 refugees and asylum seekers each year by providing the following services:

•Advice and advocacy on immigration, health, housing, asylum support and welfare rights

• ESOL classes for adults and young people at various levels from beginner to advanced

•Help with registration at College and/or other educational as well as training opportunities

•Social activities to overcome isolation and build self-esteem including a Youth Club, Women’s Group, Men’s Group, Mums and Toddler’s Group and Eco-Therapy project 

•After School Homework clubs during term times and in the holidays

•Drop-In for destitute asylum seekers providing advice, food parcels and clothing

•Emotional Support for clients with mental health issues through one to one counselling sessions

This Crowdfunding Campaign has been set up especially to raise funds for our weekly YOUTH CLUB which supports and engages newly arrived asylum seekers and young refugees in social, educational and creative activities.

We have so many interesting projects that would just need some financial support to get started! To give you just a few examples, we want to organize a 6 weeks photography workshop which will explore the themes of belongings and settling into a new country. In order for all the participants to be equally able to express their creativity, they would need to be able to access same standard equipment. For this reason, some of the money we raise will help to buy good quality cameras!

We want to run a monthly film club and screen educational movies including documentaries about life stories of refugees around the world! We would need a new projector to make this happen :)

Some of our refugee volunteers are amazing artists who can facilitate art classes and teach with a multicultural approach. Some of the things that our young people will be able to learn include: sculpture, clay modelling, frame making, puppet making, painting and jewellery! We would need financial support in order to buy specific material for this purpose including beautiful natural colours which often come from our volunteers' countries of origin!

If we manage to raise enough money on time, we would like to involve our young people into a graffiti festival which will take place in London during the end of June and 1st week of July in order to let them meet international artists and try something new and exciting!! For this event, we would need to buy sprays and paper panels so that they can unleash their creativity :)

We are also organizing some fantastic summer activities for our young people in order to enable them to socialize, make friendship and enjoy the holidays even if their families have very limited financial resources. A summer camp, climbing, go-karting, kayaking and possibly a trip to a farm are just some of the activities we have in mind!!! The summer activities will take place over 6 weeks starting from around the 7th of July until around the 21st of August. Your generous donation would help us to cover the costs and thanks to you our young people will build beautiful memories which will gradually replace their traumatic experiences.

Finally, one of our dreams is to set up a bike project where young people can exchange useful skills and learn how to fix the bikes themselves! In order to get it started, we would need some money to buy 2 or 3 bikes to begin with. We hope that you can support us to make our dreams come true. 

Please help us, be generous, be kind, share your love and spread a little happiness!!!...

Our young people and all our team would be forever grateful! 

All kind of contributions are welcome, getting the word out to promote our projects would be a great help too!

story:
What We Do

The Sellam Circus School (LLC) is a circus arts academy based in Biddeford, Maine, that will offer both recreational and professional-level classes in circus skills and performance, as well as forums on circus history, technical courses in rigging, and practical introductions to tent maintenance and mechanics.  The Sellam Circus School’s Professional Circus Arts Training (PCAT) course and PCAT Preparatory course is designed to conclude with one month of training and performance in the big top tent.  Our goal is to bring our students into the ring, and connect them with the tradition of circus, by ensuring their access to Master-level coaches, and the enchanting environment of the big top tent.

Our Mission

The mission of The Sellam Circus School is to pass on excellent performance technique, actively preserve the traditions of circus, and provide a performance venue for graduating students.  The Sellam Circus School is committed to creating avenues for students to connect with the rich history and traditions of circus.  

Teaching in a big top tent is central to our identity.  Poised between circus instruction and cultural anthropology, The Sellam Circus School is based upon two principles:

  • Easy access to world-class, professional circus arts coaching; and
  • Preservation, sharing and promotion of the culture and traditions of traveling circus.

In 2016 and 2017, with your help, we raised needed startup funds - and hit the ground running!  Your support allowed us to purchase vital equipment, participate in Maine coast festivals and events,  begin developing a traveling workshop program, and initiate negotiations for our dream location.  Your support also enable us to lease a beautiful big top tent, and launch the inaugural season of our Maine Coast Summer Circus Arts program! 

Our Maine Coast Summer Circus Arts Program was created with the mission to provide traveling circus arts day camp sessions to under-served communities throughout coastal Maine, and the larger New England area.  In our inaugural year, thanks to your generous support, we were able to share the joy of circus with communities in Rockport and Bar Harbor, Maine.  

    The Tent

    In 2017, we needed to raise $5000 to bring THIS beautiful big top tent to our day camps . . . and with your help, we made our goal!  Now, as we move toward purchasing our very own big top, we are inviting our supporters to be a part of our InDemand campaign.

    Meet Charlotte, the big top tent (pictured above).  Charlotte is the beautiful red-and-white striped tent that we leased for our 2017 Maine Coast Summer Circus Arts day camp season, and the tent we will lease again for our 2018 season. 

    Charlotte allowed us to start out strong in our partnership with College of the Atlantic, and make a huge impact in the lives of our students - many of whom had never been inside a circus tent before, and were also experiencing circus arts for the very first time.  We saw great leaps and bounds forward with our students last summer, and the memories that were made are truly life-long gems.  Your contributions enabled us to give these students an unforgettable, once-in-a-lifetime experience.

    This year, we are intensifying our efforts to purchase our own big top.  This is no small goal:  The cost of a quality, used, Italian-engineered circus big top is estimated at approximately $42,000.   This is why we are working to achieve our goal through means beyond our IndieGoGo campaign.  In particular, we have been working with a local Biddeford community organization to plan for a great summer of fun - including applying for grant funding, and planning programming and events that will extend year round.  Every bit of support helps, and your contribution - of any size - is greatly appreciated.

    With our very own big top, we will be able to offer programs well into late Fall/early Winter, start up again with the first days of Spring, and reach even more communities throughout coastal Maine and New England.  By teaching inside a big top tent, we are able to immediately connect our students with the legacy of circus arts in the most meaningful way.  Each day, students will not only learn how to juggle, ride a unicycle, climb the aerial silks and tumble inside the ring; they will also learn about the history of the canvas tent in American and European circuses, including how a tent is set up, rigged, and maintained.  At the heart of every traveling circus is a well-loved and maintained tent!

     

    The Sellam Approach

    The Sellam Circus School is master coach Sellam El Ouahabi's way to give back what he has learned during a lifetime in traveling circus. Sellam's students know that there is one standard that he insists upon from all who attend his classes:  They must train from the heart.  Coaches enjoy students who love what they do, and students learn best from coaches with a deep love and appreciation of circus. 

    Through over three decades of performance and coaching around the world, Sellam is actively connected with the incredible people - students and coaches - that make The Sellam Circus School a unique and invaluable resource for training.  

    Student & Community Impact

    There's nothing quite like entering the big top:  The smell of the sun-warmed canvas; the sound of the ropes gently chiming against the kingpoles; the experience of walking into the center ring.  There is no other way to say it:  It's a whole new way to learn circus arts.  Of course, it's not new at all . . . but it's sadly not easy to find, these days.  Your support will help us to bring circus instruction back into the tent for the benefit of our community, as well as provide:

    • An Iconic Symbol:  Teaching inside a tent allows us to send an instant and clear signal about what we do.  We teach circus arts technique, and we share circus culture.  Those passing by on the sidewalk or highway will know instantly that there is a circus happening . . . and want to know more.  The tent will be a lightning bolt for excitement in our community!
    • Room To Move:  Our tent will have a maximum capacity of 650 people.  That means that there is room for our students to really move, to experiment, to find space to explore their discipline of choice - all while still being intimately connected inside an historic space.
    • Industry Standard:  One of the biggest challenges when planning a circus learning space is finding enough ceiling height, and a safe, reliable rigging point.  Teaching in a tent solves all of these issues.  A big top tent offers upwards of 60 feet of vertical height (most permanent structures top out at 25 feet), and a rigging structure that has been engineered to meet standard industry expectations for weight load and safety.  Done deal!

    • It's Really, Really, Cool:   Seriously.  How exciting is it to say that you learned circus arts inside a big top?  Sign us up!

    Read About Us!

    Want to know more about us and what we we do?  Check out these great links to press about The Sellam Circus School and its Founders, Sellam El Ouahabi & Amity Stoddard:
     
    • Article in The Working Waterfront, the online journal of The Island Institute!
    • Article about Sellam by Circus Smirkus! 
    • Feature about a recent show, by Bangor Daily News!
    • Great article about circus parents and kids in Spectacle Magazine!
    • Amity Stoddard, Sellam Circus School's Co-Founder, at 2017 Smithsonian Folklife Festival!
    • Listen to what our young circus artists from Bar Harbor had to say about learning in the big top by clicking HERE!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know that not everyone can afford to contribute - but there are other ways you can help us:

    • Spread the word!  Share our InDemand IndieGoGo campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram pages.
    • Tag your friends!  Shout out to specific friends that you know love circus - or that may be interested in learning more about our Maine Coast Circus Arts Day Camps!

    And friends . . . Thank you.  

    *Photo credit:  JoJo Zeitlin, 2015

    We may have shared time in the circus, we might have grown up together, or we may have yet to meet.  But YOU are the reason we are building the programs we are so passionate about.  Our commitment is to create a path into this magical world for you, and every person - big and small - with dreams of the circus.  THANK YOU for your support!  And as we say in the circus . . . see you down the road! 

    - Sellam & Amity
story_txt:
What We Do
The Sellam Circus School (LLC) is a circus arts academy based in Biddeford, Maine, that will offer both recreational and professional-level classes in circus skills and performance, as well as forums on circus history, technical courses in rigging, and practical introductions to tent maintenance and mechanics.  The Sellam Circus School’s Professional Circus Arts Training (PCAT) course and PCAT Preparatory course is designed to conclude with one month of training and performance in the big top tent.  Our goal is to bring our students into the ring, and connect them with the tradition of circus, by ensuring their access to Master-level coaches, and the enchanting environment of the big top tent.
Our Mission

story:
Every year the THROW! Poetry Collective forms a team of poets to represent Montreal at the Canadian national SLAM poetry competition. This year the competition is in Winnipeg! And the team is Alex Tkachuk, Raven Summers, Ashley Hope Nelson, and Anomaly, captained once again by Rabbit Richards!

Last year donations from our indiegogo campaign paid for our hotel for the entire festival, and that was a weight off our shoulders that helped us place 2nd in the country! The strength of our art is in our communities, and we're really grateful for your support. 

We've got some great perks as well!

story:
My Request:

My goal is to help other cancer patients and survivors to use yoga to gain strength, manage side effects and just be happy. It worked for me so I want to give it forward. 

To do this, I must first take a 200 hour yoga teacher training course that will provide me the skills, information and support to apply my own success with yoga to others.

However, my own cancer journey has left me unemployed and struggling to pay basic bills.  I work hard, very hard but I need your support to transform my dream of helping other survivors into a reality.  Please know that every penny will help me as a survivor help future cancer survivors.

 

My Story:

My name is Veronica de Paulo, I am 51 years old, I am Brazilian, I have been living in the US for the past 16 years. The first time I heard about Yoga was 30 years ago. I was very curious and interested in the subject, but I soon realized that yoga was not accessible to people of my socioeconomic status; I did not know any person or school who practiced, books were rare and expensive.

In 2003 I had my first yoga class, it was Bikram yoga. At that time, a life story was established and it seemed inevitable that Yoga would change my entire relationship with my body since my corporal consciousness and my diet naturally became healthier after Yoga class.

In 2009 I was diagnosed with breast cancer at a very advanced stage. This new reality was devastating and one of the things that scared me was the possibility, almost inevitable, to not be able to practice Capoeira and Yoga anymore, the two great passions in my life, my daily companions, my "treats" after long working hours.

During the first 2 years of treatment, chemotherapy, radiation, mastectomy and breast reconstitution, I was unable to practice Bikram yoga, due to the high temperature required in class. So I keep a moderate capoeira practicing and few Vinyasa flow Yoga once or twice a week.

Then In 2011 I was diagnosed with lymphedema, a chronic condition caused by the withdrawal of various lymph nodules that were compromised by the new reality of the cancer. This situation had increased even more my physical limitations. I feared that those were my last days practicing yoga and capoeira. 

It was at that time I came to yoga class for cancer with Tari Prinster.  The room was full of  women, most of them had never practiced yoga before. Even though I was used to a more vigorous yoga, this was a unique opportunity to keep practicing yoga and learn about how to manage my lymphedema.  

Over time, those warrior women who overcame cancer also overcame the obstacles and improved day by day the perform of the yoga asanas inspiring each other.

My personal experience at that time was rediscovering my body as my first home, the original home in which we live a lifetime...It was necessary to reorganize the home that had suffered a strong shock and had compromised structures. The yoga classes was indispensable, vital and gave me hope and strength.

Also, I started to realize that my presence and practices inspired other women who always showed appreciation.The teachers, Tari Prinster, founder of the yoga4cancer, and Kelly Considine (in memory), were two people who always encouraged and inspired me to take the next step and becoming an yoga instructor and help others in the same situation.

All the doctors that took care of me were impressed with my strength, disposition and recovery; they also encouraged me to follow my practice because the result is undeniable. Yoga classes has also helped me cope with anxiety, fear and sadness; little by little I recovered my life.

During these seven years of fighting cancer and a chronic lymphedema condition, loss of employment and fighting in court to not be evicted, yoga has been my daily companion, a magical path of self- knowledge and empowerment.

My personal experience with other women who has experienced cancer and practice yoga reassures me of the benefits of this practice to all its enormous healing power. With that awareness, love and dedication that I have decided to expand my knowledge to improve my own practice and at the same time to share that knowledge and benefits with other people, especially people with financial difficulties whom are struggling against cancer.

Details of the Training:

To be a qualified and informed yoga teacher,  I must complete a 200 hour yoga teacher training.  I have chosen to take the training with the studio - Yoga to the People - that has generously supported me both before and after my cancer treatments.  They are a non-profit studio that's mission is to make yoga available to everyone,regardless of his or her financial constraints.  That is evident in the free classes they have given me for the past 4 years so that I can stay healthy and active in my yoga practice and life.  

The 200 hour training costs - $2,850.  If I am able to raise enough funds by Sept 1st, I can get the early bird discount at $2,450. My training will begin on Sept 30 and complete on December 17, 2016.k

The training curriculum is:

  • Breaking Down the Asanas (Poses)
  • Adjustments & Alignment
  • Yoga Philosophy & History
  • Anatomy for Yoga
  • Breathing Techniques
  • Teaching a Class / Class Sequencing
  • Overview of Other Kinds of Yoga

Upon graduation from the course, I will be certified and able to register myself with Yoga Alliance for my RYT.  This will provide the validation to teach classes, privates and beyond.  

For more information about the training, please check it out here.

What will I do with the Training:

After receiving my yoga teaching certification,  my goal will then to gain the advanced training with Tari Prinster - my initial yoga for cancer teacher and mentor.  Her organization - yoga4cancer - is considered the best for advanced cancer teacher training and has trained over 1,600 yoga teachers.  I plan to join Tari and her community to implement my new skills so that I can help other survivors like me to live longer, healthier and happier through yoga.  

Why I need the financial support?

Cancer brings financial challenges along with the physical and psychological that I - and many others have faced.  I lost my job and have struggled with paying my significant bills.  Since...
