story:
Let us think of education as the means of developing our greatest abilities, because in each of us there is a private hope and dream which, fulfilled, can be translated into benefit for everyone and greater strength for our nation.

John F. Kennedy

                                                   Who am I? 

Hi, I’m Daphne Gabriel and I am actor fundraising my attendance at Bristol Old Vic Theatre School this fall. I'm currently a member of The Actors’ Gang and Imagine Us Free. I've performed all over Los Angeles with Opera del Espacio. I went Off-Broadway and did a social awareness piece called Innocent Flesh, a one act play on sex trafficking, and was offered a place at the amazing Bristol Old Vic Theatre School (BOVTS). This exquisite conservatory is located in West England in an amazing city called Bristol. BOVTS has been around since 1946 opened by world renowned actor Sir Laurence Olivier. The course I will be taking is the MA Professional Acting Course (One Yr course). I will be taking courses focused on the classical British and European repertoire, with emphasis given to hands-on exploration of Shakespearean text in performance. The course is also centered on developing the actor’s voice and body, training the actor with the knowledge and technique to fulfill the physical and vocal demands of a professional stage and screen performance.

 

               Alumni include: Daniel Day Lewis, Gene Wilder,
           Sir Patrick Stewart, Naomie Harris, Pete Postlethwaite,
               Greta Scacchi, Jeremy Irons, Mark Strong, and Antonia Thomas.

 

BOVTS is part of the UK's Conservatoire for Dance and Drama, and is one of only three drama schools to be affiliated. BOVTS is recognized by the the UK government for being a leader in training in the arts.

 

I grew up South Central Los Angeles where young girls aren't always encouraged to dream big. My mother and father noticed my interest in the arts when I was very young and decided to enroll me in acting classes. Since then I sang in my church choir and performed in every play. As a young actor, I looked for actors whom I could see myself in and admired to be like; Meryl Streep, Daniel Day Lewis, Angela Bassett, Naomie Harris, and Sanaa Lathan. Though, I admired these actors I hoped for someone I could reach out to. There are many girls in my neighborhood who are, right now, looking for the same thing. 

There is a desperate need for classically trained women of color in the arts and I hope to be, along with many other actresses, a catalyst that takes such an opportunity and run with it. Once back from my training, I will be creating an art programs for young children in South Central Los Angeles in hopes of helping them find their creative voice. Acting, Theatre, and Film have been vital in my confidence and with that I want to make a mark in this industry and inspire confidence and hope in many young children to dream BIG!

 

                                                    ~+~+~+~+~

                                Why  I need this and what You get?

I’ve tried twice before to attend conservatory training, but wasn’t able to because of one reason: money. This is my third try and my very last resort. When I saw how much I had to come up with, I felt overwhelmed and doubtful of whether I could make it happen.  My will is strong  and of course, there most certainly is a way!

Studying and living in England is quite expensive. Yes, yes it-tis. Tuition is 17,500 (GDP), which is $27,500. Living expenses run about 10,000 (GDP), which is $15,700. We just sent in about $9500 to hold my spot for this fall, but of course, I must come up with the rest of the finances. An estimated $3000 - $4000 will be covered by yours truly. The rest is where YOU come in!

Why this so important:

Your contribution will help me become a role model to young children in my communnity. I want them to know that they must always follow their dreams. 

    

    ~+~ What you get is on the side of this page! All those lovely perks! ~+~

 

                                How else you can help?

Besides being a sponsor you can help my campaign go very far by sharing this with FIVE friends! SHARE SHARE SHARE!

 

 

                                        ~+~+~+~+~+~

 

 MY WORK

http://resumes.actorsaccess.com/daphnegabriel

I am trained in the Meisner Technique under the Joanne Baron/D.W. Brown Studio in Santa Monica, Ca. story_txt:
Let us think of education as the means of developing our greatest abilities, because in each of us there is a private hope and dream which, fulfilled, can be translated into benefit for everyone and greater strength for our nation.
John F. Kennedy
                                                   Who am I? 
Hi, I’m Daphne Gabriel and I am actor fundraising my attendance at Bristol Old Vic Theatre School this fall. I'm currently a member of The Actors’ Gang and Imagine Us Free. I've performed all over Los Angeles with Opera del Espacio. I went Off-Broadway and did a social awareness piece called Innocent Flesh, a one act play on sex trafficking, and was offered a place at the amazing Bristol Old Vic Theatre School (BOVTS). This exquisite conservatory is located in West England in an amazing city called Bristol. BOVTS has been around since 1946 opened by world renowned actor Sir Laurence Olivier. The course I will be taking is the MA Professional Acting Course (One Yr course). I will be taking courses focused on the classical British and European repertoire, with emphasis given to hands-on exploration of Shakespearean text in performance. The course is also centered on developing the actor’s voice and body, training the actor with the knowledge and technique to fulfill the physical and vocal demands of a professional stage and screen performance.
 
               Alumni include: Daniel Day Lewis, Gene Wilder,           Sir Patrick Stewart, Naomie Harris, Pete Postlethwaite,               Greta Scacchi, Jeremy Irons, Mark Strong, and Antonia Thomas.
 
BOVTS is part of the UK's Conservatoire for Dance and Drama, and is one of only three drama schools to be affiliated. BOVTS is recognized by the the UK government for being a leader in training in the arts.
 
I grew up South Central Los Angeles where young girls aren't always encouraged to dream big. My mother and father noticed my interest in the arts when I was very young and decided to enroll me in acting classes. Since then I sang in my church choir and performed in every play. As a young actor, I looked for actors whom I could see myself in and admired to be like; Meryl Streep, Daniel Day Lewis, Angela Bassett, Naomie Harris, and Sanaa Lathan. Though, I admired these actors I hoped for someone I could reach out to. There are many girls in my neighborhood who are, right now, looking for the same thing. 
There is a desperate need for classically trained women of color in the arts and I hope to be, along with many other actresses, a catalyst that takes such an opportunity and run with it. Once back from my training, I will be creating an art programs for young children in South Central Los Angeles in hopes of helping them find their creative voice. Acting, Theatre, and Film have been vital in my confidence and with that I want to make a mark in this industry and inspire confidence and hope in many young children to dream BIG!
 
                                                    ~+~+~+~+~
                                Why  I need this and what You get?
I’ve tried twice before to attend conservatory training, but wasn’t able to because of one reason: money. This is my third try and my very last resort. When I saw how much I had to come up with, I felt overwhelmed and doubtful of whether I could make it happen.  My will is strong  and of course, there most certainly is a way!
Studying and living in England is quite expensive. Yes, yes it-tis. Tuition is 17,500 (GDP), which is $27,500. Living expenses run about 10,000 (GDP), which is $15,700. We just sent in about $9500 to hold my spot for this fall, but of course, I must come up with the rest of the finances. An estimated $3000 - $4000 will be covered by yours truly. The rest is where YOU come in!
Why this so important:
Your contribution will help me become a role model to young children in my communnity. I want them to know that they must always follow their dreams. 
     
    ~+~ What you get is on the side of this page! All those lovely perks! ~+~
 
                                How else you can help?
Besides being a sponsor you can help my campaign go very far by sharing this with FIVE friends! SHARE SHARE SHARE!
 
 
                                        ~+~+~+~+~+~
 
 MY WORK

I've studied Viewpoints under Tanya Kane-Parry (NYU-Tisch), Commedia Dell'Arte under Cynthia Ettinger, Mary Eileen O'Donnell, and Jon Kellam (The Actors' Gang), and Le Jeu/Clown under Dominique Serrand (The Moving Company). I am a member of The Actors' Gang (Artistic Dir. Tim Robbins).

story:
Short Summary

The money you donate will help us to buy a piece of land from Haiti and to build a Rehabilitation Center for the kids in the street of Haiti. Many children of Haiti still live on the street without any hope, education, family, clothes or knowing that there is a Savior who cares for them. For these reasons we want to offer them a place where they can find that Savior, Joy and peace in their heart.

The Donation money you send will help to decrease delinquency of young kids in the street in Haiti, and also build believing leaders for this nation to support those children's development in the future also.

we set up this campaign as an easy way for those of you who wish to help out to do so. This campaign will give the kids a second chance to find joy in their life and to grow to become a responsible adult. Any help you can give in form, which Lord places in your heart is welcome. there are no minimum amount or other requirement. Your prays for this project are most welcome also.

So the helpless has hope, you are the one who help us to bring joy in their life, hear it and know it for yourself, because you send your support to them. God will help this project to come through, if it pleases him, so pray for us and help us in any way you see fit.

What we need & What you get

We need 100000 USD to get started with this projec, it will help us to buy a land from Haiti and start the construction of the rehabilitation center for the kids who live in the street without hope, family and nothing and still do not know who Jesus is. We want to offer them a place where they can find joy and also meet Jesus.

The Land and the building will be put under the name of the organization which is founded already for this project. With donation money, life will be transformes in Haiti for men and women who will be to work for the next generation. They will work as teacher, supporters, mentors and such for these children. We have no money or other earthly means to offer to you in return, but those children that will be enjoying the facilities that you help us to build, will for sure be grateful. You will be impacting the lives of these children for long time.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can help this project to succeed:

  • continue to pray for the kids in the street in Haiti
  • Ask the Lord what he puts on your heart about this project
  • Ask people you know to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign
  • Contribute financially
  • Ask your friends to support us

story:
Roman Needs a Laptop

I have been a friend of Roman's for over 10 years. He is a hardworking and dedicated 21 year old. He hasn't always had the material things that some of us take for granted, but that has never stopped his hard work and determination.

Roman struggled a bit in high school, and therefore was unable to go straight to a four year college, but instead went to City College of SF and worked hard to obtain his AA degree, AND win the state championship in football.

Roman was accepted to the University of Idaho, and is also playing football for their team, the Vandals. He is #87, and is already making his mark!

Roman is finding it a bit harder to maintain his grades and keep up with his work at a four year college, and having an old undependable laptop isn't helping!

 

Hoping to Raise enough for a decent laptop ( UNABLE to change the amount NEEDED - but will be happy if we can get to $1000)

  • Every dollar given will go directly towards Roman's new laptop ( tax, warranty & fundraising fees)
  • Depending on your contribution, you can earn baked goods or an entire home cooked dinner!!
  • Whether the goal is reached or not, all funds will go towards a new laptop - if we don't reach our goal the funds will go into a savings account, until our goal is reached.

Please help Roman be successful

  • Many of us take a working computer for granted - please help Roman with a computer that will last him the duration of his time at the University of Idaho. Please help make a difference in his education and his life

story:
Short Summary

At the Mansfield Art Center we know that many of us would not have the joy of a career in the arts, the chance to do what we love every day, if we hadn't had great mentors along the way.  That is why we want to create the Summer Art Mentorship Program so area youth can have the privilage of a one-on-one experience with a professional artist who cares about them. 

What We Need & What You Get

There are some basic costs involved with properly screening our mentors and administering this program.  We need a small amount of money, only $2500 to ensure that we can execute this impactful program.  As a sponsor you will be invited to the end of summer party where you can meet the youth and their mentors as well as have the opportunity to see their artwork they made over the summer.

The Impact

Mentorship works!  Youth who have mentors excel far beyond their peers and we want to nurture any young person who loves art.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't spare a few bucks, you can still volunteer as a mentor or donate art supplies.  Or better yet, ask a friend to donate!

story:
Payton was born on June 20 2010,  after an uneventful pregnancy, 6 hours later she turned blue and was rushed away to Childrens hospital in Denver over 2 hours away.  She was diagnosed with a major heart condition and when she was 2 days old she had open heart surgery . During this surgery she suffered a stroke.  After 5 weeks in the hospital we were finally able to take our little princess home.  



When she was  almost 3 months old she started having seizures, up to 20 a day, which at the time Dr's thought were related to the brain damage that she had suffered from the stroke.   After spending lots of time in and out of Childrens Hosptital in Denver,  months of testing and more medications then I thought one kid could ever take, she was eventually diagnosed with Aicardi syndrome.  This is a very rare genetic disorder where the corpus callosum  is missing from the brain.  This is the part of the brain that lets the right and left side talk to each other.   Dr's have told us that Payton will probably never walk and will always have pretty significant developmental delays.  The most difficult thing to deal with is that Payton will never speak with her own voice.  We are hopeful that she will beat the odds and someday walk on her own.  She has already shown the Dr.'s that she will write her own story and has done more than they ever thought she would. 


She receives therapy 3 times a week, (OT, PT, and speech) and her therapists have suggested several times that an I-Pad would be a huge tool for her. Not just for a communication tool, which is a great reason alone, but also for learning and developing her motor skills.She has used an I-Pad in therapy before and loves it and does amazing with them. Being a single income family though right now this is not in our budget. It would mean so much to Payton to be able to have this amazing gift. Any help is so greatly appreciated.   Please feel free to spread the word about this fundraiser for our precious little girl.  Whether it's $1 or $100 it all helps.

story:
College debt in the United States has reached a trillion dollars. Current college students face decisions of whether they can continue their education due to financial troubles. Graduating high school students, especially those from economically disadvantaged backgrounds, have strained access to college simply due to finances. These are both huge problems that many are debating, but we wanted to stop debating and do something about it–by using fashion.

The Bracelets With Benefits Campaign is a collaboration between Million Dollar Scholar and Isolated Art Design Studio to create a scholarship fund for current and rising college students by offering an educationally themed collection of Isolated Art’s customized bracelets to the general public. This collaboration is the first between Million Dollar Scholar and isolated Art and will be a small but significant step in creating sustainable ways to help students have increased access to financial-aid.

 

 

 











How The Funds Will Be Used

We need your support to raise two $1,000 scholarships. 100 Percent of the proceeds from the perks involved in this campaign will be used to contribute to the scholarship fund. The two scholarships that will be offered, called the Bracelts With Benefits Scholarship, will be awarded based on a merit-based application process. One scholarship will be awareded to a student graduating from a Chicagoland high school and one scholarship will be awarded to a rising sophomore attending one of the colleges in the Atlanta University Center (Spelman College, Clark Atlanta University, and Morehouse College). In summary:

  • One $1,000 scholarship will be awarded to a high school senior graduating from a Chicagoland high school.
  • One $1,000 scholarship awarded to a college Freshman/rising Sopomore attending one of the Atlanta University Center schools.
  • Both scholarships will awarded after a merit-based scholarship application process. Application can be found at www.milliondollarscholar.com

 

Why Fashion?

Fashion is a form of expression that transcends many cultures and worldviews because of its universal nature. Though individuals may differ in how they express themselves through fashion, it remains something that people from all different walks of life can appreciate and contribute to. In addition, fashion is a medium that presents unique opportunities to impact the lives of people by elevating awareness about societal issues such as rising college costs and the increasing need for scholarship programs. Fashion is done everyday, but it is not everyday that fashion is used to benefit the lives of students.

 

The Benefits You Get

There are no profits being made, just a scholarship fund being formed. Therefore, you get the benefit of knowing that by contributing to this campaign in any way, you are directly contributing to helping students fund their education. The two students you will help fund will be students that are selected after an objective scholarship application process, so you can rest assured that they will be deserving all around. In addition, if you choose a perk at the Supporter Level or above you get one or more customized bracelets produced by Isolated Art Design Studio. These bracelets are limited-edition (only 50 of each color available + serial number provided) and exclusive to this campaign. They feature a detailed graduation cap with multichromatic stones that complement various colors. These bracelets make an excellent graduation gift–no pun intended.

BROWN ELEGANCE BLACK EXCELLENCE

 

 Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share The Bracelets With Benefits Campaign with your friends, family, or colleagues on your Facebook and Twitter #braceletswithbenefits
  • Submit ideas about other perks that we can offer
  • Send us pictures of you rocking your new bracelet so you can get featured– info@milliondollarscholar.com
  • Post comments and thoughts about the campaign on IndieGoGo
  • If you would like to donate in a way not covered by the perks please contact us at info@milliondollarscholar.com
  • Visit www.milliondollarscholar.com and www.isolatedart.com to find out more about the other work being done.
  • Share the scholarship application with anyone you believe could benefit.


Who Is Behind This Project?

About 

Isolated Art is a design studio founded by QuoVadis Gates for those who wish so desperately for limited and personally inspired fashion items. Through Isolated Art's fashion, individuals can remain individuals because our innovative and bold pieces Isolate customers from the crowd.

About 

Million Dollar Scholar is a movement founded by Derrius Quarles with the mission to support high school and college students in funding their dreams and empower youth across the world to seek higher education. Million Dollar Scholar offers guidance and tangible resources to help students–high school and undergrad–become more competitive for scholarships and reduce debt amounts.

 

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING!

story:
I Am Me!

Its all in the title. 

The world today is all about definitions. Black, white, gay, straight, husband, wife, child, mother, fat, skinny, tall, short, muslim, jewish, rich, poor, succesful, pretty, sensitive, talented.................

 

                                            stop! 

 

 

                          You are who you are. Period.

 

We are building expectations for kids to try and live up to, those can generate a lot of disappointment, confusion and unhappiness.

equality for ALL..

Let's teach kids today that they just are who they are, and its for them to find out what brings them joy. It's through the ability to truely accept and love yourself that we are able to treat others like we want to be treated. 

It's that simple. To make the world a better place.

The book I Am Me speaks both to kids and adults. It was initially written in Hebrew and was translated to English while maintaing it's sweet and flowing charm. When you order make sure to specify the desired language.

By supporting the publication of this book you'll help deliver this message of equality, self acceptance and love to young kids, helping to sculpt their vision of this world and encouraging them to be kind towards themselves and others.

 

what's the plan?

funds raised through this campaign will allow: 

  • illustration

  • graphic design

  • printing

  • distribution

 

This message is long due and on it's way!

Help spread it to as many as possible.
story_txt:
I Am Me!
Its all in the title. 
The world today is all about definitions. Black, white, gay, straight, husband, wife, child, mother, fat, skinny, tall, short, muslim, jewish, rich, poor, succesful, pretty, sensitive, talented.................
 
                                            stop! 
 

 
                          You are who you are. Period.
 
We are building expectations for kids to try and live up to, those can generate a lot of disappointment, confusion and unhappiness.
equality for ALL..
Let's teach kids today that they just are who they are, and its for them to find out what brings them joy. It's through the ability to truely accept and love yourself that we are able to treat others like we want to be treated. 

It's that simple. To make the world a better place.
The book I Am Me speaks both to kids and adults. It was initially written in Hebrew and was translated to English while maintaing it's sweet and flowing charm. When you order make sure to specify the desired language.
By supporting the publication of this book you'll help deliver this message of equality, self acceptance and love to young kids, helping to sculpt their vision of this world and encouraging them to be kind towards themselves and others.
 
what's the plan?
funds raised through this campaign will allow: 


illustration


graphic design


printing


distribution

 
This message is long due and on it's way!
Help spread it to as many as possible.

story:
Our Story

Hollywood Arts is a one-of-a-kind arts academy for homeless and at risk young people ages 13-25. Since we first opened our doors in early 2007, more than 600 students have taken the opportunity to learn valuable life skills and develop a positive sense of self through classes in music, acting, fashion, dance, visual arts and more. Classes emphasize hands-on learning, mentor relationships, teamwork and technical skills, and are offered at no cost to the student. Using the arts as a vehicle, many of our classes lead to work-based mentorships, internships, and entry-level work opportunities.

 

But more than just a bunch of classrooms, teachers and students, Hollywood Arts has become a vital part of the community, serving as a safe haven, a melting pot for all the disenfranchised youth of all races, ethnicities and sexual orientation who have nowhere else to turn. Even though we are an arts based organization, our students come to us for housing referrals, medical services and other emergency services, not to mention the support and respect of our staff, volunteers and each other.


Unprecedented Success and New Challenges

 

We have been humbled by the incredible students we have worked with and the many thousands of people and organizations who have donated their money, time and goodwill to us. Like any organization, growth presents challenges - in this case - space. We have already outgrown our home of the last 4 years and will be moving into a new expanded center in March of 2011. We and our students are very excited about the new space but we need your help to ensure its success.

 

Your gift will go towards supporting a new home base for our students - a learning environment that will allow them to get the focus and attention they need in order to transform their lives.  

 

A Message from Board Member, Steve Vai


"Hollywood Arts is a vital Organization that puts creative tools in the hands of homeless and at-risk teens. Utilizing our creative side can be a cathartic process of self discovery. The feeling of creative achievement can give a person a sense of dignity and purpose. I've seen this happen multiple times with Hollywood Arts students. In some cases it's the vital link in transforming a person from being a burden on society to being a valuable contributer. I am honored to be on the Board of Directors of Hollywood Arts and hope that you can help us serve these amazing young people."

The Drive

 

Hollywood Arts started over 6 years ago as an ambitious idea and with this fundraising drive, we are about to set a new bar for ourselves - we want to raise $100,000 before our new space opens. We are asking all of you for a few things that we hope you can help with:

1. Donate $25 (or more)

2. Let  people know you are supporting the cause by using the share tools below or by personal post, tweet, e-mail, fax, smoke signals - whatever you can do to spread the word.

3. If you work for an organization that makes matching donations, let them know what you are doing and see if they will join in.

We need 2,000 people to donate $25 each to reach our online goal of $50,000. Each person who donates will have their name placed on the wall of our new center to honor their support. If you would like to donate more than $1,000, are interested in sponsoring a program or a class, need to send a check instead of using this online campaign or you would just like to know more about us, please contact us and we'll be happy to help.

 

Hollywood Arts Supporters Include: 

APM • AT&T • Blizzard Entertainment • BMG • BMI • Comcast Entertainment Group • DTS • FilmEngine, Insomniac Games • Levitt Pavillions • Paramount Pictures • Sony CEA (Playstation) • Microsoft • The Hills Treatment Center, Warner Brothers • William Morris Agency, and more.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Charlie Curtis and my dream is to attend Indiana University and attain a degree in Business; more specifically marketing. I have already outlined a business plan for a mobile application and website designed to use crowdsourcing for funding college education to help kids like me. I wish I had thought of it earlier but I don't have the time or the resources to build it in time for me to try to fund my college education. I have already been accepted to IU, and the only reason I wouldn't be able to go would be a lack of funds. At a steep rate of 45,000 a year, my family simply can't afford it. The Kelley School of Business at Indiana University is ranked the 6th best marketing school and number 1 in the nation in terms of job placement, and a degree from Kelley would give me the capabilities and talents needed to build my business and find work after college.

What I Need & What You Get

Obviously, any dollar amount would help toward my cost, whether it be one dollar or 500. What I plan to do is donate the same dollar amount I receive from crowd funding toward the general scholarship fund at IU after I graduate. While this will not directly affect most backers, most people understand the value of a college education, and this money would help kids like myself fulfill their dreams.

The Impact

Simply put, this campaign is going toward nothing more than my college education. I feel that a degree from Indiana is the best education I can get, and will put me in a position to succeed for the rest of my working life.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread my campaign by any means necessary! Use facebook, twitter, or any other social media! Obviously some people won't be able to help financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help by spreading the word! Any form of help is appreciated!

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone, Cheyenne here! As I'm sure many of you know it can be dificult to figure out what you are meant to do with your life. I have struggled with this since finishing my B.A. almost six years ago. A year and a half ago I started working as an assistant librarian at a local high school. Immidiately I realized how much I loved this job and went on the hunt for how to make a career out of it. I have just been accepted into the Masters of Library and Information Science program at the University of Denver. (YAY!!)

As a result of this acceptance I will be relocating to Denver, Colorado on May 23rd, 2013. As I'm sure many of you know relocating can be very stressful and expensive. I'm trying to raise the money for my moving expences and first and last month's rent.

I'm not trying to pull any punches here, all the money will be going directly to me to assist in my move. Your generosity will help me immensely! 

What We Need & What You Get

I am trying to raise money for my first and last months' rent and for the shipping of my things. I know that times are tough for everyone and I would greatly appreciate any donation you can afford.

I am offering different gifts for different levels of monetary donation. These gifts are nothing fancy, but fun little tidbits to make this process fun for everyone. You can see the detail of these offers on the right hand side of the screen. 

If I reach my goal in time, Indiegogo takes 4% of my profits as payment. If I do not reach my goal in time I will still get my funds, but Indiegogo will keep 9% of the profits. So please help me get there on time.  :-) 

Thank you so much for your consideration!

story:
What is El Campo?

'El' in Kyrgyz means 'people' so El Campo literally means 'The Peoples' Camp.' This 8-day overnight camp will include 70 campers from the rural areas of Kyrgyzstan. Its purpose is to empower Kyrgyz youth with lessons in civic engagement, cross-cultural awareness, project planning and implementation, and creativity through the arts. We aim to highlight the connection between creative thought, tolerance and strong leadership. The camp will conclude with our most important goal, where campers will apply their knowledge to create grassroot social projects within their communities, and realize their capacity for positive impacts.

Be a part of the movement. Be a part of the change. Because with El Campo, change lies in the hands of our youth!

 

How You Can Help! 

The funds we are asking for will be used towards meal purchases and transportation for staff and campers. As an over-night camp, 3 meals per day will need to be provided to all 70 campers. Additionally, because we want to reach out to youth in the more rural areas of Kyrgyzstan, transportation funds will be used to subsidize the cost of traveling to and from the camp for campers who may not otherwise be able to afford it. 

Don't forget to look at our perks for donating! Perks range from receiving our bi-daily El Campo newsletter to keep you up-to-date on the camp events to our commemorative video to an official El Campo T-shirt!

Our Impact in Kyrgyzstan

Through the formal education system in Kyrgyzstan youth are not given opportunities to express creativity nor solve challenges through critical thinking methods. During our first annual El Campo in the summer of 2012 we saw huge results in our campers taking initiatives to lead in their communities.

Many of the campers became more active in the social sphere, participated in youth engagement events and many even became members volunteer-based NGOs. Camper-initiated projects included: the creation of an assembly to frequent local orphanages, the initiation of national park clean-up group, and the formation of a lemonade-stand project that raised money for disenfranchised children. 

Help Doesn't Simply Mean Money!

We understand not everyone can contribute monetarily, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help out:

  • Make some noise about our El Campo campaign! Like our page on Facebook. Share our video on Youtube. Or just tell a friend about us!
  • And don't forget about the easy Indiegogo share tools found on this page!

story:
WHO AM I?

Hello! My name is Luke Bielawski. I am in my final year of law school in Indianapolis, Indiana. This year I started a not-for-profit called Get On The Green to give back to the youth in my community.

WHAT IS GET ON THE GREEN?

Get On The Green is an Indiana-based 501(c)(3) not-for-profit corporation that uses the game of golf to raise awareness and fundraising for worthwhile local, regional, and national charities.

This summer of 2013 Get On The Green is raising money for Providence Cristo Rey, a private, Catholic, college-preparatory high school devoted to providing a free education to under-privileged and at-risk youth.

THE EVENT

From Tee to Shining Tee is the fundraising event through which awareness and money will be raised for Providence Cristo Rey. I will be striking a golf ball from Monterey Peninsula, California all the way to the beaches just south of Charleston, South Carolina. I will be playing the ball as it lays, on old country roads, through fields, and through the desert. The trip will take about 110 days, 48,000 swings, and 3,200 lost golf balls to complete.

Many golf fundraisers and charity events have had great success with golf marathons. This is the ultimate golf marathon and is a true endurance event. Based on the uniqueness of the journey combined with the great cause of furthering the education of underprivileged youth, the From Tee to Shining Tee event and Get On The Green look forward to raising a substantial amount of money for the good cause.

WHY I NEED YOUR HELP

Your contributions and assistance will allow me and my team to successfully complete the cross-country trip. There are significant costs that go into this trip, including but not limited to: gas, golf balls, food, transportation, administrative costs, etc. The more generous contributors like yourself fund our journey, the more fundraised dollars we will be able to give directly to Providence Cristo Rey.

THE IMPACT

Get On The Green's fundraising goal is to be able to give $100,000 to Providence Cristo Rey. Our estimated trip costs are $15,000. Therefore, to achieve our goal of giving Providence $100,000 we would need to raise $115,000 total.

Giving $100,000 to Providence will pay for the tuition for 15 underprivileged kids. The program at Providence is highly transformative. The school has a 100% graduation rate and a 100% college acceptance rate. What makes the school unique is that they fit 5 days of school into 4. On the fifth day the students participate in a work study program at various businesses around Indianapolis. This experience has a tremendous impact on these young peoples' lives.

CAN'T DONATE? YOU CAN STILL HELP!

We can't procure any donations without people knowing about what we're doing. As such, regardless of whether you can make a contribution or not, share this page with your friends and family! Use the Indiegogo share tools! Visit our website at www.getonthegreen.org

Thank you!!

story:
Help Disadvantaged Kids Have a Great Day!

We are a team of MBA students from the University of Maryland working with Dreams for Kids, a non-profit providing opportunities for kids with disabilities and at-risk kids. Dreams for Kids empowers youth who live in poverty and those with disabilities by uniting them with their peers.
 
Specifically, we will be taking a small group of kids (about 10 years old) from the DC area to a Washington Nationals game, providing them a full day of fun, ballpark food, and Nationals merchandise.
 
If we get only 50 people to contribute $10 each, we'll have what we need (and hopefully more)!
 

What We Need

  • We want to provide an amazing day for the kids and their parents by letting them buy plenty of ballpark food and providing them Nationals t-shirts, hats, or whatever we can afford with the money we raise.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will have to scale back the great stuff we can provide, which would be disappointing.
  • We don't need much - if a small group of you can contribute $10 (or more), these kids and parents will have an amazing day.
  • If we raise more than we can use, the rest will go straight to Dreams for Kids!

What You Get

  • The satisfaction of knowing that your generous contribution brought a smile to the faces of young disadvantaged kids and provided them with a great day filled with fun!

The kids need your help to have an amazing day at a Nationals game!

story:
Hi,

My name is Gideon, I am 73 years of age, born and lived most of my life in Israel.

My father Joseph died when I was 5 and my mother hardly could support me.

Ever since - I have been struggling to achieve my goals - by myself - doing this by hard work and accumulation of knowledge and higher education.

Few years ago turning 70 I realized there is no point in postponing the dream I thought I never achieve – getting a PhD. Doing whatever it takes I started the studies (in UBB University, Cluj), being the oldest student in my class. Although my age and the generation gap I managed to excel my first year. Getting to second year I ran out of funds to continue my research.

I realized that this time I need to do something different In order to achieve this goal, maybe for the last time, and have you as my partner. Succeeding here will show me and the world that dreams are to be achieved!

The PhD research, when accomplished, will create a better well being to people and society by creating the interior architecture profession recognized around the world

Your support can help me to materialize my lifetime dream.

 Total sum required is $ 28,000

  1. Two year Studies - 20,000$
  2. Translations, statistics, traveling expenses ext. - 6000$
  3. tax and fees - 2000$

If money accepted exceeds what required it will be contributed to the association of interior architects in Israel (AiAI)

My perks will include architecture advice, personal thanks and greetings and my PhD in hard copy or e-book and you mentioning there.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • You can get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Introduction


We are CAST Astro Sciences (CIO Trust; England, Wales UK), a research group that works in minor planet research (Comets and Asteroids) and Stellar research (massive and variable stars and star clusters), we also Teach STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) education & provide materials to schools and interested groups. Along with these two aspects, we manage a number of citizen science research projects in our research areas, working with amateur astronomers and citizen scientists to conduct professional research and provide them education and guidance when needed.

The purpose of this project is to enhance the STEM education of all school aged children, to provide them a new piece of scientific research equipment that has never been available to them before. As well as opening access to the public for their own use.


Radio Interferometry: Bringing the Universe to you through Radio

Is a funding project to enable the development and construction of the first publicly accessible radio telescope interferometer baseline array. This resource will be made available to schools, located anywhere in the world, so that they can learn about the Universe and the objects within using radio astronomy. Along with access to the array we will provide STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) educational materials which can be used with the radio interferometer baseline array for lesson plans. We will also provide training and guidance to teachers so that they can lead their students in using the radio interferometer baseline array to explore the scientific characteristics of astronomical objects in the Universe.

The radio telescope interferometer baseline array will also be made available to the public; amateur astronomers, citizen scientists, or anyone interested in exploring astronomical objects (the planets in our solar system, the Sun, asteroids & comets, nebulae, stars and star clusters, galaxies, black holes, pulsars and more) for their own research purposes, or they may take part in any of the CAST Astro Sciences citizen science research projects if they want to contribute to that type of research.


Funding & Prizes


We are asking for £30,000 to procure the equipment and technology necessary to build the radio interferometer baseline array and maintain it's operational status once complete, if you are interested in this project, if you would like to donate observational time on the array to a school of your choice, or would like to access it's resources yourself, this would be an excellent opportunity to get involved with the development and construction of this publicly accessible radio telescope array.

The money donated will go to purchase the equipment for a 5 dish telescope array; this includes the 5 telescope dishes, ranging in the 3m +/- mark, the specialised mounts to support them and coordinate movement in unison with the other telescopes. Signal noise blockers, signal enhancers, and signal receivers as well as an array correlator. Fibre optic cable to enable the telescopes to be connected to their receivers and the correlator as well as the control systems and power relay, as well as armouring to ensure the optic cable is protected from damage. The telescope array control system which will control all aspects of the array from a central point, allow the telescopes to be centred on an astronomical object in unison and to send & receive signals. The design and development of the array website and  internet remote control system to enable the use of this array from anywhere in the world with an internet/wifi connection and the use of a computer, tablet or smartphone. Due to the significant amount of data that the radio telescope interferometer baseline array will collect, there will be a dedicated high capacity storage server array and cloud storage backup.

Following this, the radio interferometer array will be engineered and installed by specialist engineers familiar with the high precision engineering required for astronomical equipment.

This is an example of what the radio telescope interferometer array could look like:



There are a variety of prizes available to those donating towards this project, the full list of prizes and their details can be seen on the donation tiers, but they include high definition framed prints of astronomical objects taken with our research grade optical scopes, pieces of asteroids and impact tektite glass and other prizes. At certain donation levels you can obtain telescope time to observe whatever you are interested in, and at other donation levels you can nominate a school to receive observatory time on the radio interferometer array coupled with STEM educational materials and training in their use which is an excellent opportunity to provide your children, nephews, nieces, cousins, friends or any school aged child the opportunity to access an excellent scientific resource and take part in exploring the Universe in a way that has never been available to them before.


Below is an example of some of the print quality images, from our large catalogue, that will be made available on some donation tiers:


Below is an example of the asteroid/meteorite pieces and impact tektite glass that will be available on some donation tiers:


As a bonus, for donating to this project, we will include access to a 0.35m research grade optical telescope and scientific filter array to schools and the public, this will allow you to take direct images of astronomical objects, conduct scientific research using spectrophotometric analysis and produce light curves of the objects you image.



What is Radio Interferometry, why is it important, and why should we donate to this project?

Radio Interferometry is used to increase the angular resolution and signal detection capability of radio telescopes. By taking multiple radio telescopes, even those of smaller dish sizes, and spacing them some distance apart (meters to kilometres) in a baseline and while aligning their focus on the same object, we can combine the angular resolution of the smaller dishes so that they act as one large radio telescope. If we were to take four, 3 meter radio telescopes and place them in an baseline array 30 meters apart from each other, we can increase their combined capability into one very large radio telescope that is able to see astronomical objects in greater clarity, and with a stronger signal, than those individual radio telescopes observing on their own.    This is achieved by aperture synthesis, otherwise known as synthesis imaging, which is a method of interferometry that mixes signals from a collection of telescopes to produce images having the same angular resolution as an instrument the size of the entire collection. At each separation and orientation, the lobe-pattern of the interferometer produces an output which is one component of the Fourier transform of the spatial distribution of the brightness of the observed object, the Fourier transform is a mathematical transformation that we use to transform signals between time, or spatial, domain and frequency domain, it is reversible, being able to transform from either domain to the other.  The image of the astronomical object is produced from these measurements. 

This link provides basic information about radio telescope interferometry:  Guide to Interferometry

It is this combination of enhanced angular resolution and ability to combine smaller radio dishes to act as a unified larger radio telescope that makes interferometry such an important aspect of radio astronomy, the enhanced signal collection and data analysis this provides us, provides greater detail about the objects in our solar system and within our Universe.

This is a tool that has never before been available to schools, for them to learn a new field of science, hands-on, and to explore the different physical properties and aspects of astronomical objects that optical telescopes can not see. The ability to explore a black hole, such as the SMBH at the centre of our galaxy (Sgr A*), and see it in greater detail for themselves, having done the research that collected that data themselves, is an exciting aspect that many of us would have liked for ourselves, but were never provided that opportunity to learn different aspects of those sciences that would make that possible, to involve ourselves directly with doing work in those scientific aspects, to explore the Universe in a whole new way.     Why not contribute to making that a possibility for the children in the schools of today? To expanding their horizons with new concepts in a future where science has an ever growing importance, to allow them to relive many of our childhood dream's of looking out at the stars, but through the radio spectrum with a radio telescope, instead of through the eyepiece of an optical telescope? 

The other benefit is that this provides amateur astronomers, citizen scientists and any member of the public interested in exploring astronomical objects through the method of radio astronomy, the opportunity to access the radio interferometer baseline array for their own research using a scientific research grade tool, never before available to them. While some amateur astronomers may have access to a self built radio telescope, none have had access to a scientifically viable radio interferometer baseline array for greater research capabilities. To expand upon their research interests with greater signal cohesion, angular resolution, image synthesis, spectral analysis, to explore in greater detail, their objects of interest through multi-wavelength capability.

Supporting this project provides multiple benefits for our children and their schools, for citizen scientists and anyone interested in looking up at the sky through a different pair of "eyes". By contributing to this project, you will have the gratitude of CAST Astro Sciences and everyone that will be able to access this array, access new areas of STEM science, receive education in a field of science never before accessible to them, and be able to do scientific research, either on their own projects or in any number of citizen science projects.

If you find this project interesting, or know someone who would, if you know children who's school could benefit from access to this array, please forward the link to this Indiegogo campaign to them and let them know about it, thank you.


All school & observation package donations guarantee first access to the radio telescope interferometry baseline array. Due to the increasing interest in this array, there will likely be a waiting period before you are able to schedule your observational time, so the packages purchased through this campaign guarantee the first observational sessions available on the array and optical telescope.


June 08th, 2014 Update:
There is limited time left on funding this array.
This is an amazing resource as it has never been offered to schools, students and the public before and at such a massive savings. A typical, single, 3m radio telescope from the professional manufacturers costs in excess of £23,000. We are providing 5 dishes for £30,000!
We have arranged for a discount on some of the engineering costs, allowing us to add an additional 3m radio dish to this array, making it a 6 dish radio telescope interferometer baseline array capable of even greater scientific research and educational projects.

story:
What Is the Kliptown Photography Project? 

The Kliptown Photography Project is dedicated to teaching documentary photography and creating opportunities for the high school students of Kliptown, South Africa, one of the oldest informal settlements in Soweto.  Please come visit us on our new page.

Our goals are teach photography and empower our students to communicate visually. We want our students to come away able to use photography to advocate for themselves, their families and their neighbors. We will be teaching them skills which will help them succeed in the modern South African economy. By supporting our venture you can be part of this process.

We will initially be in Kliptown for a week and will run a photography workshop at the Kliptown Youth Program. The workshop has been developed by an American photographer who will be assisted by three dynamic young African photographers. With your financial support we will be able to provide digital equipment which would otherwise be unavailable to the students. We will teach them how to publish their photos to blogs and websites.

We believe that learning photography is a way to foster creativity and connection. The students will gain skills as they learn to take photographs, publish photos online, exhibit their work, and become powerful voices for their community. You can connect with them by helping us buy cameras, pay for teachers, and fund exhibitions of their work.

The cameras you help us buy will remain with the Kliptown Youth Program so they may continue this initiative when the workshop is completed.

Exhibitions of the photographs taken by the students and their teachers are planned for both South Africa and the United States. By helping us fund these exhibits, you will allow the students to realize the full potential of their work, both economically and as social capital. And you will help them generate funds for their community.

We are currently raising funds to run the photography workshop in Kliptown the first week of July, 2014. We are also raising money to cover the costs of mounting both exhibitions in Soweto and Pittsburgh, respectively. But right now, we need to purchase equipment and pay salaries. By donating to our project you will be helping the students from a neglected and impoverished community get started on a path to creativity, entrepreneurship, and advocacy.

All of us together—you as a donor, us as facilitators, the photography teachers, and the students—can all work together to develop a photography program at the Kliptown Youth Program, which will empower everyone involved and generate funds for the Youth Program. This is a small program with a big impact and your support is crucial to its success.

What Does Your Money Pay For?

  • CAMERAS
    We will be teaching 12 high school aged students who live in Kliptown. We are bringing the cameras for the students to use and when our workshop is complete, the cameras will remain in Kliptown, for continued use at the Kliptown Youth Program. In this way, your money is not a one-time gift. Our greatest hope is that the project will remain sustainable under the guidance of the staff at the KYP, and we will be working with them to ensure that this happens. One aim of our project is to train students so that they can set up an on-line gallery to continue to document their lives and share their stories with the world.

  • LOCAL INSTRUCTORS
    We have four instructors who will be teaching the week-long seminar. Our lead instructor, Heather Mull, is donating her time and expertise. However, we feel strongly that our local photographers (Jerry, Patrick and Tila) will provide an invaluable service to our students and should be paid for their time and work. The unemployment rate in South Africa hovers around 25% and among black South Africans, the unemployment rate is closer to 70%. We are honored to be able to employ three talented, passionate photographers for the week.

  • MEALS FOR OUR STUDENTS
    For the week of our workshop, we will be providing both breakfast and lunch for our students. Many of the residents of Kliptown skip meals or go an entire day without eating. We want our students working at their best.

  • THE EXHIBITIONS
    Two exhibitions are planned, one in Soweto and one in Pittsburgh. Your donation will help to defray the cost of printing and mounting the shows.

How Does This Benefit Kliptown? 

  • FINANCIAL SUPPORT OF THE KLIPTOWN YOUTH PROGRAM
    After the week-long seminar, KYP will be mounting exhibitions of the work. Prints will be available for purchase. All proceeds from the sale of photographs will go to the Kliptown Youth Program, which runs meal programs, tutoring, athletics and arts programs for the youth of Kliptown. Read more about the Kliptown Youth Program.

  • CREATIVE AND TECHNICAL SKILLS
    During our week-long seminar, our students will learn the elements of photography, not the least of which is to build a comfort level simply using otherwise unavailable digital equipment. The students will learn some fundamentals of shooting interiors, photographing portraits, and capturing social issues.

  • EXPERIENCE WORKING WITH DIGITAL CONTENT
    We will also be teaching the students how to work on online platforms, to upload photographs and create web-pages so they may continue to share their world with the rest of the world.

  • A PLATFORM FOR NEW STORYTELLERS
    One of the purposes of the Kliptown Youth Program is to eradicate poverty of the mind, body and soul. The Photo Project has taken that as our mandate, as well. Beyond learning new marketable skills, beyond sharing their world with us, beyond raising money, our greatest hope is that our students will learn to value their own stories and know that their voices matter.


Why Kliptown? 

Kliptown is one of the original areas established during the 1903 relocation process, when the ruling British minority forcibly moved African and Indian mine workers to an area outside of Johannesburg. Kliptown is part of the much larger area of Soweto, and was originally known as Klipspruit ("klipspruit" translates to "rocky river" in Afrikaans). The settlement was at that time nothing more than a squatters camp with the rocky river running through it.

In post-apartheid South Africa, Kliptown itself has seen both major development and neglect. There have been over 1,000 units of affordable housing built near this site, yet there are also still 11 informal settlements or shantytowns in the area known as Kliptown.

We are working in a large "informal settlement," or shantytown, which has been in place since the 1940s. The settlement lacks basic municipal services (water, sewage, electricity, etc.) and struggles with issues of air pollution, illegal dumping, and water pollution. 

Families live with up to four generations in small homes made from corrugated tin, cardboard and other found materials. The students must leave the settlement to go to school. All residents must leave to obtain medical services and purchase food and goods.

Despite such conditions, the community has been supported by initiatives like the Kliptown Youth Program. We hope that the Kliptown Photography Project can help foster similar support and growth.


What If We Raise More Money Than Our Goal?

What if we exceed our goal? Well, that's a great problem to have. Very simply, any money not used to run the seminar or mount the exhibitions of the work goes to the Kliptown Youth Program.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, but you want to help, let us know. You never know, we might find something for you to do.

If you can't donate, or you can't donate much, one of the most helpful things you can do is promote this project. Put it on your Facebook account. Tweet it. Pin it. Load it on your Tumblr page. Get it out there. Please spread the word about our campaign.

Find us at our new campaign here!

Despite such conditions, the community has been supported by initiatives like the Kliptown Youth Program. We hope that the Kliptown Photography Project can help foster similar support and growth.
What If We Raise More Money Than Our Goal?
What if we exceed our goal? Well, that's a great problem to have. Very simply, any money not used to run the seminar or mount the exhibitions of the work goes to the Kliptown Youth Program.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate, but you want to help, let us know. You never know, we might find something for you to do.
If you can't donate, or you can't donate much, one of the most helpful things you can do is promote this project. Put it on your Facebook account. Tweet it. Pin it. Load it on your Tumblr page. Get it out there. Please spread the word about our campaign.

Find us at our new campaign here!

story:
About Me

My name is Alexis Scott, and I have been teaching at-risk students English and reading since 2005. I earned my master's in Reading in 2010, and I vowed never to stop learning the best ways to teach reading. In 2011, I attended my first International Reading Association (IRA) National Convention in Orlando. It changed my life. I spent the next year implementing what I had learned. In 2013, I was fortunate to attend a second time in San Antonio, and again, I left wishing I had known the things I learned all along. I am a much better reading specialist because of what I have learned at each conference, and my students reap the benefits. Now, in 2014, I would like to attend the annual conference again, this time in New Orleans. The bottom line: I want to keep learning how to be the best teacher I can be. These kids deserve it.

How you can help and What you get

The conference lasts three days, with a fourth day being dedicated to "research institutes" - eight hours of studying in depth research about a selected topic. The fees listed here include the IRA membership discount.

  • The conference fee: $399 (if not paid by April 14th)
  • The Institute fee: $199 (if not paid by April 14th)

Your donation in any amount is helpful. All donations up to $600 will go towards funding the conference fees. Any leftover donations will fund the travel expenses, including hotel and gas to get there.

Available Perks:

  • All donors will receive a handwritten thank you note from me, and a big hug if you live nearby.
  • Donations of $15 or more will receive an additional note on a postcard from New Orleans, mailed before I leave on the final day.
  • Donations of $30 or more will receive a handpicked souvenir from New Orleans, chosen by either me or my husband.
  • Donations of $75 or more get to customize their perk. In addition to the other things listed, I'm happy to get an autograph from the convention for you, pick a special book from the exhibitor's hall, bring you extra special treats from the city, bake you bread or fancy cupcakes (my banana cupcakes with cinnamon icing are especially good), or almost anything else we can think of. 

The Impact

I truly believe that attending the IRA Conference each year makes me a better reading teacher. I am able to keep up to date on current research and best practices, get new ideas, and network with educators and researchers from across the country. 

My students, struggling readers grades 3-5, benefit by having a teacher full of passion and excitement, armed with new and research-based ideas on how to help them unlock worlds through skilled reading.

You benefit by contributing to a world where children learn that they can read, and learn to love reading and school.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share, share, share

story:
About NodePaint

NodePaint is a image editing and drawing software that uses a node based approach to give you unbelievable flexibility and free your creativity from technical issues. While the node based approach is not new, node based software until now is usually geared towards movie and TV post production. NodePaint is the first software that specializes in the tasks of image editing and image creation. Node based image software of today is either free but very limited in feature set, or costs several thousand dollars and still is not optimized for image creation. NodePaint tries to fill this gap.

I am developing several 2D games at the moment and I ended up needing a flexible image editor for Linux. There is not much out there at the moment and therefor I decided to make one myself.

After almost a year of hard work and a couple of rewrites because the chosen technology ran into problems, I finally have a stable and fast basic multicore node framework and I am starting to add the nodes now.

Funding

I now need your help to cover a few things, like getting a Mac to be able to port it, getting necessary software licenses and cover some of my expenses to speed up the process.

The final version will be available for EUR 49 which is very affordable for professional high end image editing solution. This is your chance so save money and support the development, and most important, being a part of building your favorite image editing and painting solution.

Starting from the 19 EUR perk, you will get access to the ticket system which will allow you not only to report bugs, but also to download current releases and request features and therefor make the application to what you need.

Weekly builds

I am planning to release weekly builds which you will be able to download from the ticket system until version 1 is considered to be finished. Of course occasionally there will be features that take more then a week to develop, but 90% of the time you will see the application be filled with new functionality every week, you will be able to play around with it and give feedback about it to help further improve NodePaint.

Sponsors and sponsor links

All supporters of the campaign will be listed in the help menu in a sponsors dialog with an optional click-able web link you may provide. Please be warned, being based in Germany, these links must comply to German laws and should not point to spam, hatred, religious content, drug related content and illegal things... If you want to be linked and are in doubt if your link qualifies for linking, please contact me first.

System requirements

FreeBSD / PC-BSD:

FreeBSD / PC-BSD 9.1 or higher, 1GB RAM, 50 MB Harddisk space, OpenGL capable graphics card, 32 and 64 bit builds available

Linux:

Linux x86 3.2.0, glibc 3.13 or higher, 1 GB RAM, 50 MB Harddisk space, OpenGL capable graphics card, 32 and 64 bit builds available

Mac OSX:

Intel Mac with Mac OSX 10.6.8 or higher, 1GB RAM, 50 MB Harddisk space

Windows:

Windows Vista or higher, 1 GB RAM, 50 MB Harddisk space, OpenGL capable graphics card, 32 and 64 bit builds available

About me

My name is Heiko Irrgang, I started developing games way back on the Commodore 64 and since then I spent all of my professional and a lot of my personal life developing all kind of things, including several open source projects, but also commercial games and applications. A node based image editing software was a long dream of mine and finally I have something to build upon. Thank you very much for taking the time to read this and I would really appreciate your help by supporting this project, no matter if financial, or by spreading the word in forums, in life and where ever you think it's appropriate.

Thank you!

story:
UPDATE: Over 100 sets of Pocket Kitchen Ultimate snapped up so far! Thank you for your support, and stay tuned for updates on shipping! 

To get your own Pocket Kitchen Ultimate, please go to http://aiclay.com/menu/do-it-yourself.html

------------------------------------------------------------------------


Indulge in the world of miniatures

Build it. Wear it. Flaunt it. It's yours to keep. Having a Pocket Kitchen will allow you to create the miniature food items shown in the picture, and many more!

The Pocket Kitchen is designed with making everyone a MAKER, in mind.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We are shipping the Pocket Kitchen WORLDWIDE! (http://aiclay.com/menu/do-it-yourself.html)

If you are living in Singapore, shipping is free! Please note that under the Buddy Deal, both kits will be sent to one address unless you contact me separately with another address. 

Email me at buzz@aiclay.com if you have any queries.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


What is Pocket Kitchen about?

Pocket Kitchen is a treasure trove of everything you need* to embark on the magical journey of creating miniature food sculptures from polymer clay. 

Head to "What is in the Pocket Kitchen" for specific descriptions of the items. But if you're wondering why would you need Pocket Kitchen in your life, just answer these two questions. 
One, do you love food? It extends beyond the mere act of eating - to hunting down the best steakhouse, Instagramming your beautifully plated dessert, or experimenting on pancake recipes. If you've done any of the above, then move on.

Two, do you find it hard to stay focused at work or personal life?
Possible scenarios include thinking about your next meal when you're writing a report on the computer, or being distracted by the tv while in a phone call.

If it's a nod to both of these questions, then Pocket Kitchen will benefit you.

How will Pocket Kitchen benefit me?

With Pocket Kitchen, you are well equipped to start creating miniature food, inedible sculptures which will last for a lifetime.

And miniature food crafting is a highly rewarding process.

You get to observe details of the real food items you would like to recreate in miniature, take plenty of reference pictures and have a wonderful excuse to eat the reference subject in the end. After the creation process, you can display or wear the final products, an unique calorie-free way of exercising your love for food.


More importantly, it will make a positive impact on your focus skills.

There is so much noise in our world today, with everything clawing for our attention. It's no wonder why attention deficiency is a serious issue in both kids and adults alike. Which makes immersing in the here and now, really important.

Many of us need to regain the important ability to anchor oneself in the present, with neither burdens of the past nor worries of the future. And this is what Pocket Kitchen can enable you to do.

Miniature food crafting is about sitting down, and letting all your energies flow towards the polymer clay in front of you. I could be texturing a 'cake', putting on tiny decorations, rolling thin strands of 'noodles'. 


During the creative process, you immerse yourself in the physical experience of using the tools, seeing the material come to shape under your hands, and admiring your final work. It is a calming and rewarding journey which one has to experience to believe its effects on our overall well-being.

*Besides the Pocket Kitchen, you will also require a basic toaster/convection oven to bake your polymer clay works to permanent hardness. Including an oven in Pocket Kitchen will incur a much higher shipping cost and we don't want to add that to the price. Just buy a simple convection/toaster oven (with temperature and time setting) from your nearest store.

But what if I've never crafted before?



Jocelyn has had years of experience teaching miniature food workshops at AiClay (www.aiclay.com). The participants come from different age groups, genders, and levels of crafting experience. During these workshops, we use the same set of tools and materials you would receive with your set of Pocket Kitchen. So far, EVERY participant has been able to complete their miniature food works.

Miniature food crafting is easily picked up with the right guidance, regardless of your crafting experience.

============================================================

What is in the Pocket Kitchen


All tools and materials are specially manufactured or purchased specifically for the Pocket Kitchen, and they have been tested to ensure lasting quality.

The sturdy Pocket Kitchen box will allow you to store your tools and materials neatly away. Please note that the actual box might vary slightly in terms of design.

Here's a list of what is included in the Pocket Kitchen ULTIMATE:

A USB flash drive containing 12 complete miniature food video tutorials, produced by Jocelyn who has a wealth of experience in crafting and teaching miniature food sculpting. (Visit her website at www.aiclay.com) These tutorials will include step by step footage of how she created the miniature food item from scratch, coupled with useful techniques and tips. 

Below are three samples of the tutorial videos. Please note that the final videos may differ slightly.



Here are the 12 miniature food projects you can create using the collection of video recipes/tutorials. 

(From left to right) 

Note that all items are inedible and made of polymer clay. 

Row 1: Donut, Ice Cream in a Cone, Hot Dog Bun*

Row 2: Assorted Breads*, Ice Blended Drink, Rainbow Cake*

Row 3: Animal and Frosted Cupcakes, Cheeseburger, Gingerbread House

Row 4: Christmas Logcake, Macarons, Ham and Cheese Sandwich

*: The miniature packaging shown in pictures (i.e. basket, wooden board, paper box) will be sold in the store (www.aiclay.com) separately.


8 sets of 2oz. Premo! Sculpey polymer clay.


A set of Pocket Roller with 5 pairs of levellers with different heights. Two ceramic tiles as working surfaces.

A 50ml bottle of FIMO liquid gel and a bottle of FIMO 10ml gloss varnish from Staedtler.

2 high quality brushes, one for general painting and one for finer details.


1 set of soft pastel chalks consisting of 4 colours which are most commonly used for miniature food crafting.


A set of tools consisting of a stainless steel tissue blade, a sharp needle tool, a dual-function scalpel/rounded needle tool and a pair of tweezers.

(As there are sharp tools in the kit, please supervise your children when they are using the tools.)


A set of 5 metal circular cutters of different diameters.


2 set of glass bottles containing accessory findings to create different types of jewelry pieces.


(Please note that making accessories using the miniature food is an optional add-on and while we are providing the accessory findings, jewelry tools are not provided in the kit.)

An acrylic roller, a strip of blu tack, a piece of aluminium foil and a piece of sandpaper (picture not shown).

============================================================

You save time and money.

The retail price for everything above is at least USD140. For us to keep the cost of Pocket Kitchen affordable to you without compromising on quality, we need to buy/manufacture supplies in quantity of at least 1000 sets. This allows us to keep the final retail price for Pocket Kitchen lower than the combined prices of the individual sale prices of the items above (at external vendors).

When you decide on getting a set of Pocket Kitchen, you save not just money, but also time and effort in hunting down the individual material/tool from various sources.

When will I get my Pocket Kitchen?

If you have purchased the kit after 1 July, your kits will be sent out in August 2015. If your address is in Singapore, you should receive your order within 5 working days from the date of shipping. For the rest of the world, please allow 2-4 weeks for Pocket Kitchen to reach you.

For contributors of 'I support SMALL' perk, we will begin to ship these packages from 1st August 2015. All shipping progress will be updated via the Updates page.

Ok I want to get a Pocket Kitchen Ultimate! How?

Just head to http://aiclay.com/menu/do-it-yourself.html and click on the listing you want to purchase! Easy peasy! 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Support Pocket Kitchen by referring our campaign to anyone you think will interest them! Or just a small donation will mean a lot to us. Thank you.

Delivery of perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed. In the extremely rare case of non-delivery, you will receive a full refund from us.

story:
What is Allversity?

Just over two years ago a small team of geeks and nerds decided it was time to do something about the global education gap: we built a website where people could learn important things for free. From the start Allversity has been different from other educational platforms, here is why:

  • We partner with innovative non-profits to create courses about health, sustainable agriculture, human rights, and entrepreneurship.
  • We don't believe that people in poor communities should pay to learn basic skills that save lives or strengthen communities; this is why we work also with our partners to build free courses in professional development. 
  • And from the start we have paid for this thing out of our own pockets, we are doing this because we want to make education work for more people in more places, not to make a buck.

Our team believes that education is the key to building a future in which people around the world can live happier and healthier lives, while taking better care of each other and the planet.

Why We Need Support

Last Friday we were invited to attend Africa's largest eLearning conference in Kampala, which takes place in just TWO WEEKS!

The problem: we can't afford the transportation. 

This invitation is a big deal as it is the perfect conference for us, in a country where we have already been doing a lot of work. Given this great opportunity, we want to make the most of it. So here is what we will be doing: 

  1. Attending and moderating panels at eLearning Africa 2014, using the conference as a chance to connect with potential partners and sponsors.
  2. Outside the conference we will be meeting with our new local partners from the Afrika Rise network in Uganda who want to use Allversity as a tool in their educational projects. We want to help them get started and see what we can do to improve access.
  3. We will be talking with existing users about their educational needs, collecting information we can then transmit to our content-creating partners and their funders.
  4. And most importantly: learning from our students about what they need and want to learn.

The Impact

This trip is a huge deal for our team, a chance to connect on the ground and build towards more locally-inspired learning materials on the site:

  • While on the ground Ysanne and Shane can collect data that will help us determine what materials need to be built for the site.
  • The trip allows us to connect with other organizations with similar goals who we can partner with to build or improve materials for our users.
  • Most importantly: this trip will help Allversity finally land the funding that will make it more effective at distributing materials.

Other Ways You Can Help

We work in non-profit and know that sometimes you just don't have the money. But that is fine, our goal is small and more than anything we need people to spread the word, so:

  • Make some noise about this project and about Allversity: post us to your Facebook or Twitter. 
  • Forward our message to friends or family in an email.
  • And don't forget, you can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

Anything you contribute, whether time, money, or good cheer will help.
